story:
Short Summary

  • I am a Moldavian-born Italian-based concert accordionist interested in Baroque, Classical, Contemporary and Chamber music. Over the 10 years span living abroad I have had the chance  to perform loads of great music with great and talented musicians
  • It has been a long-time dream of mine to record a CD of selected accordion solo works from my repertoire to mark my musical progress up to this point. The second CD with a cocktail of works for accordion and piano marks the first 5 years of existence of Duo Aspera with the Italian pianist Valentina Vargiu
  • By contributing to my campaign you will help me realize this long-time dream, record two unique CDs and set a milestone in my career as a musician

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The amount I am hoping to raise is 4000 Euros which will go into recording, mixing, booklet, promotion and distribution expenses
  • You can choose among numerous rewards for your donations, including CDs, tickets to concerts, dinners, private lessons (also online), private concerts and more!

 

Why should you support the project

  • Recording a CD has been one of my dreams and career goals for some years now, and with your support it will become true very soon. The solo CD will be a showcase of concert works for accordion ranging from Bach’s and Scarlatti’s harpsichord works to original compositions by Zubitsky, Lindberg and others, showing the instrument’s versatility and full potential. Every listener will find something to his/her taste
  • The second CD will feature Duo Aspera, piano and accordion. A combination of the two instruments is seldom heard in concerts, leave alone on CDs, which makes it special and rare. The CD will contain a cocktail of works transcribed from the classical period as well as original works written by today’s composers with a bit of fiery Tango Nuevo.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even 1$/Euro can make a huge difference for me, so even if you choose to donate a small amount feel free to do so
  • Explore my website, YouTube channel, Facebook page and if you like what you see and hear feel free to share it with your friends and contacts
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Short Summary

I am a Moldavian-born Italian-based concert accordionist interested in Baroque, Classical, Contemporary and Chamber music. Over the 10 years span living abroad I have had the chance  to perform loads of great music with great and talented musicians
It has been a long-time dream of mine to record a CD of selected accordion solo works from my repertoire to mark my musical progress up to this point. The second CD with a cocktail of works for accordion and piano marks the first 5 years of existence of Duo Aspera with the Italian pianist Valentina Vargiu
By contributing to my campaign you will help me realize this long-time dream, record two unique CDs and set a milestone in my career as a musician

 

What We Need & What You Get

The amount I am hoping to raise is 4000 Euros which will go into recording, mixing, booklet, promotion and distribution expenses
You can choose among numerous rewards for your donations, including CDs, tickets to concerts, dinners, private lessons (also online), private concerts and more!

 

Why should you support the project

Recording a CD has been one of my dreams and career goals for some years now, and with your support it will become true very soon. The solo CD will be a showcase of concert works for accordion ranging from Bach’s and Scarlatti’s harpsichord works to original compositions by Zubitsky, Lindberg and others, showing the instrument’s versatility and full potential. Every listener will find something to his/her taste
The second CD will feature Duo Aspera, piano and accordion. A combination of the two instruments is seldom heard in concerts, leave alone on CDs, which makes it special and rare. The CD will contain a cocktail of works transcribed from the classical period as well as original works written by today’s composers with a bit of fiery Tango Nuevo.

 
Other Ways You Can Help

Even 1$/Euro can make a huge difference for me, so even if you choose to donate a small amount feel free to do so
Explore my website, YouTube channel, Facebook page and if you like what you see and hear feel free to share it with your friends and contacts
Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
A music REVOLUTION is at hand, & we are excited to be a part of it! With YOUR support, we can independently record & release ROOTS TO REVOLUTIONS, an album unlike anything we've done before! Its essence will open your heart & pull you into the depths of your soul. It will inspire you to reach down into your roots, RISE UP, & BE THE CHANGE!

 

“The highest goal of music is to connect one’s soul to their Divine Nature, not entertainment.”

~Pythagoras (569- 475 BC)

 

Hi, we are Randall and Kristin Brooks of Bhakti House Band, and we want to invite YOU to join us in something life-altering… world-changing… revolutionary…

 

Sunrise 108 Gayatri Meditation workshop, Fort Lauderdale, FL

 

Music Has the Power to Heal and Change the World

 

We believe that music and sacred sound have the power to change and heal the world. And our mission is to share positive, uplifting music that inspires us all to rise above the mundane and joyfully live life to the fullest. Our desire is to create a soundtrack for living a life filled with purpose and passion, and then set the world on fire with love. Our music, filled with love and mantra (Sanskrit for "protective tool for the mind"), sends out positive vibes to work on us at the most subtle levels--especially in calming the sympathetic nervous system, as well as sends a positive message to reprogram our thought and emotional patterns.

 

We all live in a society that tells us that love and kindness are not the norm. We are surrounded by programming from the media, news, politicians, and advertisers all telling us that we are broken in some way.They insist that the world is full of nothing but evil and hate at every turn, that we are doomed, and only they can save us. If we accept these suggestions as truth, then our reality will follow. 

 

But... we are here to challenge all of that.

 

 

Great teachers of the past tell us that "suggestion" is the most powerful force in the universe… that life itself was born through the power of suggestion. 100% of our human behavior is a direct result of suggestion, whether that suggestion comes from ourselves or from our environment.

What you feed grows, and what you feed yourself is what you become.


 

This is especially true regarding music since music has been proven to be one of the fastest and most powerful ways to instill new suggestions or change thought patterns.

 

That's where we come in...

 

 

A little background...


 

Growing up, I (Randall) accepted these type of negative suggestions from my environment, and it led me to a path of turmoil, substance abuse, violence, and aggression in my teens, and the music I listened to reinforced that identity. One night, I was fortunate to hear a song that told me a different story--that I was much more than what I had been living, that I had a purpose and was worthy to live a better life. It broke me down. I listened to that song over and over and over, allowing it to repeat all night while I slept. When I awoke the next morning, my trajectory had completely changed. And then my life changed. It was then that I began to realize the awesome power of music, and I wanted to be a part of that. It soon became my desire to write songs and share music that were inspiring and thought provoking—songs to invite others to stop and think a little more. 

 

Boy Meets Girl

 +  = 

 

Soon after, this boy from the hood met a girl from the west side (Kristin) who grew up surrounded by all types of music from classical to the Beatles, playing piano, writing music, singing in musical theatre productions and choirs as well as various  local bands, and who had even been a music major in college. Though from very different worlds, our voices and our hearts came together so effortlessly, and she shared my passion to share inspiring (and maybe a little controversial) music. So here we are now. We've been singing together for 23 years and married over 21 years. Completely devoted to one another as well as to our dharma (life purpose) and musical mission to spread healing love through song, we have shared our music as Bhakti House Band  (which means the House of Love)  for about 10 years now. 

 

 

The Impact

 

Our country and even our world have seemed to be in an uproar lately, with many left feeling lost and in tremendous fear. United we stand; divided we fall, and our world needs healing more than ever. Music is a universal language that unifies and speaks directly to the heart. Kristin and I have personally experienced the healing power of music and are devoted to paying that forward and creating more music that heals and inspires all of us to live a full and empowered life.

We all deserve to experience love. And when we feel love, we are likely to share more love in service to others while bringing forth our gifts into greater purpose. But no one can do this alone. We are ALL here to support one another. That's why this project is so important... The more people we can reach and inspire with our music, the more people that could be inspired to heal their wounds. And when we free ourselves (and others) from our wounds, our hearts open, we feel connected to the world around us, and move with more compassion and wisdom. IMAGINE a world where LOVE and KINDNESS motivate us rather than fear; a world working in harmony to uplift and EMPOWER everyone. Welcome to the vision of Bhakti House Band music!

 

 

On top of all our music's healing power, proceeds from ALL our music efforts go to support impoverished children around the world with food, education, and medical care through our Peace Love OM Project.

 

This NEW ALBUM (releasing December 21, 2018)...

 


Holi Festival of Colors, 2016

 

This Indiegogo campaign is to create a new album, which will draw from our roots like never before. We will be integrating everything from old gospel and church hymns to rap and hip hop to tibetan bowls, beloved classical sanskrit mantras, and kirtan. We combine western and eastern instrumentation and rich  harmonies, all driven by a powerful combination of drums and percussion from different cultures all over the world. These various healing musical influences represent seeds of our musical past that have brought us to THIS present moment. As we integrate our experiences and expand our world view, the music we create continues to evolve to reach out to a broader audience. 

 

Bhakti Fest Joshua Tree, CA 2015

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We have amazing perks and gifts in exchange for your support! So as to keep the stress down of whether or not we meet our financial goals on time here and be able to receive funds for the project and meet our deadlines, we have divided the project into several phases, and had set the initial phase goal at $5400 and SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED PHASE 1 in time to reach InDemand status! BUT it will actually take about 5 times that to create the ideal campaign and be able to do everything we hope to do with this album. We have recorded most of the album music thanks to the funds from phase 1 and are ready to complete PHASE 2 so we can begin some of the the mixing and mastering!

 

Phase 1: production/recording studio fees: $5400... COMPLETE! YAY!

Phase 2: mixing and mastering fees: $5400 for a total of $10,800 (in progress...)

Phase 3: artwork design, cd production, and printing 

Phase 4: perk product fulfillment, shipping, and campaign fees; tour expenses 

Phase 5: marketing and promotional campaign 

ABOVE & BEYOND... once we fund all 5 phases, anything above and beyond will go to boost us to the next level in taking our message around the world to a broader audience, uniting humanity, and sharing love.

 

Risks & Challenges

There's a new genre of music forging its way across the globe... a music revolution, if you will! And it's inspiring humanity, continually calling forth more love, more authenticity, and more empowerment in our LIVES! The only risk here is buying into a world of negativity and then standing alone, immobilized, watching life pass you by from the sidelines. Instead, why not buy into the power and possibility of love and then help us to spread that love, kindness, healing, and inspiration through uplifting music by giving to this project. We choose the latter, and you can count on us to see this project through to the finish. We don't give up until we're done. We have completed 4 other albums prior and have gathered supporting fans now in more than 79 countries, so we are confident that we can count on YOU to help us achieve this dream! Join the revolution! 

 

Holi Festival of Colors, 2016

 

Ways You Can Help

 

1. Contribute to our campaign and receive an AWESOME PERK in return! 

2. Share our campaign on your social media pages every few days

3. Send personal messages (text, email, facebook, etc) to friends who are ready to stand up in love!

 

We understand that times can be tough, and though you may believe strongly in our project, you feel you can't contribute financially right now. AHO! Remember that there is a way you can help us tremendously by helping us get the word out:

1. share our campaign on your social media pages using the Indiegogo Share Tools

2. personally share with friends you feel could always use a boost in life (aka: everyone!)

 

WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU! THANK YOU! LOVE!

 

Thank you so much for your love and support! We value it more than words could ever convey! 

 

May the Blessings Be,

Randall & Kristin

story:
Hi, I’m zSeven,

Thank you for stopping by :)
 

This is my rebirth as a pop singer, and I am super excited to be sharing this new adventure with you.

I had been a professional R&B singer all my life, in my hometown of Cleveland and later in New York City, until cancer brought me down, twice.

The second time, I felt really broken and I was close to resigning. But one lady’s incredible energy kicked me out of bed and got me going again. Her name is Robin Roberts, the abc anchor and host of “Good Morning America”. She was going through the same ordeal and yet her positivity was incredible and infectious… I can never thank her enough for the gift she gave me.

Today, I'm 4 years cancer-free and it's my turn to give back. I am a different person. I am a different artist. I want to touch as many lives as possible with my music. 'TODAY' is the first pop song that I wrote and recorded with the top music producer Chris Griffin, in NYC. This is for everyone who is going through a challenge in their life right now. This song gives you that extra energy that helps you not give up, ever: "Nothing can bring you down, I'm walking in the air..."

 

I was able to get this far, but now I need YOUR help to bring this vision to life!

  • I want to shoot a music video for the lead-song 'TODAY' to spread its message of positivity and its uplifting energy. I want everyone to have it on their phone when things gets shaky and you need a little kick to keep going with a smile ;)
  • I also want to complete the production of my mini-album and record 2 new songs that I wrote, called “Rose of Sharon” and “Jump across the Heaven”, also with Chris Griffin, whose incredible talent I am blessed to have attracted.

To achieve that, I need to raise $15,000.

I invite you to watch my and Chris' video. I hope you’ll get as excited as I am and want to be a part of this project. 

We have worked out incredible perks for you to participate.
  • ‘Executive Producers’: attend the recording session with Chris Griffin in NYC
  • ‘Co-Producers’: get live-streaming access to the recording (twice/day)
  • 'Insiders': receive a customized behind-the-scenes video of the recording video
  • ‘Sponsors’: donate freely to 'just support/no perks needed'. All the money raised goes into the album production.
  • ‘Fans’: chat with me on a private Skype call; make it whatever you want it to be!
  • 'Supporters': order a pre-release CD or a download of the album, the link to the first song 'TODAY', and some beautiful branded items...

I thank you all in advance for your support and generosity. There is no support too small. Every bit makes a difference.

I can’t wait to hear from you and get started on this journey with you by my side. I will be updating you on our progress here regularly. Please stay tuned!

Last but not least, I wanted to introduce my power-team:

Chris Griffin: A-list multi-faceted music producer and sound engineer (Madonna, John Legend, Janet Jackson, John Mc Laughlin...)

Alex Vachon: Passionate film-maker who produced our videos (cartouchecreations.com)

Veronique Gautier: My friend, who believes in me and has been supporting this project day-in and day-out.

Feeling blessed :)

Let's get started!

-zSeven

story:
[español]

ACERCA DE MÍ

Mi nombre es Camila Pérez y nací en Guayaquil, Ecuador. La música ha estado en mi sangre desde que nací, y se convirtió en mi pasión a los 3 años cuando comencé a cantar, en mi refugio a los 12 años cuando comencé a componer, y oficialmente en mi profesión a los 18 años cuando la escogí como carrera.

A lo largo de todos estos años de estudio, he acumulado experiencias, aprendizajes y nuevas perspectivas que me han llevado a evolucionar, a encontrar mi propia voz, y finalmente a definir mi identidad y mi propósito como artista y como persona. Hoy mi música no busca impresionar, exhibir, o demostrar virtuosismo. Lo que busca es conmover, inspirar, invitarte a sentir y conectarte, a cuestionarte y reinventarte. Busca ofrecer una visión auténtica de la vida en la que el reconocimiento de tus errores y defectos son medallas de valentía. 

Fue aquí en Barcelona donde mis composiciones tomaron forma y vida propia en manos de algunos de los músicos más increíbles que he tenido el orgullo de conocer, y hoy pienso cumplir mi sueño de grabar mi primer álbum como cantautora con estos artistas de primera en esta maravillosa ciudad. Y para lograrlo, necesito de tu ayuda financiera. 

Este proyecto es importante para mí no solamente porque marca un nuevo comienzo en mi carrera musical, sino porque me llena de ilusión y orgullo el poder contribuir al desarrollo cultural y artístico de mi país. Aspiro a convertirme en una de las voces que representen todo lo que mi tierra tiene para ofrecer; la calidez de su gente, la riqueza de su cultura, y el orgullo que sentimos de ser ecuatorianos ‒ y este es el primer paso. Es momento de llegar más lejos, darnos a conocer, y alcanzar nuevas metas... juntos.

Quiero agradecer de antemano a todas las personas que decidan formar parte de esta campaña, y todas aquellas que visiten esta página, compartan, y me apoyen a mí y a mi música de cualquier manera que les sea posible. ¡Gracias infinitas!

LO QUE NECESITO

Como habrán notado, la meta de esta campaña es de $12,000 que serán destinados a:

  • Estudio de grabación
  • Honorarios de los músicos
  • Mezcla y masterización
  • Arte gráfico (fotografía y diseño de la portada)
  • Impresión del disco
  • Costos de distribución
  • Costos de promoción

Sin embargo, es importante mencionar que, como toda plataforma de crowdfunding, Indiegogo se quedará con un porcentaje de los fondos recaudados, incluso si alcanzamos la meta o no. Por este motivo, lo ideal es sobrepasar la meta proyectada (lo cual es permitido e incentivado), y todo el dinero "extra" recaudado también formará parte de la producción del disco, particularmente para impulsar las estrategias de promoción y cubrir sus respectivos gastos.

LO QUE OBTENDRÁS

Lo que más me gusta de Indiegogo es que me permite ofrecerte algo a cambio por tu ayuda, y dependiendo de la cantidad que contribuyas, puedes obtener una gran variedad de recompensas que he preparado con muchísimo cariño para todos ustedes, como por ejemplo:

  • Una copia del disco físico firmado y con dedicatoria personalizada.
  • Kits con la línea gráfica del disco y regalos personalizados como las letras escritas a mano, pintadas por mí, y enmarcadas.
  • Clases de canto (presenciales o vía Skype)
  • Conciertos privados.
  • Y (mi favorita) una canción hecha por mí para ti o para alguien que amas a base de alguna historia, escrito, poema, o idea tuya que quisieras musicalizar.

Recuerda que también, si lo prefieres, puedes contribuir con una donación sin recibir una recompensa a cambio de ella.

RIESGOS Y RETOS

Al igual que todo proyecto, llevar a cabo esta iniciativa supone algunos riesgos:

  • Como les decía, Indiegogo se quedará con un porcentaje de los fondos recaudados alcancemos la meta o no, y por eso es importante apuntar a sobrepasar la meta proyectada.
  • El disco será promovido inicialmente en Ecuador, y por este motivo algunas de las recompensas no están disponibles en todos los países. Es necesario revisar todas las condiciones detalladas en cada una de las recompensas antes de realizar la compra de alguna de ellas.
  • Otras recompensas pueden viajar por el mundo para que puedas recibirlas en la puerta de tu casa, pero para ese propósito me es necesario agregar los costos de envío. Este costo puede variar dependiendo del lugar en el que estés.
  • Las fechas de entrega de las recompensas son estimadas. Garantizo el 100% de sus entregas pero es importante considerar que, aún trabajando de manera eficiente y medida, esto es un proceso, y el disco y las recompensas tomarán un tiempo antes de estar materializadas en su totalidad.

OTRAS MANERAS DE AYUDAR

Agradezco infinitamente todas las donaciones, pero si no puedes contribuir con un aporte financiero, también puedes ayudar muchísimo sólo con un poquito de tu tiempo:

  • Viendo, dando like, y compartiendo el video de la campaña con la mayor cantidad de gente posible.
  • Pasando la voz de esta iniciativa, e impulsando a otros a aportar con su granito de arena.

Muchísimas gracias a todos los que han pasado por aquí por su ayuda, su interés, su confianza en mí, y todo su apoyo. ¡Prometo que este es sólo el comienzo!

Con amor,

Camila. 

Facebook: @camilaperezmusic

Instagram: @camilaperezmusic

Twitter: @camilaperezec

[inglés]

ABOUT ME

My name is Camila Pérez and I'm from Guayaquil, Ecuador. Music has been in my blood since I was born, and it became my passion when I was 3 years old when I started singing, my refuge when I was 12 when I started to write songs, and officially my profession when I was 18 when I chose it as a career.

Throughout all these years of study, I have accumulated experiences, life lessons and new perspectives that have led me to evolve, to find my own voice, and finally to define my identity and my purpose as an artist and as a person. Today, my music does not seek to impress, exhibit, or demonstrate virtuosity. It seeks is to move, inspire, invite you to feel and connect, to question and reinvent yourself. It seeks to offer an authentic vision of life, in which the admission of your mistakes and flaws are medals of courage.

It was here in Barcelona where my compositions took shape and came to life in the hands of some of the most incredible musicians I've had the honor to know and work with, and today I plan to fulfill my dream of recording my first album as a singer-songwriter with these first-class artists in this wonderful city. And to make it happen, I need your financial help.

This project is important to me not only because it marks a new beginning in my musical career, but because it fills me with excitement and pride to be able to contribute to the cultural and artistic development of my country. I aspire to become one of the voices that represent everything my country has to offer; the warmth of its people, the richness of its culture, and the pride of being Ecuadorian ‒ and this is the first step. It's time to go further, to make ourselves known to the world, and reach new goals... together.

I want to thank in advance all the people who decide to be part of this campaign, and all those who visit this page, share, and support me and my music in any way possible. Infinite thanks!

WHAT I NEED

As you may have noticed, the goal of this campaign is $12,000, which will be destined to:

  • Recording studio
  • Musicians' fees
  • Mixing and mastering
  • CD cover artwork and photographer 
  • CD replication
  • Distribution costs
  • Promotion expenses

However, it is important to mention that, like any crowdfunding platform, Indiegogo will keep a percentage of the funds raised, whether the goal is reached or not. For this reason, it's best aiming to exceed the projected goal (which is allowed and encouraged), and all the "extra" money collected will also be destined to the production and post-production of the album, particularly to fuel the promotion strategies and cover its costs.

WHAT YOU GET

What I like most about Indiegogo is that it allows me to give you something in return for your help, and depending on the amount you contribute, you can pick among a variety of perks that I have prepared for all of you with lots of love, such as:

  • A signed hard copy of the album, and with a personalized note just for you.
  • Tote-bag kits with the album's design and filled with personalized gifts such as handwritten lyrics, painted by me, and framed.
  • Singing lessons (face-to-face or via Skype)
  • Private concerts.
  • And (my favorite) a song written by me for you, or for someone you love, based on a story, poem, or idea of ​​yours that you would like to turn into music.

Remember that, if you prefer it, you can also contribute with donations without claiming a perk in exchange for them.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Like any project, carrying out this initiative involves some risks:

  • As I was saying, Indiegogo will keep a percentage of the funds raised whether we reach the goal or not, and that is why it is important to aim to surpass the projected goal.
  • The album will be promoted initially in Ecuador, and for this reason some of the perks are not available in all countries. It is necessary to review all the conditions detailed in each of the perks before purchasing of any of them.
  • Other perk items can travel around the world so you can receive them at your door, but for that purpose I need to add shipping costs. This cost may vary depending on where you are purchasing it from.
  • The dates of delivery of the rewards are estimated. I guarantee 100% of the deliveries but it is important to consider that, even working in an efficient and time-measured way, this is a meticulous process, and the album and its perks will take some time before being fully materialized.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

I am infinitely grateful for all the donations, but if you can't make a financial contribution, you can also help a lot with just a little bit of your time:

  • Watching, liking, and sharing the campaign video with as many people as possible. 
  • Spreading the voice about this campaign, and encouraging others to contribute with their grain of sand.

Thank you so much to all the people reading this for your help, your interest, your faith in me, and all of your support. I promise this is just the beginning!

With love,

Camila.

Facebook: @camilaperezmusic

Instagram: @camilaperezmusic

Twitter: @camilaperezec

[español]
ACERCA DE MÍ
Mi nombre es Camila Pérez y nací en Guayaquil, Ecuador. La música ha estado en mi sangre desde que nací, y se convirtió en mi pasión a los 3 años cuando comencé a cantar, en mi refugio a los 12 años cuando comencé a componer, y oficialmente en mi profesión a los 18 años cuando la escogí como carrera.
A lo largo de todos estos años de estudio, he acumulado experiencias, aprendizajes y nuevas perspectivas que me han llevado a evolucionar, a encontrar mi propia voz, y finalmente a definir mi identidad y mi propósito como artista y como persona. Hoy mi música no busca impresionar, exhibir, o demostrar virtuosismo. Lo que busca es conmover, inspirar, invitarte a sentir y conectarte, a cuestionarte y reinventarte. Busca ofrecer una visión auténtica de la vida en la que el reconocimiento de tus errores y defectos son medallas de valentía. 
Fue aquí en Barcelona donde mis composiciones tomaron forma y vida propia en manos de algunos de los músicos más increíbles que he tenido el orgullo de conocer, y hoy pienso cumplir mi sueño de grabar mi primer álbum como cantautora con estos artistas de primera en esta maravillosa ciudad. Y para lograrlo, necesito de tu ayuda financiera. 
Este proyecto es importante para mí no solamente porque marca un nuevo comienzo en mi carrera musical, sino porque me llena de ilusión y orgullo el poder contribuir al desarrollo cultural y artístico de mi país. Aspiro a convertirme en una de las voces que representen todo lo que mi tierra tiene para ofrecer; la calidez de su gente, la riqueza de su cultura, y el orgullo que sentimos de ser ecuatorianos ‒ y este es el primer paso. Es momento de llegar más lejos, darnos a conocer, y alcanzar nuevas metas... juntos.
Quiero agradecer de antemano a todas las personas que decidan formar parte de esta campaña, y todas aquellas que visiten esta página, compartan, y me apoyen a mí y a mi música de cualquier manera que les sea posible. ¡Gracias infinitas!

Como habrán notado, la meta de esta campaña es de $12,000 que serán destinados a:

Clases de canto (presenciales o vía Skype)
Conciertos privados.
Y (mi favorita) una canción hecha por mí para ti o para alguien que amas a base de alguna historia, escrito, poema, o idea tuya que quisieras musicalizar.

Recuerda que también, si lo prefieres, puedes contribuir con una donación sin recibir una recompensa a cambio de ella.
RIESGOS Y RETOS
Al igual que todo proyecto, llevar a cabo esta iniciativa supone algunos riesgos:

Como les decía, Indiegogo se quedará con un porcentaje de los fondos recaudados alcancemos la meta o no, y por eso es importante apuntar a sobrepasar la meta proyectada.
El disco será promovido inicialmente en Ecuador, y por este motivo algunas de las recompensas no están disponibles en todos los países. Es necesario revisar todas las condiciones detalladas en cada una de las recompensas antes de realizar la compra de alguna de ellas.
Otras recompensas pueden viajar por el mundo para que puedas recibirlas en la puerta de tu casa, pero para ese propósito me es necesario agregar los costos de envío. Este costo puede variar dependiendo del lugar en el que estés.
Las fechas de entrega de las recompensas son estimadas. Garantizo el 100% de sus entregas pero es importante considerar que, aún trabajando de manera eficiente y medida, esto es un proceso, y el disco y las recompensas tomarán un tiempo antes de estar materializadas en su totalidad.

OTRAS MANERAS DE AYUDAR
Agradezco infinitamente todas las donaciones, pero si no puedes contribuir con un aporte financiero, también puedes ayudar muchísimo sólo con un poquito de tu tiempo:

Viendo, dando like, y compartiendo el video de la campaña con la mayor cantidad de gente posible.
Pasando la voz de esta iniciativa, e impulsando a otros a aportar con su granito de arena.

Muchísimas gracias a todos los que han pasado por aquí por su ayuda, su interés, su confianza en mí, y todo su apoyo. ¡Prometo que este es sólo el comienzo!
Con amor,
Camila.

story:
Power to the Purple, Purple Foxers!

I'm Purple Fox Josh, and I have a little story to tell you about how this all came about.  It was in 2014 that I realized what I needed to do.  While I was attending a music conference in LA, pitching some of my pop songs to artists and producers, I realized I wanted to combine my family with my music, and that was the birth of Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies.  Purple, my daughter's favorite color, and Fox, my son's favorite animal.  

And when I started walking my son to kindergarten every morning, I grabbed the ukulele as we headed out the door and...  we began writing songs together, he has the main vocals on one of the songs on this album, "Forever Everyday."

I released our first album "My Purple Fox" in 2017, to rave reviews, with radio, newspaper interviews, and lots of concerts.  Side note, the live band has a long list of gigs this summer, and thanks to you, we will have our 2nd CD ready for you to get your groove on!

Wanting to get our music on TV, I created a TV show for kids.  Afternoon Snack Episode #1 won the national Hometown Media Award for Best Children's Program by an Independent Producer for 2017.

We have a wide variety of Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies merchandise available in our rewards section, something exciting for everyone from albums to concerts to guitar lessons. 

I have had 2 successful Kickstarter campaigns in the past.  The first one, enabled me to work with producer/music supervisor Marcus Barone, which landed my music in Film and TV.  

The 2nd successful campaign, kickstarted the funding of the first album, "My Purple Fox."  It raised enough for me to produce the album by myself, hiring musicians, and pressing the CDs.  But I invested quite a bit of my own money as well.

This 3rd campaign will help us achieve our goal, to win Best Children's Album for the upcoming 61st Grammy Awards.  Or at least get nominated.  ;0)

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Below I will show you how much we need for all our projects this summer....1) production of the album "The Something of Love" 2) taking the band to Nashville for CDBaby's DIY Music Conference in August 3) production of the next episodes of Afternoon Snack 4) Printing the 2nd edition of our children's book...
    • How much it will be total to make this 11+ song album "The Something of Love", and be able to offer CDs at our live shows.... $9,000.  Not bad!  I'm doing all the production myself, and recording many of the different parts.  But there are certain parts that I need to go outside of my studio to get.  Tiny Telephone studio - 2 days with the audio engineer, hiring the musicians: Kristen Cardiasmenos on guitar, Brett Warren on bass, Justin Markovits on drums. Then, at my home studio I will record Janelle LaSalle on vocals, Lucie Duffort on vocals, Luke Kirley on trombone and tuba.  On location I will record Clay Bandy on drums, Max Cowan on organ, Kenny Schick on saxophones, Nic Roozeboom, Jim Mallonee, and Paul Strong on sonic atmospheres, then back home adding my talented family, wife Jessica Morgan on trumpet, and kids Jude and Jozy on vocals. (Luckily my wife and kids don't charge much). Mastering and pressing vinyl via Second Line Vinyl in San Francisco.  Add on CD manufacturing locally at New Cyberian Systems in San Jose.  I love having such local high quality services, no need for shipping.
    • Taking the band to Nashville for CDBaby's DIY Music Conference will initially cost $3,000, for air fare, hotel, food, transportation, conference tickets, and equipment rental.  We are trying to line up as many gigs as possible to offset the costs, lots of interest, but nothing confirmed yet.  There are 4 different opportunities to perform at the conference, and we have a long list of venues we have contacted in and around Nashville, from pre-schools to camps to clubs.
    • The cost of producing Afternoon Snack are mostly in the art supplies, as I already have the computer, cameras, and software needed.  But it adds up, from clay to construction paper to fabric and tie-dying, for the last 2 episodes, we spent about $2,000.  The TV studio portion of the show has been filmed, with an amazing crew of volunteers, and the amount to rent the studio was a steal at $500 + the $150 for feeding the 30 volunteers, but I have personally about 300 hours of video production time to invest to get the final outcome!  
    • Printing the 2nd edition of Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies children's book will be a total of $1,500.  I am doing the layout myself.  Illustrations by Patrick McCauley, and my mom Barbara Friedman did the watercolor.
  • ​Okay, I totally understand the thought process of wanting to get a reward for contributing money. That is why I have offered, discounted from the retail price, some really fun rewards:
    • Of course, the digital download of the album that we are creating!  Reggae, Progressive, Funk, Ska, Pop, with a touch more Reggae on this album.  No need to have an allergic reaction to the brand of Children's Music, it really is just good music with good clean intentions for all ages.  It will be done in July, it has to be, as it is the deadline for releases to be eligible for the upcoming 61st Grammy Awards.  Here are the track names so far, but you might understand, there might be some last minute changes, and definitely some added funness:
      • The Something of Love
      • Perfect Day
      • Forever Everyday
      • We Got it (Our Time Together)
      • Please
      • Thank You
      • You're Welcome
      • Sharing is Caring
      • Sorry
      • S'Alright
      • I Love You Infinity (For the Possibilities)
    • I still have a CD player in my car, and some of the most important albums to me, I listen to on CD, even though I also listen on Apple Music... So, of course, The Something of Love on CD is one of the perks for this campaign.  You get one, you get them both, a signed copy of My Purple Fox CD is just the right pairing.  Delish!
    • I have been playing guitar for 20+ years, and have tried countless amounts of picks.  But I play best with the one with an illustration of a Hippogriff designed by Benjamin Henderson.  In 7 different colors including Clown Barf and Glow in the Dark.
    • I have written a ton of music, having a Masters in Music Composition from UC Santa Cruz.  My best sellers are my guitar studies.  I have 3 books:
      • Josh's Monster Pack is the easiest of the 3, plus it has cool illustrations for each of the monsters, done by Benjamin Henderson. 
      • Josh's Flash Pack was my first collection I wrote, and although they are super cool pieces, they didn't turn out as easy as I had planned for.  The Flash Pack I have recorded on CD. 
      • Josh's Polyjuice Pack, difficult, crazy polyrhythmic mayhem.  They are the coolest guitar studies I have written, but they are not for the faint at fingering.  You better have some chops to pull these off.  Or you can just get it for the fun illustrated cover, also illustrated by Benjamin Henderson.
    • Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies stickers - illustrated by Patrick McCauley, watercolor by Barbara Friedman, tie-dye by Jozy, layout by me.  Also the cover art for My Purple Fox.
    • Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies one of a kind personally Tie-Dyed shirt, each one unique (Kid's, Women's, Unisex) sizes ((3T, 5T, 6-8, 8-10, 10-12, Small, Medium, Large, X-Large, XX-Large)
    • Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies Coloring Book, illustrations by Patrick McCauley, layout by me.
    • signed copy of our first album Poster "My Purple Fox"
    • Josh Friedman guitar shirt, illustrated by Benjamin Henderson, Size (Small, Medium, Large, X-Large, XX-Large)
    • 2 - Half Hour Lessons, for the new students, I have availability to teach during the summer, and I have a couple of students that are graduating high school and going off to college, so there will be a couple spots available in the Fall.  I give personalized private lessons in a range of genres and instruments, all ages (4 or older), all levels.  Got my degrees in Music Composition, Guitar Performance, and Electronic Music, and my main instruments right now are ukulele and voice.  Learn for fun, or for exam prep.  Rock, Pop, Blues, Classical, Jazz....
    • How would you like for me to write a 1-2 minute Original Solo Guitar Piece for you?  Yes, that is one of the rewards offered.  I have written numerous pieces for students, and if I write a piece for you, it might just end up in my next book of guitar tunes.  
    • One of the most unique, special gifts you can give to someone, is a Personalized Song.  Birthday, Valentines Day, Graduation, a personalized song can be just the right touch for telling someone how much they mean to you.  limit 2-3 minutes, lyrics and music, a digital recording will be made.
    • Personal 2 hour Concert (with 15 minute break) of Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies, 4-6 piece band, additional fee for travel expenses if beyond 50 miles of Sunnyvale, CA. We can provide the sound equipment, but we will need an outlet within 100ft.
    • Music Box from the Album!
  • Hopefully we reach at least $9,000!  This is our first goal, although if we don't reach at least $8,000, I won't be including the pressing of the vinyl through this campaign..  This will enable us to pay for the making of the album.  From $9,000 - $15,000, the funds will be spread between our next goals, 1) Nashville tour and CDBaby DIY music conference ($3,000), 2) Afternoon Snack TV show production ($2,500) 3) Printing the 2nd edition of our children's book ($1,500)

The Impact

We are making good quality music and entertainment, that is appropriate for all ages.  Plus, an important message.  We are creating something unique, and something that is bound for success.  And with my track record, your contribution will help us achieve above and beyond our goals.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for me is time.  I am doing so much for this band, that I need to be as efficient as I can with my time.  Yes, it saves money, but it also keeps everything high quality, as this is my band, I am the quality control.  I know how much time I have in my schedule to dedicate to the band.  Although I could complete this much faster with more hired hands, I stay true to my realistic goals.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways that you can help if you cannot contribute financially.

 1) Share this campaign on your social media.  Here are our main ones:

http://www.youtube.com/mypurplefox

http://www.facebook.com/mypurplefox

http://www.instagram.com/mypurplefox

http://www.twitter.com/mypurplefox

http://www.mypurplefox.com

https://store.cdbaby.com/Artist/PurpleFoxandthe...

(we are on iTunes/Apple Music, Spotify, Pandora, Amazon....)

 

 2) Contribute your time!  If you want to join our team, there is lots to do!  I can always use someone at our live gigs to help with the merchandise table, email list, or even taking pictures and video.  Or if you are interested in doing film production and stop motion animation, I have a ton to do for the next Afternoon Snack episodes!  Or, if you would like to record some hand claps or triangle hits, that could be arranged as well....
story_txt:
Power to the Purple, Purple Foxers!
I'm Purple Fox Josh, and I have a little story to tell you about how this all came about.  It was in 2014 that I realized what I needed to do.  While I was attending a music conference in LA, pitching some of my pop songs to artists and producers, I realized I wanted to combine my family with my music, and that was the birth of Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies.  Purple, my daughter's favorite color, and Fox, my son's favorite animal.  
And when I started walking my son to kindergarten every morning, I grabbed the ukulele as we headed out the door and...  we began writing songs together, he has the main vocals on one of the songs on this album, "Forever Everyday."
I released our first album "My Purple Fox" in 2017, to rave reviews, with radio, newspaper interviews, and lots of concerts.  Side note, the live band has a long list of gigs this summer, and thanks to you, we will have our 2nd CD ready for you to get your groove on!
Wanting to get our music on TV, I created a TV show for kids.  Afternoon Snack Episode #1 won the national Hometown Media Award for Best Children's Program by an Independent Producer for 2017.
We have a wide variety of Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies merchandise available in our rewards section, something exciting for everyone from albums to concerts to guitar lessons. 
I have had 2 successful Kickstarter campaigns in the past.  The first one, enabled me to work with producer/music supervisor Marcus Barone, which landed my music in Film and TV.  
The 2nd successful campaign, kickstarted the funding of the first album, "My Purple Fox."  It raised enough for me to produce the album by myself, hiring musicians, and pressing the CDs.  But I invested quite a bit of my own money as well.
This 3rd campaign will help us achieve our goal, to win Best Children's Album for the upcoming 61st Grammy Awards.  Or at least get nominated.  ;0)
 

What We Need & What You Get

Below I will show you how much we need for all our projects this summer....1) production of the album "The Something of Love" 2) taking the band to Nashville for CDBaby's DIY Music Conference in August 3) production of the next episodes of Afternoon Snack 4) Printing the 2nd edition of our children's book...

How much it will be total to make this 11+ song album "The Something of Love", and be able to offer CDs at our live shows.... $9,000.  Not bad!  I'm doing all the production myself, and recording many of the different parts.  But there are certain parts that I need to go outside of my studio to get.  Tiny Telephone studio - 2 days with the audio engineer, hiring the musicians: Kristen Cardiasmenos on guitar, Brett Warren on bass, Justin Markovits on drums. Then, at my home studio I will record Janelle LaSalle on vocals, Lucie Duffort on vocals, Luke Kirley on trombone and tuba.  On location I will record Clay Bandy on drums, Max Cowan on organ, Kenny Schick on saxophones, Nic Roozeboom, Jim Mallonee, and Paul Strong on sonic atmospheres, then back home adding my talented family, wife Jessica Morgan on trumpet, and kids Jude and Jozy on vocals. (Luckily my wife and kids don't charge much). Mastering and pressing vinyl via Second Line Vinyl in San Francisco.  Add on CD manufacturing locally at New Cyberian Systems in San Jose.  I love having such local high quality services, no need for shipping. 

Taking the band to Nashville for CDBaby's DIY Music Conference will initially cost $3,000, for air fare, hotel, food, transportation, conference tickets, and equipment rental.  We are trying to line up as many gigs as possible to offset the costs, lots of interest, but nothing confirmed yet.  There are 4 different opportunities to perform at the conference, and we have a long list of venues we have contacted in and around Nashville, from pre-schools to camps to clubs.
The cost of producing Afternoon Snack are mostly in the art supplies, as I already have the computer, cameras, and software needed.  But it adds up, from clay to construction paper to fabric and tie-dying, for the last 2 episodes, we spent about $2,000.  The TV studio portion of the show has been filmed, with an amazing crew of volunteers, and the amount to rent the studio was a steal at $500 + the $150 for feeding the 30 volunteers, but I have personally about 300 hours of video production time to invest to get the final outcome!  
Printing the 2nd edition of Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies children's book will be a total of $1,500.  I am doing the layout myself.  Illustrations by Patrick McCauley, and my mom Barbara Friedman did the watercolor.


​Okay, I totally understand the thought process of wanting to get a reward for contributing money. That is why I have offered, discounted from the retail price, some really fun rewards:

Of course, the digital download of the album that we are creating!  Reggae, Progressive, Funk, Ska, Pop, with a touch more Reggae on this album.  No need to have an allergic reaction to the brand of Children's Music, it really is just good music with good clean intentions for all ages.  It will be done in July, it has to be, as it is the deadline for releases to be eligible for the upcoming 61st Grammy Awards.  Here are the track names so far, but you might understand, there might be some last minute changes, and definitely some added funness:
The Something of Love
Perfect Day
Forever Everyday
We Got it (Our Time Together)
Please
Thank You
You're Welcome
Sharing is Caring
Sorry
S'Alright
I Love You Infinity (For the Possibilities)


I still have a CD player in my car, and some of the most important albums to me, I listen to on CD, even though I also listen on Apple Music... So, of course, The Something of Love on CD is one of the perks for this campaign.  You get one, you get them both, a signed copy of My Purple Fox CD is just the right pairing.  Delish!
I have been playing guitar for 20+ years, and have tried countless amounts of picks.  But I play best with the one with an illustration of a Hippogriff designed by Benjamin Henderson.  In 7 different colors including Clown Barf and Glow in the Dark.
I have written a ton of music, having a Masters in Music Composition from UC Santa Cruz.  My best sellers are my guitar studies.  I have 3 books:
Josh's Monster Pack is the easiest of the 3, plus it has cool illustrations for each of the monsters, done by Benjamin Henderson. 
Josh's Flash Pack was my first collection I wrote, and although they are super cool pieces, they didn't turn out as easy as I had planned for.  The Flash Pack I have recorded on CD. 
Josh's Polyjuice Pack, difficult, crazy polyrhythmic mayhem.  They are the coolest guitar studies I have written, but they are not for the faint at fingering.  You better have some chops to pull these off.  Or you can just get it for the fun illustrated cover, also illustrated by Benjamin Henderson.


Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies stickers - illustrated by Patrick McCauley, watercolor by Barbara Friedman, tie-dye by Jozy, layout by me.  Also the cover art for My Purple Fox.
Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies one of a kind personally Tie-Dyed shirt, each one unique (Kid's, Women's, Unisex) sizes ((3T, 5T, 6-8, 8-10, 10-12, Small, Medium, Large, X-Large, XX-Large)
Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies Coloring Book, illustrations by Patrick McCauley, layout by me.
signed copy of our first album Poster "My Purple Fox"
Josh Friedman guitar shirt, illustrated by Benjamin Henderson, Size (Small, Medium, Large, X-Large, XX-Large)
2 - Half Hour Lessons, for the new students, I have availability to teach during the summer, and I have a couple of students that are graduating high school and going off to college, so there will be a couple spots available in the Fall.  I give personalized private lessons in a range of genres and instruments, all ages (4 or older), all levels.  Got my degrees in Music Composition, Guitar Performance, and Electronic Music, and my main instruments right now are ukulele and voice.  Learn for fun, or for exam prep.  Rock, Pop, Blues, Classical, Jazz....
How would you like for me to write a 1-2 minute Original Solo Guitar Piece for you?  Yes, that is one of the rewards offered.  I have written numerous pieces for students, and if I write a piece for you, it might just end up in my next book of guitar tunes.  

One of the most unique, special gifts you can give to someone, is a Personalized Song.  Birthday, Valentines Day, Graduation, a personalized song can be just the right touch for telling someone how much they mean to you.  limit 2-3 minutes, lyrics and music, a digital recording will be made.

Personal 2 hour Concert (with 15 minute break) of Purple Fox and the Heebie Jeebies, 4-6 piece band, additional fee for travel expenses if beyond 50 miles of Sunnyvale, CA. We can provide the sound equipment, but we will need an outlet within 100ft.
Music Box from the Album!


Hopefully we reach at least $9,000!  This is our first goal, although if we don't reach at least $8,000, I won't be including the pressing of the vinyl through this campaign..  This will enable us to pay for the making of the album.  From $9,000 - $15,000, the funds will be spread between our next goals, 1) Nashville tour and CDBaby DIY music conference ($3,000), 2) Afternoon Snack TV show production ($2,500) 3) Printing the 2nd edition of our children's book ($1,500)


The Impact
We are making good quality music and entertainment, that is appropriate for all ages.  Plus, an important message.  We are creating something unique, and something that is bound for success.  And with my track record, your contribution will help us achieve above and beyond our goals.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge for me is time.  I am doing so much for this band, that I need to be as efficient as I can with my time.  Yes, it saves money, but it also keeps everything high quality, as this is my band, I am the quality control.  I know how much time I have in my schedule to dedicate to the band.  Although I could complete this much faster with more hired hands, I stay true to my realistic goals.

Other Ways You Can Help
There are other ways that you can help if you cannot contribute financially.
 1) Share this campaign on your social media.  Here are our main ones:
http://www.youtube.com/mypurplefox
http://www.facebook.com/mypurplefox
http://www.instagram.com/mypurplefox
http://www.twitter.com/mypurplefox
http://www.mypurplefox.com
https://store.cdbaby.com/Artist/PurpleFoxandthe...
(we are on iTunes/Apple Music, Spotify, Pandora, Amazon....)
 
 2) Contribute your time!  If you want to join our team, there is lots to do!  I can always use someone at our live gigs to help with the merchandise table, email list, or even taking pictures and video.  Or if you are interested in doing film production and stop motion animation, I have a ton to do for the next Afternoon Snack episodes!  Or, if you would like to record some hand claps or triangle hits, that could be arranged as well....

story:
WHO AM I?

I’m an Egyptian/Canadian oud player/guitarist originally from Cairo, now based in Montreal. Music is my biggest passion in life, and playing the oud is one of the things I love doing the most. Whenever I pick up my oud and start playing a few notes it transcends me to another world.

 

WHY AM I DOING THIS?

The effects of listening to the oud are immediate and powerful. It is so expressive that if you let it, it can draw you in and put you in a trance. It can calm your mind and soul.

On this album I am playing an oud that was made for me by Iraqi/Canadian luthier Saad Al Tayyar, a true artist and one of the greatest oud makers of our current times. It's a real honour for me to own it. It gave me a completely new voice through which I am able to express myself. It has brought me so much joy, and now I wish to share this joy with everyone.

This album represents many important things to me. It is a milestone, a culmination of almost two decades of experience as a professional musician, of many years that I spent practicing, studying, listening, absorbing, performing, collaborating. So far it all led to this album.

 

THE MUSIC ON THIS ALBUM

I’ve always believed that one of the best ways to get introduced to any culture is through its music. Music unites people of different backgrounds. Having lived a part of my life in Cairo, and another in Montreal, I have become naturally and equally exposed to both eastern and western cultures. Having also spent years studying jazz as well as classical Arabic music, I seek to find a common ground where both cultures meet and complement one another.

This common ground between the two gave birth to the idea of this trio (around the end of 2014) as the combination of the oud, upright bass and oriental percussion was already on my mind for a while. Three instruments that cover the three main elements of music: melody, rhythm, and harmony. Accompanying me on this album are two world-class musicians: Mike De Masi, one of the most talented upright bass players from Montreal’s vibrant jazz scene, and Joseph Khoury, one of the top oriental percussionists from Montreal’s diverse oriental/world music scenes.

The music on this album is a result of almost four years of us playing together, developing our sound as one unit, after many performances around the island of Montreal and its surrounding areas. It is an album of original music as well as arrangements of pieces from the traditional Egyptian repertoire. Oh, and there's also an arrangement of a song by Leonard Cohen!

 

THE PROJECT

Being a perfectionist by nature, I seek only the best elements. The recording takes place live at Piccolo Studios, one of the top studios in Montreal, where Celine Dion herself launched her career! Pierre Messier, the recording engineer, helped us capture the live performances beautifully. The editing and mixing are done by Omar Raafat in Cairo, a super-talented sound engineer and a good friend of mine. The mastering is done by Stefano Amerio in Italy, one of the top sound engineers out there with over 400 albums under his belt. Three engineers in three different continents!

The album cover drawing (shown above in progress) is created by my very own super talented sister, artist Layla Omar El-Farouk, founder of Place Des Arts art center in Cairo. The photography and videography taken during the recording sessions are by Joshua Hansen, one of the most active and talented film makers in Montreal. On second camera is Evan Shay, another very talented photographer/film maker, and an incredible saxophone player. The album design is created by Lucas Zafiris, a super talented graphic designer with a very sensitive artistic touch.

I am completely managing this whole project solo from A to Z (music arrangements, management, promotion…etc). It’s been downright exhausting, but the results are starting to appear and I am super excited!

 

THE REWARDS

Contribute in the making of this amazing project by choosing one of the rewards on the right -->

 It would make a great idea for a gift (birthday, Christmas…etc)!

Rewards would be delivered after the campaign ends.

 

THE BUDGET

Making an album costs money. Making an album with good quality ingredients costs a looooot of money! The entire budget costs more or less 8000 CAD. I am looking to raise 5000 CAD to start with. If I am able to raise more, it will help in the future in funding the editing costs of the songs that were filmed during the recording sessions, using four different cameras!

 

CAN'T CONTRIBUTE? NO PROBLEM!

What you can do instead is spread the word within your network and on your social media campaigns. Word of mouth marketing and third-party endorsements are wonderful things!

Let this wonderful instrument that is entrenched in so much of mankind’s history be discovered. Help create tolerance and understanding across cultures.

Peace and love.

story:
"Where have you been, Lacey?"

I know it's been a while since my last CD. And nowadays, most artists are expected to release new music almost every month. But this project might be the most important of my career, and I wanted to be absolutely positive that the songs are as close to perfect as possible, and that they are the best representation of me and my music. And, after three long years, I FINALLY feel confident that these new songs, and my new sound, are ready to share with the world!  

My greatest resource has been my amazing fans. I've played over 100 shows since February of 2016, and the feedback I received from the people who attended those shows has been invaluable! I played to people from around the world and your comments about which songs you love, what keeps you coming back to more shows, what about the show moved you, and so much more, has helped me grow as an artist and songwriter. And I think it shows on this new album.

Your help with this Indiegogo Campaign will help me get these songs recorded by the best possible producer and musicians, and will also provide the means to create more videos, come up with exciting new merchandise, and FINALLY go ON TOUR to all of the places so many fans have asked me to visit! But, I can't do it alone, and here's how you can help, and what you can get in return...

 

Here's The Deal

Releasing a new album takes a lot of people, time, and money. Doing it without a record label is a HUGE undertaking, but more and more artists are doing it by getting their fans involved... fans just like YOU!

In order to make this project a reality, I'm trying to raise $10,000. Here is where and how that money will be spent:

  • $7,500: Producer, recording, and musician fees
  • $1,500: CD Manufacturing/Printing
  • $1,000: Merch (t-shirts, posters, custom guitar picks, etc.)

And if we raise MORE than the goal, any extra money will be put towards a SUMMER TOUR. Of course, touring takes a lot of funding with fuel expenses, vehicle maintenance, meals & lodging, etc. It takes a minimum of $250 in expenses for each city we visit, and I am hoping to do a 15 city tour this summer, which would cost about $3,750. So, the more we raise over the goal, the better the chances I might be performing in YOUR town!

AND... everyone who contributes gets SOMETHING in return! Rewards include:

  • Custom guitar picks
  • Signed exclusive photos or posters
  • Invitations to a private Facebook Live Show
  • Signed copies of CD's
  • T-Shirts
  • A 30-minute Skype call or lesson
  • Personalized videos (you choose the cover song)
  • A 90-minute LIVE performance at your home!!

So check out the perks on the right side of this page and select the level that's best for you!

 

Risks & Challenges

I am so grateful for anything you can give, and I know that so many people live paycheck to paycheck, so giving ANY money is a very big deal for them. I am SO confident that we can reach the goal of this campaign, and even go WAY above it, but if timing just isn't right and we fall short, my parents have always taught me how to make the most out of what you have, so I know I'll still be able to make GREAT album. 

If the goal isn't met, we can explore options like putting fewer songs on the CD, or looking into CD printing packages that don't include artwork, less expensive packaging, etc. So, no matter what, this project is happening... BUT, reaching the goal will mean putting my absolute BEST foot forward, and giving theses new songs the best treatment possible!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially to this campaign, that's absolutely understandable! But, I can still use your help in other ways...

  • Share this Indiegogo page on your social media pages to help get the word out!
  • Tell your friends, family, or fellow fans who might be able to contribute, or who might be able to get the word out as well!
  • Tune-in to my Facebook Live or Instagram Live shows during the campaign and share the broadcasts or invite friends to join!

Thank you for visiting my Indiegogo page. I couldn't be more grateful for your support!

story:
My name is Andrew Longaker. I'm a jazz musician, surfer and entrepreneur. I grew up in Southern California surfing and skateboarding and began playing in a rock band as a teenager. At 16 I became obsessed with learning to play jazz. At 18 I entered the UCLA Herb Alpert school of music under the direction of jazz legend Kenny Burrell (Burrell played guitar on "What a Wonderful World" by Louis Armstrong). At 22 I moved to Chicago to try my hand at the jazz scene. I led various bands under my own name and recorded 5 records (3 of which are available in the Perks section of this project). In 2017 I left Chicago and returned to California to pursue surfing and take on new challenges as an athlete and musician. The surf video "Invisible Force" and "The Bridge" reflect this exciting transition. 

This upcoming album explores new themes and musical landscapes. Lost Realm conveys the vital importance of moving out of one's comfort zone and reaching for excellence in more than one pursuit. Many are the people who perform their job or their craft well but fall short in other areas of life. Few are those who push to move beyond the familiar and into the Lost Realm- the vital stream of knowledge of our past and future.  

I couldn't talk this talk without walking it first. Musically, I've stepped out of this comfort zone and prepared 3 songs which are out of my wheelhouse musically (since 2005 I've recorded purely instrumental jazz music). I sing and rap on these 3 songs, and trade verses with eclectic beat maker Dale Marron. Together, we've fused diverse elements into one sound which will be heard on these 3 songs. The other songs will be solo guitar, followed by a surprise bonus track!

I was inspired to use my voice and delve into another style. After all, Duke Ellington's quote about genres is still true; "There are only two types of music: good music and the other kind".

If you are a music listener, I am confident you'll thoroughly enjoy this new record and be able to listen to it again and again. 

This campaign is to pay for the production, recording, mixing and mastering, pressing and release of this new CD. As an independent artist, I look to your interest and contributions to help bring this musical work to fruition. Any and all support is much appreciated!

Here is a breakdown of the funds which I am seeking to raise:

Recording: $2,100

Mixing and mastering: $800

Easydisc CD pressing: $500

Graphic Design: $150 (with additional donated design time)

CD baby Pro online distribution: $70

Physical Distribution: $1500

 

The perks to choose from in this project are:

A digital download of Lost Realm 

A copy of the newly pressed CD Lost Realm

An original Invisible Force T Shirt (see photo in "perks" section)

A Signed copy of the CD Lost Realm

A pencil sketch of the Lost Realm original concept and signed CD Lost Realm 

4 of my latest CDs (includes Lost Realm)

Surf Lesson 

Choose a song title and theme 

If the fundraising goal is not reached the funds raised still go toward this project. All contributions will be put to work for the process of releasing this album. This album will be released In August. 

This project is my third on Indiegogo. My first project was 'A Journey in Sound & Surf', in which funds were raised to make my first surf video. The second project culminated in the 2017 surf film called 'Invisible Force'. 

You can see and hear the results of my work and efforts. My youtube channel is an ongoing representation of my releases. You may view these videos under my main project video. 

How to Support this Project:

If you are not in a position to contribute monetarily, you can help get the word out. It's just as important that people see the project and its contents. Please share it if you like the idea. Indiegogo has some great share tools!

Thanks for reading and enjoy the music.
story_txt:
My name is Andrew Longaker. I'm a jazz musician, surfer and entrepreneur. I grew up in Southern California surfing and skateboarding and began playing in a rock band as a teenager. At 16 I became obsessed with learning to play jazz. At 18 I entered the UCLA Herb Alpert school of music under the direction of jazz legend Kenny Burrell (Burrell played guitar on "What a Wonderful World" by Louis Armstrong). At 22 I moved to Chicago to try my hand at the jazz scene. I led various bands under my own name and recorded 5 records (3 of which are available in the Perks section of this project). In 2017 I left Chicago and returned to California to pursue surfing and take on new challenges as an athlete and musician. The surf video "Invisible Force" and "The Bridge" reflect this exciting transition. 
This upcoming album explores new themes and musical landscapes. Lost Realm conveys the vital importance of moving out of one's comfort zone and reaching for excellence in more than one pursuit. Many are the people who perform their job or their craft well but fall short in other areas of life. Few are those who push to move beyond the familiar and into the Lost Realm- the vital stream of knowledge of our past and future.  
I couldn't talk this talk without walking it first. Musically, I've stepped out of this comfort zone and prepared 3 songs which are out of my wheelhouse musically (since 2005 I've recorded purely instrumental jazz music). I sing and rap on these 3 songs, and trade verses with eclectic beat maker Dale Marron. Together, we've fused diverse elements into one sound which will be heard on these 3 songs. The other songs will be solo guitar, followed by a surprise bonus track!
I was inspired to use my voice and delve into another style. After all, Duke Ellington's quote about genres is still true; "There are only two types of music: good music and the other kind".
If you are a music listener, I am confident you'll thoroughly enjoy this new record and be able to listen to it again and again. 
This campaign is to pay for the production, recording, mixing and mastering, pressing and release of this new CD. As an independent artist, I look to your interest and contributions to help bring this musical work to fruition. Any and all support is much appreciated!

Recording: $2,100

A digital download of Lost Realm 
A copy of the newly pressed CD Lost Realm

A Signed copy of the CD Lost Realm
A pencil sketch of the Lost Realm original concept and signed CD Lost Realm 
4 of my latest CDs (includes Lost Realm)
Surf Lesson 
Choose a song title and theme 
If the fundraising goal is not reached the funds raised still go toward this project. All contributions will be put to work for the process of releasing this album. This album will be released In August. 
This project is my third on Indiegogo. My first project was 'A Journey in Sound & Surf', in which funds were raised to make my first surf video. The second project culminated in the 2017 surf film called 'Invisible Force'. 
You can see and hear the results of my work and efforts. My youtube channel is an ongoing representation of my releases. You may view these videos under my main project video.

story:
Music as a Doorway to Silence

My name is Dana I am a musician and a singer of devotional music. In the last few years music has been flowing so effortlessly and with pure joy I have been sharing music at concerts, yoga classes, kirtans, workshops and ceremonies.
I grew up in an ashram in a beautiful family who devoted their lives to yoga and meditation. As a child I was mesmerised by the sound of mantra's and Indian music. Over the years I studied Hindi, started teaching yoga and devotional music became a part of my everyday life. I have created some beautiful compositions of mantra's, combining words of prayer in Sanskrit and their translation into English. Now I feel the time has come to share these soothing chants with the world and to record my first album.

I am asking for your help to fund the recording of this music and I am fully confident it is possible with your support! Every single pre-ordered CD and every donation can make a difference to achieve the bigger goal to record the full album. 

You can pre-order the album before it's made, and so help create this music. Please choose from the gifts (perks) on the right hand side, or simply give a donation by clicking the 'back now' box by the video. 

Budget

The budget of 5500 Euro's is needed for the following costs:
- Studio costs: (recording, mixing, producing and mastering)
- Guest musicians: (fees and travel expenses)
- Pressing the CDs
- Artwork CD
- Indiegogo fees and expenses
- Video and photo shoot

Sharing Peace with the World

When we find peace within, we find peace in the world. This album will contribute to the growing longing of people to re-connect with inner peace, quietude and silence. The vibration of divine music is so powerful. Music has the power to calm our nervous system, to open the heart and is a doorway to silence.  I truly believe that music in service to silence, meditation, yoga, prayer and chanting can contribute to the vibration of peace in the world.

In 2016 I recorded 3 songs (these were my first studio recordings) and listeners have responded with enthusiasm to these chants: 
"Beautifully sung and such soothing calming voice.”
“very grateful for the magic of your voice and the music which fills all cells with wellness.”

In 2017 I sang the lead vocals on the song "Prayer for Healing" - on the album Silence Speaks by Praful and Spirited Tribe (2017). It has been received with succes in the world of yoga and meditation: "Soaked with beauty and devotion...invokes a familiar but forgotten calling out to the divine."

Praful is a highly talented musician and producer who will help me produce this album. With his expertise on board I am fully confident this album will be one of high quality, so you will have something to look forward to.
www.prafulmusic.com  

There are always risks in life and we never know how life unfolds, but I am fully confident that with the help of friends and of all of you it will be possible to record beautiful music. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this campaign with your friends, companies or others that could be interested to support me in the making of this album. 

What a blessing it is to be alive and to be able to share music to honour these blessings of the divine that are given to us every day.

With love and gratitude 
Dana Devi

story:
Our Story

We are “Cases4Kidz”, a campaign group at the University of Tennessee. Our group includes Krystal Singleton, Ethan Burnett, Jack Martindale, and Aaron Dittmer. We all share a passion for music and playing instruments.

We are raising money for The Joy of Music School. This organization is, “providing free music lessons and instruments to hundreds of financially disadvantaged, at-risk children and teens” (About us). The Joy of Music School is an important element to the Knoxville community because it is providing volunteer work to benefit young students.

It is important to financially contribute to this non-profit, because you will be helping The Joy of Music School provide children with education, community, and new experiences. Without donations, none of this would be possible.

By donating, you will be providing these students with cases to protect the instruments provided by The Joy of Music School. These instruments can be very expensive, and cases mitigate the cost of repairs for instruments. These children need YOUR help!

For donating to this cause, you will have the satisfaction of helping troubled youth. For a small donation of $5, you will recieve a social media shout out from "Cases4Kidz". For only one more dollar you will be entered to win a homemade, music themed tutu dress. We are also selling beautiful holiday ornaments with the Joy of Music School logo printed on them, so you can show off your generosity! These ornaments are only $12.50.

Thank you for your consideration in donating to the Joy of Music School through Cases4Kidz. If you are unable to donate, you can volunteer at The Joy of Music School. Just email Frank Graffeo at Graffeo@joyofmusicschool.org.

story:
BRUTAL BATTLE CUBA 2016


Based out of Canada's Capital, Ottawa, Piranha Productions is an extreme music production company that is putting on the only contest that will send an independent Canadian metal band to the biggest touring festival of CUBA, the BRUTAL FEST. Having done the tour ourselves back in 2014, we decided to help bands who don't have the budget to tour other countries by producing the Brutal Battle CUBA and sending one winner with a full tour package.


While touring the country, we realized Cuban musicians and metalheads did not have access to a music shop to get their instruments and/or accessories. Let's not forget that with their monthly salary, they cannot afford to buy or simply order brand new gear. 


We decided to put on this campaign to help send instruments to metalheads  in Cuba to help them grow as a musicians and continue to produce some wicked Cuban heavy metal!


We are aiming to raise a total of $3000. This amount will help us achieve our goals and make this experience truly special for a Canadian band along with supporting Cuban metal.  We will send them basic instrumental needs such as guitar/bass strings, tuners, drumsticks, drum pads, etc. to begin with. It will also help pay for the shipping of the instruments all the way to Cuba.


As musicians ourselves, we understand their needs. Cuban musicians will be thrilled to receive some brand new gear that they don't have access to! Imagine if we could send them bigger instruments such as guitar and basses!

THE IMPACT
  • Any donation to this project can make a big difference for the Cuban bands and musicians!
  • Lots of Cuban bands/musicians are extremely talented and would be able to keep on doing what they like with new gear.
  • There is a lot of young crowd attending the Brutal Fest in Cuba. Most of them cannot afford to get even used instruments because of the low family income. The instruments could help young people to learn how to play music!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people simply cannot afford to help, even if they would love to. We understand it. Here is what you could do to help.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share it on the social medias and talk about it to your friends.
  • Don't forget, you can use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thanks for your help!
