story:
MoonCandy Album Fund

MoonCandy needs 100 people to purchase a  "MoonCandy Fan Pack" at $27 to insure final production cost.  (There are many other wonderful perks, please check them out below)
"The MoonCandy Fan Pack" includes: An Album Poster, Yoshi's event ticket and Pre-sale Album.  This will cover the final production cost.    
When you donate, you are making a direct contribution towards...
1.  Album Mixing & Mastering:  The mixing and mastering makes the album 100% Professional sound quality.  Without it we can not share the album with the world and that would just be devastating. 
2.  Online and Hardcopy Duplication:  We want to get this music out to the whole wide world.  By having online and hardcopy distribution MoonCandy will be heard near and far in no time. 
3.  Yoshi's Live Video Production - We need video footage for promotion and to solidify future bookings
4. Hiring a publicist -  Hiring a publicist  will help MoonCandy step up their game and get wider coverage and gig opportunities.   
The Impact
MoonCandy has been on the Bay Area music scene since 2010 appearing at many local festivals such as;  Oakland Pride, The Black Eyed Pea Festival, Yerba Buena Garden Festival, Malcolm X Jazz Fest, The Laurel Street Fair, The Oakland Museum and headlining at Oakland's Famed ThePeople Party.  Mooncandy's most reflective work has been as the musical soundtrack for Nicole Klaymoon's Dance Company the "Embodiment Project" providing original music documenting the struggle of African-Americans, systemic racism, and sexism in America.  In the spirit of the Black church, Jazz, The Freedom Singers, and Disco sensation Sylvester, MoonCandy creates an environment for survival music to live and thrive through live performance. Using the dance floor as a it's universal synagogue, MoonCandy's inspirational lyrics and transfixing  grooves gives birth to a "House Church"  where everyone is welcome to dance for love.  
 

Risks & Challenges

The thing about recording a live album is,  you never actually know how much money you're going to need... or at least we didn't.  Mooncandy raised enough funds to record all the vocal and instrumental elements of the album by sacrificing monies from our 2015 summer gigs, however, we need your support to complete this process.   MoonCandy is a group of friends who became family through the music.  We all have day jobs, families and "The Struggle is Real".  Currently we are in need of investors, PR, Marketing and administrative support.  Our hope is to acquire a manager and team, but we need an album and promotional package to help share our story in a professional way.

 
Other Ways You Can Help

All donations small and large are appreciated.  If you are not in a position to give financially, please consider reposting our indiegogo page or sharing our Yoshi's event information with your communities.  We are gratful for your support and appreciate that you want to help us along the way.

story:
About the Project

Broken Things began recording our as of now nameless seven song 12" EP in the summer of 2016 with Norval Alleman at NorvalSound Recording Studio, in St. Petersburg, FL. We are currently (approximately) 90% done with the recording portion of our self-funded project. 

The four of us — Anthony, Stewart, Colin and Mike — are vinyl aficionados, and one thing became abundantly clear about halfway through the recording process: after releasing two EP's via CD and digital download, we would LOVE to commit something to vinyl!

What We Need

Unfortunately without the support of a label, paired with the inability to tour full-time — as well as the additional exorbitant costs associated with the mastering and pressing of an LP — we are short the funds needed to see the totality of our vision come to fruition. That's where you come in.

We have set up a four tiered reward system, should you choose to help us reach our goal of pressing 250 12" EP's. You can read about those rewards under the "Support This Project" tab.

With this project, we will have 45-days to raise the remaining $1,700 needed to pay for the recording and mastering of the album, as well as send you any of the tangible rewards if/when we meet our goal. Check back often for any updates (video or otherwise) on the project. 

Any leftover funds will be used to recoup any extraneous recording expenses, as well as the creation of our own boutique vinyl only label, Dead Sound Recordings.

The Impact

Your contribution, while not saving the world by any stretch of the imagination, will go a long well in helping four budding musicians finally realize their dream of recording, and self-releasing, what we think is a quality project. And while we may no longer sound exactly as we had two years ago — What can I say? Band evolution can be a very good thing! — your contribution will help us create a caché as it were ... an indelible reminder of a time and a place.

Risks & Challenges

We have isolated two risks or challenges for you — our potential benefactor — as well as us:

1. Turn around time for the vinyl release. Because of the recent "vinyl boom," there may be a delay in the time associated with the pressing of a record — something that has been well documented. 

In kind, we will be upfront and honest, and maintain communication with you all along the way.

2. If we do not meet our goal, we will find another way to master and put our pending release.

story:
Hi all! 

My name is Vlade Guigni. I’m from the Dominican Republic and I currently reside in the United States. I’ve been playing Drums for about 20 yeas now. I’ve been very fortunate and blessed, having the gift of music in my life and I consider myself a vessel in service to the society through my talents.

For the past 6 years I attended to Berklee College of Music in Boston, where I earned a Bachelor’s Degree in Music Production and Engineering and then a Master’s of Music in Contemporary Performance (Global Jazz Concentration) at the renowned Berklee Global Jazz Institute. This experience was a life changing for my career. I’ve learned so many things that go way beyond than just playing my instrument. My time at Berklee helped  me immensely in my journey  finding purpose in what I do beyond of what is tangible.

I met so many great musicians from all over the world at Berklee, they became friends and family to me. I had incredible teachers and mentors like Terri Lyne Carrington, Ralph Peterson, Neal Smith, Henrique De Almeida, Danilo Perez, Joe Lovano, John Patitucci, Leo Blanco and many others. With their guidance I became aware of very important values such as the community and collaboration service for the greater good.

As an independent and self-funded artist,  I’m inviting you to support me on this exciting project of making my first full studio album as a band leader. Your donations will help me to cover the costs of post-production, high quality video recording, musician fees and release fees. In exchange you will receive exclusive packages with different rewards that will be available only for you!.

I’ve been blessed to have Berklee College of Music providing the recording studio fees covered. However the recording process is just one step of many that I need to accomplish in order to bring this project to life.

The recording date is March 19th2019, with your support we will make this happen. Stay tuned in all my social media channels so you can see the progress of the recording.  THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!!!!

Sincerely,

Vlade

P.S. Please don’t forget to SHARE this with everybody !!!!!!

 

MORE ABOUT ME, CHECK THE LINKS BELOW 


https://www.vladeguigni.com
https://www.instagram.com/vladeguignimusic
https://www.facebook.com/vladeguigni17
https://twitter.com/VladeGuigni
story_txt: Hi all! My name is Vlade Guigni. I’m from the Dominican Republic and I currently reside in the United States. I’ve been playing Drums for about 20 yeas now. I’ve been very fortunate and blessed, having the gift of music in my life and I consider myself a vessel in service to the society through my talents.For the past 6 years I attended to Berklee College of Music in Boston, where I earned a Bachelor’s Degree in Music Production and Engineering and then a Master’s of Music in Contemporary Performance (Global Jazz Concentration) at the renowned Berklee Global Jazz Institute. This experience was a life changing for my career. I’ve learned so many things that go way beyond than just playing my instrument. My time at Berklee helped  me immensely in my journey  finding purpose in what I do beyond of what is tangible.I met so many great musicians from all over the world at Berklee, they became friends and family to me. I had incredible teachers and mentors like Terri Lyne Carrington, Ralph Peterson, Neal Smith, Henrique De Almeida, Danilo Perez, Joe Lovano, John Patitucci, Leo Blanco and many others. With their guidance I became aware of very important values such as the community and collaboration service for the greater good.As an independent and self-funded artist,  I’m inviting you to support me on this exciting project of making my first full studio album as a band leader. Your donations will help me to cover the costs of post-production, high quality video recording, musician fees and release fees. In exchange you will receive exclusive packages with different rewards that will be available only for you!.I’ve been blessed to have Berklee College of Music providing the recording studio fees covered. However the recording process is just one step of many that I need to accomplish in order to bring this project to life.The recording date is March 19th2019, with your support we will make this happen. Stay tuned in all my social media channels so you can see the progress of the recording.  THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!!!!Sincerely,VladeP.S. Please don’t forget to SHARE this with everybody !!!!!! MORE ABOUT ME, CHECK THE LINKS BELOW https://www.vladeguigni.comhttps://www.instagram.com/vladeguignimusichttps://www.facebook.com/vladeguigni17https://twitter.com/VladeGuigni

story:
We are inviting you to support the new direction of our work.  Sound Light ceremonies through the gift of song.

This campaign (and your support) is something that ripples well beyond the mere physical and monetary support to us as a group.  It is support that extends to the shamanic healing of lands, people, creatures and environments - as we take these songs and share them internationally, and give them to you to use in the same way as the great planetary healing expands.  It is an album at service to All of Creation, for All of Creation, with All of Creation.  And with your support YOU will be the first to receive these songs and have privilege to use them!

Our trio is composed of musicians Joe Ronco (guitar, vocals and musical construction virtuoso), Reaz Bacchus  (tabla drums, vocals and rhythm-blaster extraordinaire) and Bermalva Porter (vocals, percussion and Earthen en-chant-tress).  Together these forces of nature create The Bhakti Connection, converging since 2007.

This is the core reason for the existence of the group - to offer a refuge and place of healing, peace and spiritual evolution through music. For the first time in the history of The Bhakti Connection, this album expresses the very unique essence of Sound Light, as heard and recorded by the group.  There is an accompanying book called "Priestess of Light Ceremonies" written by Bermalva that teaches the practical use of these songs  (be sure to choose the "Book & CD" perk option if interested!)

 

What is the Music?

Sound Light is the original form of music on Earth.  To compare the type of music on this album to what you might know, we can say it carries a multi-cultural vibe, with hints of tribal cultures, traditional native shamanistic drum beats,  trance-like repetitive chant, and soothing nature inspired melodies.  You will hear bird calls, throat singing, high soprano and low Tibetan singing tones.  It's an album that can be used in a yoga class, for relaxation, and with some songs for dancing! All songs are original and authentic, the way Sound Light usually comes!

Examples of song titles, to give you a sneak peak are; "Lila song", "Sovereignty Song", "Yahweah", "Goddess Anthem", "Meant to Be" and more!

 

 

The Sacred Exchange

By supporting this campaign by "pre-sale" and other fun perks, it guarantees YOU get the very first copies of the album, hot off the press!

Making an album is expensive! We have sound engineering costs ($35/hour), graphic design, sound mastering (specific technical sound engineering), CD covers and copying onto disc, paid advertising, and a music video recording cost (single release "Yahweah" video).

Here are our estimates for costs for this album:

  • In studio recording $3000
  • Mastering $500+
  • Graphic Design $200+
  • CD cover and copying printing $1000+
  • Music videographer $500
  • Advertising $300

IF we reach our modest goal (and hopefully surpass it!) and you become one of the firsts to receive the album, it will be a most joyful relationship exchange!  Our sacred supporters!  Our greater costs will be covered, and we will have avoided going into personal dept.  You will have a new album as a soundscape for your everyday life, ceremonies and healings. 

 

 

Perks - What you get!

Now take a look at all the amazing perk options over on the right hand side.  Besides being the coolest kid on the block by owning a first copy of our album,  how about having your own private band playing your favorite type of sacred music for a dinner party? Or inviting 10 of your closest friends over to drink fresh made juices and chant kirtan all night?  A personalized sacred ceremony or mantra initiation? How about renting a tabla player for the night?  We are super excited to share this campaign with you, so don't be shy to choose what you like!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to help us out monetarily, so here's how you can help without spending a dime!

  • Post, email, talk and share our campaign within your communities!  Make some noise about our campaign!
  • Use this website as your link and feel free to utilize the tools here, little buttons up at the top to share on Facebook and twitter, and follow us!

 

 

Our sound engineer Gareth Auden-Hole with his cute pooch who was present in many of our recordings!  Supporting our project directly support these guys too!

 

 

On our Healing Waters East Coast tour - pictured here in Sackville, NB with a group of sound light chanters who really got into the "Lila Song" and ceremony.  This song is on the new album!

 

Scroll all the way DOWN to see ALL of our fun options!  ----->

story:
Most people know me for my words. As a journalist, I’ve covered elections in multiple countries, interviewed White House officials, combated Nazis online, profiled unusual Jews in baseball, and even chronicled the translation of Harry Potter into Yiddish. But for the last 5 years, I’ve been quietly working on something very different: an original album of Jewish music.

Today, I'm ready to share it with the rest of you—and with your help, many people beyond.

(A quick note: To see what's included in any perk on the right, just click it.)

THE PROJECT

Music has long been a universal language among Jews, transcending time periods, ideologies, and denominations. Jewish communities that would never speak to each other somehow sing to each other, sharing the same tunes even when they seem to share little else. In an increasingly fractious time, these melodies serve as a rare unifying force. The beauty of music is that it transcends localities and languages. The beauty of Jewish music is that it also transcends our communal and ideological divides.

This is particularly true of the songs we sing on Shabbat, the Jewish day of rest. To that end, for many years, I've been working on a new collection of modern melodies for traditional Jewish Shabbat songs, from Shalom Aleichem to Lecha Dodi. Together with a fantastic team of musicians and vocalists, I've produced two of the tracks—one which you can hear above, and another which will be released during this campaign—and created demos for the rest.

How do those demos become full-fledged productions? That's where you come in.

MAKING THE MUSIC HAPPEN

My definition of success is a simple one: to give people new melodies to enrich their Jewish lives, however they define them. It’s to walk into a Jewish gathering somewhere in the world and hear that they are singing one of my songs and have no idea who I am, because the melody has taken on a meaning beyond its composer.

Together, we can make that a reality. To this point, I've been self-funding this project out of my own pocket. That's sustainable for a couple songs, but not for an entire album, especially if the goal is not simply to produce the music, but to share it widely and enable as many people as possible to learn and enjoy it.

Here's what your contribution will support:

  • Production of the entire album, including studio, musicians, mixing, mastering, and distribution
  • Making available free sheet music for each track for those who wish to learn and teach the songs
  • Creating animated lyrics clips to enable the songs to be shared and learned online
     


REWARDS

Depending on the level of your contribution, here's what you'll get:

  • A digital download of the entire album, plus immediate MP3s of each single off the album as they are released (as an online-only project, you'll get your music instantly)
  • Additional bonus tracks, from beautiful instrumental variations to entirely alternate versions

There's more: Want to learn how to lead a prayer service, and even get some coaching for that from me? Get a personal thank you on Twitter? An advance copy of the album? Those are just some of the other perks available. Click any perk on the left to expand it and see its details! You can also contribute at any perk level whether or not you want the particular perk. Every contribution is greatly appreciated. You can even click "Back It" at the top of this page and give a custom amount of your choosing.

THE TEAM

I've found that the secret to doing something well in life is to surround yourself with people who are better at it than you and have even stranger names. (That last one may be specific to me.) I've been extremely lucky to collaborate on all the harmonies and backing vocals for this project with two immensely talented performers who fit this description:

Abbaleh Savitt is the former musical director of New York University's Jewish a cappella group Ani V'Ata, an attorney, and sometimes high holiday chazan.

Arun Viswanath is the former musical director of Harvard University's Jewish a cappella group, Shani, a tech start-up employee by day, and the official Yiddish translator of Harry Potter by night.

Yair Rosenberg (that's me!) is a senior writer at Tablet Magazine, where he covers politics, culture, and religion. His work has also appeared in the New York Times, Washington Post, Wall Street Journal, and The Atlantic, and has received awards from the Religion Newswriters Association and the Harvard Center for Jewish studies. He promises to stop writing in the third-person now.

Finally, there's our valiant maestro, Charles Newman of Cottage Sounds in Brooklyn, New York. He's a music producer, recording engineer, composer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, talent manager​ and music publisher​, and the co-founder of New York City's Mother West Records and Studios​, The Deli Magazine​, and the band PLEASE​.

Throughout the project, we'll update you with behind-the-scenes looks at how the music gets created—the sort of thing that's really fun but rarely seen. For example, here's the exact moment that the opening harmony for the Shalom Aleichem above came together:

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

I would not be coming to you if I wasn't already confident about our path to production. Every song on the album has already been composed. Every unfinished track has a demo. If this campaign succeeds, we hope to jump straight into production and have the album ready for release by the Jewish high holidays beginning in September, if not before.

That said, with the spread of the coronavirus, particularly within the New York Jewish community, we may be delayed unexpectedly by the necessities of caution and quarantine. Before launch, I considered postponing this project until some months in the future, hoping for the epidemic to pass, especially as members of my own family—not to mention my entire former elementary school and high school—are currently under quarantine. But I decided that now, of all times, we desperately need ways to inject joy into our lives, and that hopefully this music can be of some relief to those anxiously waiting in their homes. We will do our very best to get the completed album to you in a timely fashion.

Thank you for reading this far and for your consideration. I hope you'll support the project and help spread the word!

story:
(English below)


TOCHAPESTANA é um super duo moderno que aplica a linguagem contemporânea da electrónica, do tecno, da dança, do rap, do rock à música popular portuguesa de festa.

Queremos levar o baile português para a pista de dança e para o século XXI.

Amigos, amigas, 
Fãs do primeiro dia ou acabados de chegar:

Estamos a fazer um novo disco.
Um disco construído como um tufão imparável, composto directamente em estúdio e potenciado com a introdução no nosso set de novas máquinas analógicas, drum pads e sintetizadores Moog e Korg. 
Um novo, mais actual e surpreendente, reportório nasceu.
É uma prova de vida. 
Queremos fazer o que não sabemos se conseguimos fazer.
Para TOCHAPESTANA cada álbum deve ser uma reinvenção, um passo inesperado, uma pedra que parte o espelho. 
Nós não queremos ser uma coisa única, uma imagem cristalizada da música, estamos a experimentar uma forma que ainda não foi testada, tendo como rumo o que pode ser um baile português moderno e contemporâneo, embalados pela crença de que em música tudo é possível.

NOVO DISCO O álbum vai ter 10 temas e vai ser organizado como uma mixtape,  todas as canções terão um altro, uma parte final autónoma que as complementam e que fazem ligação com a música seguinte. O ritmo tornou-se a chave na composição e é notória a maior definição e complexidade das batidas, expandidas pela introdução de máquinas como a Yamaha DD 10 e a MFB Tanzbar. Existe agora uma maior maturidade na escolha harmónica, entre a poesia do rap, a força do rock-metal, a hipnose do tecno,  a simplicidade da Pop e o fulgor da pista de dança. Nas harmonias o novo disco demonstra também uma nova fase no processo de composição, com uma maior linguagem e complexidade estrutural em contraste com o recurso a melodias simples e directas nos refrões. Esta mistura de universos, entre os acordes maiores e menores, transportam as melodias para um limbo entre a melancolia e a euforia, num tão português sentir.

PORQUE AVANÇAMOS PARA UM CROWDFUNDING. Com o primeiro disco, Música Moderna (Ed.Autor/Compact 2014), reunimos o nosso melhor cancioneiro dos últimos 6 anos, numa espécie de colectânea das canções que melhor resultavam nas nossas festas. Lutámos longamente para não editar, se não estivéssemos prontos. Não temos pressa, TOCHAPESTANA não é uma corrida de 100 metros, é uma maratona de fogo!  Fizemos "Música Moderna" quando o podíamos fazer, uma súmula do inicio da nossa vida. A partir daqui estamos prontos para tudo. E foi assim que menos de um ano depois, ainda a rodar o espectáculo de Música Moderna, entrámos em estúdio para um novo disco,  por nossa conta, obedecendo ao nosso instinto. E agora é este novo disco que vai criar um novo espectáculo, um show que vocês podem ver a acontecer.

A PROVA NA VIDA REAL Em todos os concertos que fizemos neste último ano, por todas as cidades e aldeias por que passámos, sentimos um fulgor: afinal temos público, afinal temos pessoas que vivem o espectáculo, e que querem ouvir, sejam adolescentes que nos esperam no final de um concerto ou seniores que nos compram o CD no meio de um baile de verão ou hipsters numa discoteca na capital.  Não há nada que nos faça parar enquanto sentirmos que há alguém que nos espera. Como uma das novas canções do próximo disco diz: "basta um fã para ser true / basta um fã para se ter uma crew" E é só isto que interessa.

VOCÊS FAZEM PARTE Pedimos então uma coisa simples: a melhor forma de ver nascer este disco é comprá-lo antecipadamente. Assim vocês serão parte do processo, uma coisa única entre nós. É isso que pedimos. É pouco, mas faremos muito por pouco. E enviaremos cada disco para vocês totalmente personalizado, com a dedicação de uma relação.

TOCHAPESTANA será sempre uma questão de fé e a quem nos dá a mão, nem que seja uma vez na vida, seremos para sempre fieis.

Gravado, produzido e misturado pelo produtor e DJ Boydingo.
As gravações decorreram entre 28 Julho e 20 Agosto + 15 a 28 Setembro 2015 . Pós-produção e mistura entre Outubro e Dezembro 2015.
Todas as canções são originais e cantados em português. 
Participações de Chiara, Mariana Camacho, Denise Pereira, Rocha Alves, Boydingo, Savana

________________________________________________________________

TOCHAPESTANA is a super modern duo applying contemporary language of electronics, techno, dance, rap, rock to popular Portuguese party music.
We want to take the Portuguese ball to the dance floor and into the twenty-first century.

Friends,
Fans from day one or fresh arrived:

We are making a new album.
A disk built like an unstoppable whirlwind, composed directly in the studio and boosted with the introduction in our set of new analog machines, drum pads and Moog and Korg synthesizers.
A new, more timely and surprising repertoire was born.
It is a proof of life.
We want to do what we do not know if we can do.
For TOCHAPESTANA each album should be a reinvention, an unexpected step, a stone that breaks the mirror.
We do not want to be one thing, a crystallised music image, we are experiencing a way that has not been tested, with the direction of what can be a modern and contemporary Portuguese ball, lulled by the belief that in music everything is possible.
NEW ALBUM

The album will have 10 songs and will be organised as a mixtape; all the songs will have a altro, an autonomous end that complements and makes connection to the next song. The rhythm has become the key in the composition and is notorious the greater definition and complexity of beats, expanded by the introduction of machines like the Yamaha DD 10 and MFB Tanzbär. There is now a greater maturity in the harmonic choices, from poetry rap, the strength of metal-rock, the techno hypnosis, to the simplicity of Pop and the glow of the dance floor. In the harmonies the new album also demonstrates a new stage in the writing process, with greater language and structural complexity which makes a contrast with the use of simple and direct melodies in the choruses. This mixture of universes, between major and minor chords, carries the melodies to a limbo between melancholy and euphoria, in a so Portuguese way of feeling.

WHY WE MOVE TO CROWDFUNDING.

With the first album, Modern Music (Ed.Autor / Compact 2014), we gathered our best songbook from the last six years, a sort of compendium of songs that resulted best in our parties. We fought long not to edit, if we weren't ready for it. We are in no hurry, TOCHAPESTANA is not a 100 meters race, is a fiery marathon! We did "Musica Moderna" (A.K.A. Modern Music) when we could, a statement from the beginning of our life. From here on we are ready for everything. And so less than a year later, still turning the Musica Moderna show, we entered the studio for a new album, on our own, obeying our instinct. And now is this new record that will create a new show, a show that you can see happening.

THE RACE IN REAL LIFE

In every concert we did this last year, in all the towns and villages we went through, we felt a flash: after all we have public, after all we have people who live the show, and that want to hear, whether they are teens that expect us at the end of a concert, or seniors who buy our CD in the middle of a summer concert or hipsters in a nightclub of the capital. There is nothing that will make us stop until we feel that there is someone that awaits us. As one of the new songs from the upcoming album says, "one fan is enough for it to be true / one fan is enough to have a crew" And this is all it matters.

YOU DO TAKE PART

We then asked for a simple thing: the best way to see the birth of this record is to buy it in advance. So that you will be part of the process, a special bond between us. That's what we ask. It's little, but we will do a lot with little. And we will send each album for you completely customised, with the dedication of a relationship.

TOCHAPESTANA will always be a matter of faith and for those who will give us a hand, if only once in a lifetime, we will be forever faithful.

 Recorded, produced and mixed by producer and DJ Boydingo.
 The recordings took place between July 28 and August 20 + 15 till September 28, 2015. Post-production and mixing between October and December 2015.
 All songs are original and sung in Portuguese.
 Appearances by Chiara, Mariana Camacho, Denise Pereira Alves Rocha, Boydingo, Savannah
story_txt:
(English
below)
TOCHAPESTANA é um super duo moderno que aplica a linguagem contemporânea da electrónica, do tecno, da dança, do rap, do rock à música popular portuguesa de festa.Queremos levar o baile português para a pista de dança e para o século XXI.Amigos, amigas, Fãs do primeiro dia ou acabados de chegar:Estamos a fazer um novo disco.Um disco construído como um tufão imparável, composto directamente em estúdio e potenciado com a introdução no nosso set de novas máquinas analógicas, drum pads e sintetizadores Moog e Korg. Um novo, mais actual e surpreendente, reportório nasceu.É uma prova de vida. Queremos fazer o que não sabemos se conseguimos fazer.Para TOCHAPESTANA cada álbum deve ser uma reinvenção, um passo inesperado, uma pedra que parte o espelho. Nós não queremos ser uma coisa única, uma imagem cristalizada da música, estamos a experimentar uma forma que ainda não foi testada, tendo como rumo o que pode ser um baile português moderno e contemporâneo, embalados pela crença de que em música tudo é possível.NOVO DISCO O álbum vai ter 10 temas e vai ser organizado como uma mixtape,  todas as canções terão um altro, uma parte final autónoma que as complementam e que fazem ligação com a música seguinte. O ritmo tornou-se a chave na composição e é notória a maior definição e complexidade das batidas, expandidas pela introdução de máquinas como a Yamaha DD 10 e a MFB Tanzbar. Existe agora uma maior maturidade na escolha harmónica, entre a poesia do rap, a força do rock-metal, a hipnose do tecno,  a simplicidade da Pop e o fulgor da pista de dança. Nas harmonias o novo disco demonstra também uma nova fase no processo de composição, com uma maior linguagem e complexidade estrutural em contraste com o recurso a melodias simples e directas nos refrões. Esta mistura de universos, entre os acordes maiores e menores, transportam as melodias para um limbo entre a melancolia e a euforia, num tão português sentir.PORQUE AVANÇAMOS PARA UM CROWDFUNDING. Com o primeiro disco, Música Moderna (Ed.Autor/Compact 2014), reunimos o nosso melhor cancioneiro dos últimos 6 anos, numa espécie de colectânea das canções que melhor resultavam nas nossas festas. Lutámos longamente para não editar, se não estivéssemos prontos. Não temos pressa, TOCHAPESTANA não é uma corrida de 100 metros, é uma maratona de fogo!  Fizemos "Música Moderna" quando o podíamos fazer, uma súmula do inicio da nossa vida. A partir daqui estamos prontos para tudo. E foi assim que menos de um ano depois, ainda a rodar o espectáculo de Música Moderna, entrámos em estúdio para um novo disco,  por nossa conta, obedecendo ao nosso instinto. E agora é este novo disco que vai criar um novo espectáculo, um show que vocês podem ver a acontecer.A PROVA NA VIDA REAL Em todos os concertos que fizemos neste último ano, por todas as cidades e aldeias por que passámos, sentimos um fulgor: afinal temos público, afinal temos pessoas que vivem o espectáculo, e que querem ouvir, sejam adolescentes que nos esperam no final de um concerto ou seniores que nos compram o CD no meio de um baile de verão ou hipsters numa discoteca na capital.  Não há nada que nos faça parar enquanto sentirmos que há alguém que nos espera. Como uma das novas canções do próximo disco diz: "basta um fã para ser true / basta um fã para se ter uma crew" E é só isto que interessa.VOCÊS FAZEM PARTE Pedimos então uma coisa simples: a melhor forma de ver nascer este disco é comprá-lo antecipadamente. Assim vocês serão parte do processo, uma coisa única entre nós. É isso que pedimos. É pouco, mas faremos muito por pouco. E enviaremos cada disco para vocês totalmente personalizado, com a dedicação de uma relação.TOCHAPESTANA será sempre uma questão de fé e a quem nos dá a mão, nem que seja uma vez na vida, seremos para sempre fieis.
Gravado, produzido e misturado pelo produtor e DJ Boydingo.As gravações decorreram entre 28 Julho e 20 Agosto + 15 a 28 Setembro 2015 . Pós-produção e mistura entre Outubro e Dezembro 2015.Todas as canções são originais e cantados em português. Participações de Chiara, Mariana Camacho, Denise Pereira, Rocha Alves, Boydingo, Savana________________________________________________________________
TOCHAPESTANA
is a super modern duo applying contemporary language of electronics, techno,
dance, rap, rock to popular Portuguese party music.
We want to take the Portuguese ball to the dance floor and into the
twenty-first century.

Friends,
Fans from day one or fresh arrived:

We are making a new album.
A disk built like an unstoppable whirlwind, composed directly in the studio and
boosted with the introduction in our set of new analog machines, drum pads and
Moog and Korg synthesizers.
A new, more timely and surprising repertoire was born.
It is a proof of life.
We want to do what we do not know if we can do.
For TOCHAPESTANA each album should be a reinvention, an unexpected step, a
stone that breaks the mirror.
We do not want to be one thing, a crystallised music image, we are experiencing
a way that has not been tested, with the direction of what can be a modern and
contemporary Portuguese ball, lulled by the belief that in music everything is
possible.
NEW ALBUM

The album will have 10 songs and will be organised as a mixtape; all the songs
will have a altro, an autonomous end that complements and makes connection to
the next song. The rhythm has become the key in the composition and is
notorious the greater definition and complexity of beats, expanded by the
introduction of machines like the Yamaha DD 10 and MFB Tanzbär. There is now a
greater maturity in the harmonic choices, from poetry rap, the strength of
metal-rock, the techno hypnosis, to the simplicity of Pop and the glow of the
dance floor. In the harmonies the new album also demonstrates a new stage in
the writing process, with greater language and structural complexity which
makes a contrast with the use of simple and direct melodies in the choruses.
This mixture of universes, between major and minor chords, carries the melodies
to a limbo between melancholy and euphoria, in a so Portuguese way of feeling.

WHY WE MOVE TO CROWDFUNDING.

With the first album, Modern Music (Ed.Autor / Compact 2014), we gathered our
best songbook from the last six years, a sort of compendium of songs that
resulted best in our parties. We fought long not to edit, if we weren't ready
for it. We are in no hurry, TOCHAPESTANA is not a 100 meters race, is a fiery
marathon! We did "Musica Moderna" (A.K.A. Modern Music) when we
could, a statement from the beginning of our life. From here on we are ready
for everything. And so less than a year later, still turning the Musica Moderna
show, we entered the studio for a new album, on our own, obeying our instinct.
And now is this new record that will create a new show, a show that you can see
happening.

THE RACE IN REAL LIFE

In every concert we did this last year, in all the towns and villages we went
through, we felt a flash: after all we have public, after all we have people
who live the show, and that want to hear, whether they are teens that expect us
at the end of a concert, or seniors who buy our CD in the middle of a summer
concert or hipsters in a nightclub of the capital. There is nothing that will
make us stop until we feel that there is someone that awaits us. As one of the
new songs from the upcoming album says, "one fan is enough for it to be
true / one fan is enough to have a crew" And this is all it matters.

YOU DO TAKE PART

We then asked for a simple thing: the best way to see the birth of this record
is to buy it in advance. So that you will be part of the process, a special
bond between us. That's what we ask. It's little, but we will do a lot with
little. And we will send each album for you completely customised, with the
dedication of a relationship.

TOCHAPESTANA will always be a matter
of faith and for those who will give us a hand, if only once in a lifetime, we
will be forever faithful.

 Recorded, produced and mixed by producer and DJ
Boydingo.
 The recordings took place between July 28 and August 20
+ 15 till September 28, 2015. Post-production and mixing between October and
December 2015.
 All songs are original and sung in Portuguese.
 Appearances by Chiara, Mariana Camacho, Denise Pereira
Alves Rocha, Boydingo, Savannah

story:
My name is Michael Ramey and I have been making recordings under the name of Golden Death Music for almost a decade now.  My most recent album, Symbiosis, is available on Cassette and CD and I would love to be able to release it on vinyl.  Any and all support is truly appreciated!  The album in its entirety can be listend to at www.goldendeath.com


Costs - 


300 Records pressed at Musicol in Columbus, Ohio- $1210

300 Record Jackets printed at Musicol in Columbus, Ohio- $745

for a total of $1955


Anyone who contributes will get a copy of the record when it is released, as well as a CD and Cassette - and my endless gratitude.

story:
A Tale of Wonder

Have you ever wondered what it must be like for a baby in the womb? Randy Lindsay did and the result of those musings was the concept for the play, Nine Months With Angels. Randy pictured angels keeping the unborn Alicia company until her time arrived to be born on Earth. The soundtrack will be available separate from the play and contains songs that vary from hand-clapping happy to spiritually profound.

Celine Durney has composed the music for the soundtrack. As you can see from the clip we have provided, she is a talented young woman able to weave together catchy melodies.

Together Randy and Celine have created 15 songs they believe will touch the hearts of listeners. These are songs which look at birth and life in an inventive and heart-warming manner.

We invite you to be part of a project to bring a little more light into the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $3,500 to realize the dream that is Nine Months With Angels.

This will include the cost of:

  • Compensating the musicians and singers.
  • Mixing and mastering the recorded music.
  • Artwork for the album.
  • CD pressing.
  • Purchase of CD cases and album covers.
  • Posters.
  • Shipping goodies to all of our wonderful supporters.  

For the angels who support the project we are offering autographed CD covers, digital downloads of the album before it is available to the project, copies of the CD, autographed Nine Months With Angels posters, and the chance to have us list you as an Executive Producer (imagine how many interesting conversations you can start with that perk?).

In addition, you will have our deepest and sincerest gratitude.

Should we raise more than our targeted goal the rest of the funding will go to the production of a video chronicling the making of the album and improvements to the Nine Months With Angels website.

About the Project

It has long been Randy's goal as a storyteller to reach out to his audiences and touch their hearts in a way they won't soon forget. When the idea for Nine Months With Angels popped into his head he knew he finally had the right story to do exactly that. He wrote the play. He wrote the lyrics for the songs. Then he set out to find a composer who could breath life into his written words. After listening to the single, 730 Days, his search was over. Celine Durney had the right sound to accompany the play. Randy pitched his story about 4 angels keeping a baby company during her stay in her mother's womb and was excited to be part of this innovative project.  

For both Randy and Celine this project is about creating a legacy which will enrich the lives of those who experience it.

Risks & Challenges

The only challenge we face with this project is the funding and that is where you can make a difference. The music has been written and is ready to record. A recording studio has been contacted and is ready for us to proceed. Musicians and singers have all been located and have agreed to lend their talents to the soundtrack. We are 100% ready to go.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help Nine Months With Angels soar by sharing the information about this campaign with your friends. Do you know anyone who could use a spiritual boost? Please, send them our way. We think they will be glad you did and we certainly appreciate the effort.

story:
Bio

C’est sur les bancs de l’école en 2005 que Klin (guitare lead) et John (basse) se sont rencontrés. Préférant la musique et la bière aux cours de maths et aux heures de colle, ils décidèrent de former un groupe et de s’évader de leur prison lycéenne.

          Ils seront bientôt rejoins en 2008 par Kevin (guitare rhythmique) et par Jerem (batterie) avant de suffisamment bourrer la gueule à Rob (chant) pour le convaincre de rejoindre leurs rangs. Bloodstorm verra officiellement le jour en 2009.

          C’est en 2011 que vint leur premier opus intitulé “The Coming Storm” qui fit l’unanimité chez les poivrots du bar du coin et qui leur permit de faire vibrer les planches locales et régionales.

Breaking The Pyramid

        Septembre 2015 aura vu la sortie du 2e opus "Breaking The Pyramid", balayant le premier album et cherchant dignement a faire passer le groupe au cap au-dessus.

Requiem

Lyric video issue du 2e album:



EURO TOUR AVRIL 2016

           Nous avons récemment été contactés pour participer à une tournée européenne de 10 dates et avons besoin de votre aide pour prendre la route.

           Partir en tournée coute cher pour les pauvres groupes émergents qui n'ont pas l'appui des labels, les deals avec les boites de production n'incluent pas forcements le transport, le catering, l'hébergement ou les soins hémorroïdaux du batteur qui reste assis trop longtemps.
          


         Le groupe tournera avec les vétérans de NIGHTRAGE (SWE / GRE), RISE TO FALL (SPA), MONOSCREAM (SWE) et se produira en Allemagne, Belgique, Pays-Bas, Italy, France, Suisse et d'autres pays encore à déterminer.

Comment nous aider?

         Indiegogo fonctionne sur le financement participatif et permet à chacun de donner ce qu'il lui faire plaisir et d'obtenir de jolis cadeaux en fonction des dons.    

         En participant à cette campagne vous nous aiderez à payer:

  1. Les frais de booking
  2. La location du camping car
  3. La bouffe (c'est important)
  4. L'essence
  5. Frais quelconques improbables....
        

     Aidez nous à réaliser notre rêve et à partager notre musique avec le monde!!


(ENG)


Bio

    It was on the dreaded school benches in 2005 that Klin (lead guitars) and John (bass) met. Both of them tending to prefer beer to math classes and detention, they decided to form a band and escape the academic penitentiary.

          They would soon be joined in 2008 by Kevin (rhythm guitars) and Jerem (drums) before getting Rob (vocals) drunk enough in 2009 to convince him to join their ranks. Thus Bloodstorm was born.

          2011 saw the release of their first album entitled “The Coming Storm” which was unanimously praised by the local drunkards and which gave them to possibility to crush the local and regional scene.

Breaking The Pyramid

         Bored from playing the same goddamn songs over and over, Bloodstorm has released their second album called "Breaking The Pyramid" in this year of 2015.

Requiem

Lyric video taken from the 2nd album:

EURO TOUR AVRIL 2016

           We have recently been contacted to take part in a european tour for 10 shows and we need you help in order to get on the road.

           Going on tour costs a lot of money for emerging independant bands, deals with production companies often dont include transportation, catering or hemorrhoid cream for the drummer sitting for long periods of time.


       The band will be touring with NIGHTRAGE (SWE / GRE), RISE TO FALL (SPA), MONOSCREAM (SWE) and will be playing in Germany, Belgium, The Netherlands, Italy, France, Switzerland and more countries to be announced.

How can you help?

         Indiegogo works on a crowdfunding principal and enables anyone to donate the amount they want and receive awesome gifts according to their donation.

         By participating to this campaign you will help us pay for:

Booking fees

  1. Booking fees
  2. RV rental 
  3. Food (very important)
  4. Gas
  5. Improbable fees....
       

     Help us fulfil our dream and spread our music with everyone!!

Booking fees

story:
PARTY WITH A PURPOSE

On September 19, 2015 at 8pm at the Masonic Temple, 317 Clermont Ave. #4, Brooklyn NY 11205, the ground-breaking Experiential Orchestra is partnering with Groupmuse to present a Rite of Spring Dance Party, with all proceeds going to benefit Musicambia, a program that brings conservatory-style musical training to prisons and jails in the United States.

That’s right-we are inviting the AUDIENCE (you) to DANCE to the Rite of Spring. You know, the most famously revolutionary piece of music in history, the piece that caused a riot at its premiere. A piece so full of rhythm and primal energy that you can’t sit still. And now you don’t have to. Shake it to the Glorification of the Chosen One, get down to the Dance of the Earth, be evocative in the Evocation of the Ancestors, and grind to the Danse Sacrale.

But it gets better, because in supporting this Indiegogo, you are also helping a truly important cause: Musicambia's 2015-16 season.  Starting in September, selected inmates housed at correctional facilities in South Carolina and New York will receive conservatory style training in music theory, performance, and most importantly, collaborative ensemble work.  In a world where everyone is forced to stand alone, Musicambia creates a positive environment for students by using collaborative musical activities to promote individual growth.  Participants use the experience to redefine themselves by their potential rather than their past, creating dedicated and passionate human beings with the confidence and work ethic required for successful reentry into society.  

It's changing a lot of lives and giving hope to families while raising awareness about prisons in the United States. Your donations-and the ticket revenue-will go to support this great cause. 

Come and make history by getting sweaty to the most bad-ass piece of music ever written, and help a worthwhile cause in the process.

JOIN THE MOVEMENT

The orchestra is assembled from the very top free-lancers in NYC. They are playing at a highly reduced rate as a way of supporting this cause, but we need to pay them, and that’s where you come in. Contribute as much as you can, and the full value of what you give is tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law. Any contribution of over $50 receives admission to the event, and larger donations include perks like drinks with the conductor and your own private house concert with a select group of these superb musicians. 

Please consider making a significant donation to this fantastic event.  If you would like to support Sheep Island Ensemble and Musicambia but don’t feel comfortable making a donation to this campaign, please be bold and share our project with your friends. 

Last but not least, it goes without saying that we certainly invite you to dance your hearts out at our benefit concert on September 19th, 2015.  Information and tickets are available here. 

Help us make this happen! Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,

James Blachly
Director, Experiential Orchestra/Sheep Island Ensemble

Sam Bodkin
Founder and CEO, Groupmuse

Nathan Schram
Founder, Musicambia

revolutionary piece of music in history, the piece that caused a riot at its
premiere. A piece so full of rhythm and primal energy that you can’t sit still.
And now you don’t have to. Shake it to the Glorification of the Chosen One, get down to the Dance of the Earth, be evocative in the Evocation of the Ancestors, and grind to the Danse Sacrale.
But it gets better, because in
supporting this Indiegogo, you are also helping a truly important cause:
Musicambia's 2015-16 season. 
Starting in September, selected inmates housed
at correctional facilities in South Carolina and New York will receive
conservatory style training in music theory, performance, and most importantly,
collaborative ensemble work.  In a world
where everyone is forced to stand alone, Musicambia creates a positive
environment for students by using collaborative musical activities to promote
individual growth.  Participants use the
experience to redefine themselves by their potential rather than their past,
creating dedicated and passionate human beings with the confidence and work
ethic required for successful reentry into society.  It's changing a lot of lives and giving hope to families while raising awareness about prisons in the United States. Your donations-and the ticket revenue-will go to support this great cause. Come and make history by getting
sweaty to the most bad-ass piece of music ever written, and help a worthwhile
cause in the process.JOIN THE MOVEMENT
The orchestra is assembled from the
very top free-lancers in NYC. They are playing at a highly reduced rate as a way of
supporting this cause, but we need to pay them, and that’s where you come in. Contribute as much as you can, and the full value of what you give is tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law. Any contribution of over $50 receives admission to the event, and larger donations include perks like drinks with the conductor and your own private house concert with a select group of these superb musicians. 
Please consider making a significant donation to
this fantastic event.  If you would like to support Sheep Island Ensemble
and Musicambia but don’t feel comfortable making a donation to this campaign,
please be bold and share our project with your friends. 
Last but not least, it goes without
saying that we certainly invite you to dance your
hearts out at our benefit concert on September 19th, 2015.  Information and tickets are available here. 
Help us make this happen! Thank you for your help.
Sincerely,
James BlachlyDirector, Experiential
Orchestra/Sheep Island EnsembleSam BodkinFounder and CEO, GroupmuseNathan SchramFounder, Musicambia

story:
THE STORY

FOLLOW handles pressing and sensitive issues about race, religion, family, and equality. It delivers with honesty and truth. FOLLOW personalizes the issues and brings it all home. Home, where we all want to feel safe and welcome.

Marcus and Daniel are getting married.

Their foster son Noah calls them "Dad & Pops". They're a "typical" American family, juggling wedding and adoption plans... until suddenly their world is turned upside down.

Marcus' estranged religious father returns to take over the family business, setting events in motion that threaten to tear the family apart. After years of distance and denial, Marcus has one more chance to reconcile with his father and face the painful memories of his past, before he can raise a family of his own.

THE MUSIC

Music is  like another character in this film.  There is a juke box in the cafe that holds old and new tunes.  There will be a church choir.  We have the good fortune to have the multi talented Frenchie Davis on board to play JADE!

We also have the two-time Academy, Golden Globe and Grammy nominated song writer Allan Rich,  “Run to You” from the movie BODYGUARD,  on board to write the music.

Allan is well known for his Grammy  and Oscar-nominated song "Run to You" (co-written with Jud Friedman), sung by Whitney Houston in “The Bodyguard.” His song "For the First Time" (co-written with Jud Friedman & James Newton Howard) from “One Fine Day” starring Michelle Pfeiffer and George Clooney was also nominated for an Academy Award as well as Golden Globe and Grammy Awards – it was also a #1 adult contemporary song for Kenny Loggins. Allan’s song "I Drive Myself Crazy" (co-written with Ellen Shipley & Rick Nowels) was on NSync’s debut album, which sold 10 million units and was certified “Diamond” by the RIAA. 

We are raising money to develop the MUSIC to this film.  Allan will be writing songs for Frenchie to sing.

THE TEAM

Based on his stage play, Michael Patrick Spillers has written this ensemble character screenplay that blends the right mix of comedy and drama to tell the story.  

Emmy-winning actor/director Melanie Mayron (“Thirtysomething”, “Slap Her She’s French”, “The Baby-Sitters Club,” “Jane the Virgin,” “Switched at Birth”) will utilize her depth of knowledge and her incredibly honed vision as a director to tell our story.

Producers are LeeAnne Matusek, who after seeing the stage play, knew that this film adaptation would be her passion project, and Todd Shotz (Human Rights Campaign Award winner, former development executive on films such as “Live Free or Die Hard,” “Sixteen Blocks,” “Timber Falls” and exec. producer of Paramount’s “Ghost Team One”), who has yearned to work on a project like FOLLOW.

Executive Producers include the legendary film and television producer Howard Rosenman (“Father of the Bride,” “Buffy the Vampire Slayer,” Oscar-winning doc “Common Threads,” “Celluloid Closet,” founder of Project Angel Food), whose background as a gay rights activist is already having a crucial impact on the production.

Also on the team is Jan Miller Corran, Executive Producer, who has produced award-winning documentaries and most recently the feature film “See You In My Dreams” starring Blythe Danner & Sam Elliott, which premiered at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival and went on to a successful theatrical release this past spring. 

WHAT WE NEED  

This campaign will cover the cost of recording original songs and securing the copyrights for already recorded songs.  

If you know movie soundtracks, and I think you do if you're looking at our campaign, you KNOW it costs a lot to create those songs or secure previously recorded songs. 

Some of the costs will be studio rental, payment for musicians and vocalists.

Indie filmmakers usually don't plan for the musical part of their budget for the movie they are making and it can make or break the quality of a film.  

We are also currently raising money to film FOLLOW in Spring 2016.

WHAT YOU GET

We have some GREAT perks that we hope you like and will encourage you to support our quest to get it right!  We want to make sure this beautiful story about love and family has a wonderful soundtrack.  

We cannot do this without you!

story:
Hello!

We are Middlewav (a dream indie band from Olympia, WA). Middlewav consists of Keir Allison-Bourne and Mike Elliott. We have been making music together for 4 years now and have released quite a few albums digitally. Music is our passion and drives us each day so having our first real physical release is a very important milestone in our perceived careers in music. We have been writing and recording new songs for the last year in preparation for our next EP which will be our first time on vinyl. The vinyl will be pressed on 160 gram virgin vinyl (12" 45 rpm) via Pirates Press. The video above is one of the songs from the EP called "Nika". 


What is needed

We have already started the process of pressing the vinyl but we are short on funds for packaging/shipping. It takes a lot of money to press vinyl and we definitely underestimated the final price tag. 


How you can help

You can help by essentially pre-ordering the vinyl for a special sale price of $12 (free shipping). If you want to contribute more money there are a couple special offers such as cool paintings and personal songs written for you :)

story:
It has been written that Rene Bailey is “an unknown national treasure" and that “it seems like a fluke that the name Rene Bailey is not uttered in the same breath as Aretha Franklin, Mavis Staples, Etta James, etc...”

Those who do know revere her highly, for the soul-power of her voice, over-the-top inspirational performances, and her gracious presence as a human being.

Rene Bailey grew up in southern Georgia. Raised in a family of singers, Rene has been singing professionally since she was a young girl, when she toured the gospel circuit during summer break from school.

She's performed with Louis Armstrong, B.B. King, Aretha Franklin, Sam Cooke, Dave Brubeck, Ruth Brown, Paul Anka, and many more...

Rene has been a local legend in the Hudson Valley since 1973, when she came to take a job as the featured vocalist at the Peg Leg Bates Country Club in Kerhonkson, New York. She still resides in Kerhonkson, where she is the choral director at the Samsonville Methodist Church.

Live audiences are consistently blown away by what Rene does with her singing. Despite a dedicated local following and continuously active career, there has never been a Rene Bailey album. Until now.

Production is being overseen at Lone Pine Road Studio in Kingston, NY, by producer/engineer Eli Winograd, a big fan, whose father has been playing gigs with Rene since the 1980's.

Initial recording sessions took place in November 2016. At this point, the project is at a stand-still until money can be raised to finish the album.

We're raising money to fund the following aspects of the project:

1. Repay a loan that covered session musicians, arranger's fee, and piano tuning for the 3 basic tracking sessions.

2. Promotional video production

3. Arranger's fee for horn and string overdub arrangements

4. Horn and string overdub session musicians

5. Backup vocal overdub session 

6. Percussion overdub sessions

7. Rene's fee

8. Studio fees for tracking

9. Mixing

10. Mastering

11. CD manufacture (1000 cds)

Any of the 1000 CD's that are not pre-ordered during the fundraiser or sent out for press review will belong to Rene to sell at gigs.

Any money raised beyond this budget will be applied directly to recording a follow-up Rene Bailey album!!!

In addition, we will do our best to network and promote this album into the music industry in pursuit of new professional opportunities for Rene.

In the event that the entire budget isn't raised, the studio fees, mixing, and mastering costs will be absorbed by labor of love.

This project will be taken to completion no matter what happens in the fundraiser. However, it is most desirable that all of the outstanding hard work be compensated fairly.

Please help by pre-ordering a copy of the album, or several copies to give as gifts to music-loving friends. We're offering discounted prices for multiple copies.

In addition, we're offering some interesting perks, check 'em out!

Please share this fundraiser far and wide with anyone you think might be interested in ordering a copy of an incredible gospel album and supporting Rene Bailey,

Thank you.

story:
THE PROJECT

Hi! My name is Jo-Ann Richards Goffe and I'm a cultural advocate and ethnodoxologist. I am passionate about seeing people from all over the world worship our Creator in their own language and their own music forms. 

As a Jamaican who has traveled to over 30 countries, I have never failed to be amazed at how Reggae ambassador Bob Marley has put our little country on the map. If we are known for nothing else, it is for reggae music. Unfortunately, our rich musical heritage is still on the fringes of many of our churches at best, and there is a very small collection of songs in our repertoire that use our language and music.

Kom Mek Wi Worship, my first album in what is now becoming a series, was released in 2012. It is a collection of 12 songs in the Jamaican language and music genres. The project was born out of a vision to see Jamaicans worshipping as Jamaicans, using their own language and their own music genres.

Some churches have been using the songs in their corporate worship, and many from all walks of life, age groups and even non-Jamaicans have been responding positively to it. In the words of one woman who is from an inner city community in Kingston: "It connects! And it connects me with God!" (Of course she said this in Jamaican/Patwa!)

'Kom Mek Wi Worship 2: Di Revilieshan' will be another such collection as we continue to promote love and unity in Christ through culturally relevant expressions of worship. This next collection focuses on the book of Revelation which is chock full of amazing worship experiences. 

In a nutshell, your support of this project will help Jamaicans everywhere to connect with their true selves, and to connect their true selves to God. It is my firm belief that among other positive outcomes, this will contribute greatly to the reduction of crime and violence in our beautiful island.

 

What We Need & What You Get

US$12,000.00 is our goal for this project. This will cover musicians and producers' fees, studio fees, mixing and mastering, artwork, CD printing, Indiegogo fees and perk fulfillments. 

Here's exactly how we'll use the funds we raise to make this dream a reality:

PERKS!

In addition to the usual perks - digital downloads and signed copies of the CDs - we have other exciting ones such as:

  • Lessons in how to read Jamaican
  • Mission & Arts Skype Presentations by yours truly Jo-Ann Richards
  • Live Jamaican Worship Session Online with the CREW 40:4 performing arts team

What if we far overshoot our goal in this campaign? Our vision is actually much larger than this one album, and so the more you support this campaign, the more we'll be able to work on the other projects lined up after this one. Our intention is to also start a series for children. Currently there is no collection of Jamaican Children's worship music that uses the language and music of the Jamaican children. We hope to fix that!

What if we don't hit our target? Well, by any means necessary (legal, of course - borrowing, selling stuff, etc.), we WILL get the album done. This is our commitment! 

A LITTLE HISTORY ...

I should let you know that this is actually my third album project. The first one - Jo-Ann and Friends: The World is Waiting - was intended to have been just a small in-house project. However, it became much more than that, involving many other persons and groups. It was completed in exactly two months from conception to final product.

The second album - Kom Mek Wi Worship - was again intended to have been a small demo album. I was delivering seminars about congregational music and cultural identity, and was using some of my songs as samples of what I thought could be used in worship - the language and music of the people. People kept asking if the songs were not recorded. Again, from start to finish, the album took exactly two months.

This album may take us a little longer than two months, but not much more. One song is already completed, and we have already started on the others. Collaboration is the name of the game here. From old style roots reggae artiste K Vibes to opera singer Ana Strachan to dynamic reggae gospel artiste Rondell Positive, I will be blending my voice with them all for another real Jamaican worship experience.

Another significant feature of this album will be the expression of the global call to worship, including sounds from other cultures. This helps to reflect the national motto of Jamaica: Out of Many, One People. It also on an even grander scale reflects the worship that is reported in the book of Revelation from every tribe, and country and people and language. So far we have connected with a sitar player from India and a balafonist from Burkina Faso!

Can't contribute? Here's how you can still help:

  • Share, Share, Share with all the people you know that would be happy to support this campaign
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
