story:
Colosseum.TV is the urban movement to Showcase & Discover Raw MC Talent through our iOS app, website and Record Label. We support upcoming grime artists. The best moments in grime don’t usually come from pre-recorded vocals or music videos, they happen live in cyphers when MCs get shelly and thrive off each other’s energy. In grime, the term "shelly" is used as a sign of appreciation for MCs with hard-hitting, never-ending lyrics and riddims. Our UK Grime Competition captures the immersive experience by filming each cypher live in 360º using cutting edge 4k cameras, so you can watch the madness, feel the energy and appreciate the shells and as if standing at the very the center of the cypher, in 360º VR!

MAD!

Up to 240 artists will feature in 24+ cyphers, at 8 city locations with ALL videos published to Facebook and YouTube every Friday between April and September 2017.

The Prize for 15 Winners

A place on the London Eye super-cypher as well as a record deal for a feature-track on the album Grime 360º.

Watch a 360º Cypher

Note: if using a smartphone or tablet, instead open the YouTube or Facebook app and search for “VR CYPHER 2”

 

Associate Producers

The heavy beats for all 360º VR cyphers are provided by our associate producers - Restraint Productionz, Meenz, and Flip'C. Our producers will pair each competition winner with an exclusive beat for the 15-track album Grime 360º, as well as providing mixing and mastering services. Checkout some of their beats below:

Perks to Support the 15 Winning Artists

Grime 360º. Download the album or receive a limited edition CD before its official release, with an exclusive promotional price ONLY on Indiegogo! 

Funding Target. Should we exceed our funding target, 75% of profits relating to pre-orders for Grime 360º (digital download and CD) shall be held back for the 15 winners and divided between them when the album is officially released in September 2017.

Perks to Become Part of the Competition

VIP on the London Eye Final. Watch the super-cypher featuring all 15 competition winners with the Colosseum.TV crew! You'll be filmed as spectator in the 360º cypher video, so bring your best "nod you head to the beat" and freshest kicks!

Feature on the End Credits. We will put your photo onto one of the 360º cypher videos published during the competition. There will be a max of 12 photos per 360º video. BANG BANG!

Limited Edition T-Shirt. Be the envy of your mates with a limited edition, loose fit T-Shirt with our UK GRIME COMPETITION logo on front and back. Available in unisex sizes: S, M, L and XL. Sick bro! 

Audio of all Competition Cyphers. A link to digitally download the audio of at least 25+ cyphers = over 8 hours+ of live grime carnage and shelly MCs. It's a no-brainer fam!

Or simply...

A LARGE UP on Twitter or Facebook. Show your support and Colosseum.TV will give you a public sign of our appreciation. Respect g!

Providing Preferences After Purchase

Some of our perks require backers to provide details - such as Twitter or Facebook username, shipping address, T-Shirt size or photo/name - shortly after ordering we shall email you requesting required information. 

Other Ways to Support Colosseum.TV

We know not everybody is able to support us financially, but you can still support us BIG TIME by:

  • Sharing the Indiegogo love! 
  • Subscribing to our YouTube channel 
  • Following us on Facebook @RealColosseumTV
  • Following us on Twitter @ColosseumTV  
  • Watching and sharing the 360º competition videos

LARGE UP to anybody that supports Colosseum.TV in any way, big or small... We massively appreciate it! #Blessings
story_txt:
Colosseum.TV is the urban movement to Showcase & Discover Raw MC Talent through our iOS app, website and Record Label. We support upcoming grime artists. The best moments in grime don’t usually come from pre-recorded vocals or music videos, they happen live in cyphers when MCs get shelly and thrive off each other’s energy. In grime, the term "shelly" is used as a sign of appreciation for MCs with hard-hitting, never-ending lyrics and riddims. Our UK Grime Competition captures the immersive experience by filming each cypher live in 360º using cutting edge 4k cameras, so you can watch the madness, feel the energy and appreciate the shells and as if standing at the very the center of the cypher, in 360º VR!
MAD!
Up to 240 artists will feature in 24+ cyphers, at 8 city locations with ALL videos published to Facebook and YouTube every Friday between April and September 2017.

The Prize for 15 Winners
A place on the London Eye super-cypher as well as a record deal for a feature-track on the album Grime 360º.

Watch a 360º Cypher
Note: if using a smartphone or tablet, instead open the YouTube or Facebook app and search for “VR CYPHER 2”

 
Associate Producers

The heavy beats for all 360º VR cyphers are provided by our associate producers - Restraint Productionz, Meenz, and Flip'C. Our producers will pair each competition winner with an exclusive beat for the 15-track album Grime 360º, as well as providing mixing and mastering services. Checkout some of their beats below:




Perks to Support the 15 Winning Artists

Grime 360º. Download the album or receive a limited edition CD before its official release, with an exclusive promotional price ONLY on Indiegogo! 

Funding Target. Should we exceed our funding target, 75% of profits relating to pre-orders for Grime 360º (digital download and CD) shall be held back for the 15 winners and divided between them when the album is officially released in September 2017.
Perks to Become Part of the Competition
VIP on the London Eye Final. Watch the super-cypher featuring all 15 competition winners with the Colosseum.TV crew! You'll be filmed as spectator in the 360º cypher video, so bring your best "nod you head to the beat" and freshest kicks!

Feature on the End Credits. We will put your photo onto one of the 360º cypher videos published during the competition. There will be a max of 12 photos per 360º video. BANG BANG!

Limited Edition T-Shirt. Be the envy of your mates with a limited edition, loose fit T-Shirt with our UK GRIME COMPETITION logo on front and back. Available in unisex sizes: S, M, L and XL. Sick bro! 

Audio of all Competition Cyphers. A link to digitally download the audio of at least 25+ cyphers = over 8 hours+ of live grime carnage and shelly MCs. It's a no-brainer fam!

Or simply...
A LARGE UP on Twitter or Facebook. Show your support and Colosseum.TV will give you a public sign of our appreciation. Respect g!

Providing Preferences After Purchase
Some of our perks require backers to provide details - such as Twitter or Facebook username, shipping address, T-Shirt size or photo/name - shortly after ordering we shall email you requesting required information. 
Other Ways to Support Colosseum.TV
We know not everybody is able to support us financially, but you can still support us BIG TIME by:

Sharing the Indiegogo love! 
Subscribing to our YouTube channel 
Following us on Facebook @RealColosseumTV
Following us on Twitter @ColosseumTV  
Watching and sharing the 360º competition videos

LARGE UP to anybody that supports Colosseum.TV in any way, big or small... We massively appreciate it! #Blessings

story:
The Project

"There was a boy A very strange enchanted boy They say he wandered very far, very far Over land and sea A little shy and sad of eye But very wise was he"

Beyond the songs, Nat King Cole’s success in the face of many adversities exemplifies the triumph of talent over ignorance and prejudice. Indeed, the impact of this legendary and pioneering artist continues to cut across the world’s cultural and political boundaries. It is not surprising, therefore, that in the five decades since Nat King Cole’s death, his music continues to have a strong and dedicated following. Can anyone really say that they haven’t been moved by songs like (I Love You For), Sentimental Reasons (No.1 for six weeks), or Nature Boy (No.1 for eight weeks)? Nature Boy – The Music Of Nat King Cole is being arranged and produced by Phillip Victor Bova of Bova Sound with the aim of reintroducing these songs to the contemporary jazz scene. While most of the project’s songs have been given new arrangements, my team’s incredible creativity and emotional capacity ensure that the project remains respectful while radiating a fresh new feel. I am convinced that the solid creative and business teams I have assembled will ensure that the music of Nature Boy will again reverberate across boundaries, appealing not only to Nat’s solid fan base but also drawing in a whole new audience!

The songs chosen for this record address universal, as well as deeply personal, struggles, hopes, loves, regrets and fears. Several of Nat King Cole’s 21 top-ten hits are featured in this project, but each song we’ve selected holds a special place in my heart and inspires me to convey the sentiment, warmth, and sophistication behind every lyric. Together, my very talented group of Canadian musicians and I aspire to reinterpret 11 of Nat King Cole’s outstanding jazz standards.

My musical collaborators include:

• John Fraser Findlay - Juno nominated multi‑instrumentalist;

• Jeff Bova - Grammy award winner keyboardist;

• Kevin Breit - Guitar and Mandolin virtuoso and Juno award winner;

• Jennifer Swartz - Montreal Symphony Orchestra Principal Harpist;

• Petr Cancura (Programming Manager of the Ottawa Jazz Festival) Sax and clarinet;

• Socalled - Rapper

• Rebecca Noelle - Vocalist/Peptides

The Artist

As a black male growing up in the foster care system, music played a major role in my upbringing, it was my retreat. For me, Jazz is more than just a musical genre. It provides an intimate and articulate way of telling stories — stories of love, loss, hope and life. I am very passionate about this project because Nat King Cole’s songs take the listener on a journey through life that everyone can relate to, black or white, young or mature, gay or straight, male or female.

I recorded my first jazz vocal album Somewhere Along The Way while living in Tel Aviv, Israel. Taking this project from inception to completion in a foreign country, hiring and managing arrangers, musicians, producers, arranging for record distribution, video production and promotion, demonstrates my considerable skill at undertaking and completing complex projects. Overall, it was a great experience. My most important take-away was that the experience of building one’s own career in the music business is one of the most rewarding aspects of being a recording artist. With experience, I now recognize that in building one’s own career, it is also important to know when to seek help and guidance that can assist me in achieving my goals. For example, for this project I am working with a manager, professional marketing firms and a producer to develop a strategic marketing plan that will help this project succeed. The success of this campaign will help me to realize my goal of featuring incredible Canadian talent in paying tribute to one of the world’s greatest jazz artists. Personally, it will allow me to take my music career to the next level, to work with a well-established producer,talented guest artists, an innovative marketing firm, a creative publicist, and a dedicated manager to realize my artistic vision.

The Team

Production

Phillip Victor Bova of Bova Sound has put together a phenomenal group of musicians for the recording. Phil’s vision is to make the tracks hipper yet keep them lush with novel instrumentation and arrangements, while staying true to Nat ”King” Cole.

Distributor

CD Baby – will distribute my music on all the most popular download and streaming sites worldwide. With 95+ digital distribution partners CD Baby will get my music for sale in more place than any other music distributor. Also, with CD Baby my music will be available in over 15,000 record stores worldwide and on CDBaby.com.

Management

In talks with Judith Humenick Productions. (JHP) will work with, and support me as a developing jazz artist through career planning, management advice and a range of professional artistic development services, including analysis of performances and recordings,present markets and the tracking of audience and fan responses. This is ongoing process will supply us with valuable information as we work together toward the common goals of developing my brand, audience reach and artistic/financial success. JHP has achieved a solid track record in terms of the “company brand”, JHP artist name recognition, national and international performance contracts and bookings; and development of International business partnerships (including companies in the US, the United Kingdom, Germany and Asia). This work has resulted in a broadly based and growing network of business contacts and relationships within the established and developing markets of the highly competitive International Jazz world.

Marketing

Online and Social Media Marketing

Lead: Suzette Small Weekes, Managing Director BrandingbyWeekes - With expertise in social media and web-marketing, Suzette Small Weekes has supported the development of innovative and successful social media and web-marketing strategies and solutions for a wide range of clients. Execution, network cultivation and analytics are at the core of her competencies in bringing demonstrated results. For the Nature Boy Project, BrandingbyWeekes has developed a comprehensive social media plan to tap into Canadian networks of music influencers, amplify social media exposure for the project, drive traffic to the artist’s website and ultimately grow Antoine L Collins’ fan base in order to increase album sales. To measure efficacy, BrandingbyWeekes will use key performance indicators including social media impressions, major engagement stats and big-picture views of posts, likes, comments, followers and click-throughs.

Media & Public Relations

Lead: Denise Siele, Strategic Events and Public Affairs SEMgroup - An award-winning public affairs professional, Denise has worked with diverse public and private sector clients in the management of local, national and international projects. With an emphasis on message marketing and media relations, Denise Siele has developed a media & public engagement strategy for Nature Boy that capitalizes on the uniqueness of the project. The plan is also anchored in SEMgroup’s access to extensive networks in print, radio and televisionmarkets across Canada. Earned media will support efforts to drive traffic to the artist’s website, cultivate new listeners and increase album sales. Monthly album sales monitoring in targeted markets will assess exposure and engagement with target audiences and inform ongoing media engagement.

Marketing & Public Relations

Lead: Brennan Richardson JACKPINE – We have put a strategy in place to drive sales and raise Antoine’s profile as an artist, both locally and nationally. JACKPINE has developed an innovative video marketing concept to promote Antoine and his music. The marketing strategy is aimed at capitalizing on his strengths as an artist: his talent, his stage presence, and his passion for Jazz as a medium for meaningful story-telling. This approach is aimed at reaching new audiences, as well as the existing Nat King Cole fan-base, through the strategic deployment of digital design, social media, videography and graphic design media.

Radio Marketing

Lead: Jason Gorov Gorov Music – We plan to engage in an eight week radio campaign, in two phases. We work with 200 national and international radio stations, syndicator, satellite providers and internet outlets to make sure the campaign gets the highest amount of coverage possible. Smooth Jazz radio has a potential weekly audience reach of approximately 1 million people from across the globe. The campaign will include eight weeks of contact with radio stations on Antoine’s behalf and a weekly airplay report. Our goal is to maximize airplay and chart success.

Graphic Design

Lead: Mark Michaud Ryan/Smith Creative - A fixture in Ottawa for over 25 years, Ryan/Smith Creative enjoys an admirable track record and a loyal client base. In the hands of our designers, we will give the Nature Boy Project a unique and professional look that will reflect the passion and artistry of Antoine L Collins Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Lets get the word out and make some noise about this campaign post on all your social media sites and tell your family and friends!
  • Feel free to use the indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it, thanks in advance and let's make a hell of an album!!!!

story:
A few songs that will be on the upcoming album:
Neighbors

Lick the Lollipop
Worth It
CALL TO ACTION #1: There are many ways to support this campaign. You can email or message 5-10 friends you think would just absolutely love my music. You can also share the link to this campaign on your social media accounts (Thanks in advance!). 
The Link:  https://igg.me/at/ 
Your support does not have to be financial but it wouldn't hurt if it was.

Hello music lovers and crowdfunders, thank you for landing on my campaign page!

I am Prozhan!  I'm recording my sophomore album (Rockstar) and would really appreciate your support. 

Included in this campaign are some great perks (Yes, I do say so myself). Please note that with your support, I will be able to release an amazing album that we can all be proud of (Or I can be proud of it and you be amazed by it; either way works for me). The perks range in price from $5 to $1,500, ranging from a handwritten thank you note (Alot of thought went into this perk) to a private show at your house (if your house is located in Kristiansand, Norway)!

Some of my previously released music:

The Zoo

Brooklyn

 

I F'd Up


Love Blows

Back Together
 

 

I am in the process of completing my album, it will have 10 songs (Unless I hit a couple stretch goals, then I may add a couple more), that will be available for instant download to those that choose one of the perks where it is included.

Other perks include a hoodie, a t-shirt, my first album, Made in the Bahamas (which currently playing in the background), thank you notes, pink bunnies and so much more (but not that much more).

Your financial support will help with the completion of the album (recording, mixing and mastering), as well marketing. And if we manage to go past the goal (YES!), then stretch goals will include having a professionally made music video for one or more of the songs. 

CALL TO ACTION #2: Any professional videographers out there that would like to volunteer to make a video as a show of support, that would be awesome!

Thank you all again and I look forward to meeting some of you in person!

*Note: The pink bunnies perk was an attempt at humor on my part. No pink bunnies are included as perks (As if I can find any pink bunnies in Norway. I did see a pink elephant riding a segway once and a pink dog, staring in the window at Aquarama. But pink bunnies?). 

Thank you!

story:
Sounds of Summer Music Festival 2017

 We are trying to raise money for a free all ages, family friendly. pet friendly, handicapped accessible music festival. It is always a great day of music  but we are a little like the tree falling in the woods - we need money so we can advertise. We also pay the sound man and we want to bring in a well known musician or band to perform. This year's festival is September 8th from 5:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m.at Town Center Park 2761 Dixwell Ave in Hamden CT.Even if you can't contribute - please spread the word. Thank you.   We are a 501 [c] [3] non-profit and all donations are tax deductible.

story:
My name is Maria Cangiano. I am a singer, songwriter and composer from Argentina who loves to explore  the diversity of Latin American music and crossed it with global musical genres, as well as  Jazz and Classical.  Exploring the richness of our voice is one of my expertise. My musical journey is a mirror of my gipsy life: Born in Bs As from Italian family, I grew up listening to Classical and Latin Folk music thanks to my father and Tango, thanks to my mother.  In the US  I discovered Jazz, blues and afro music. Inspired by my Neapolitan grandfather who was an Opera singer, I left the University world to do my dream: to become a singer.  I premiered as an Opera singer, doing mezzo soprano roles in many well-known NY companies, such as Regina Opera, Dicapo Opera and Amato Opera. Then suddenly my beloved Tango came back to my life. I have the honor to perform  Tango songs in many well-known NY venues such as Blue Note, Joe's Pub, Nuyorican Poets Cafe, Cornelia Street Cafe, Tischman Auditorium, Argentine Consulate, DROM, Tutuma Social Club and sharing the stage with  master musicians, icons of the  NY Tango-Jazz scene, such as Octavio Brunetti, Pedro Giraudo, Fernando Otero, Raul Jaurena, Pablo Jofre Romarion among others.  In 2009-10 my first CD tribute to Astor Piazzolla came out at the Blue Notes of NY and Milan: Ballads for my Life and Death. In 2015, this tribute was premiered in Bs as at the prestigious Catalan Theatre Margarita Xirgu. Creativity continued expanding. It has no limits. My own songs came to life in Corazon de Mujer-Heart of a Woman in 2011, a CD with original songs of mine and the words of Latin American women poets. It  was released at the Joe ́s Pub in NY in 2012, and later presented at the Blue Note and other Bs as venues in 2013-2014.

ABOUT RENACERE (REBORN); PIAZZOLLA X CANGIANO

Piazzolla, however, has always been my favorite,...so you always go back to your first love. This new CD  Renacere (Reborn) is related also to my rebirth returning to my country of origins Argentina, after many years of living abroad.  I feel Piazzolla and  are being born again  through this exciting new musical journey.  My world music heart is inside these songs: they are tango, Latin American folk and afro music, flamenco, classical, jazz and beyond. The project was done in collaboration with a  young master piano and composer from Argentina, Miguel Pereiro. We managed gather some of the best Argentine musicians of today, including Piazzolla´s own grandson Daniel Pipi Piazzolla!!!!!!. It has been hard work and fun at the same time. Thanks to a loan from the Fondo Nacional de las Artes we recorded the material and now EPSA music, one of Argentine leading record companies will distribute it and present it to the Gardel awards and the Latin Grammy. 

Nowadays, independent musicians need to pay for all the production of their music. That is why we are asking your for your support so we can achieve our dream to have our cd out there and get it not only to your hands but also to major music award competitions. 

If you are not able to help us  financially or pre-order the CD, you could help me spread the word and this would also help a lot!!!!!

There are no words to express our appreciation ...thanks thanks and infinite thanks from the bottom of our hearts!!!!!!!

 MUSICIANS IN RENACERE

Miguel Pereiro, arrangements and piano

Hernán Reinaudo, arrangements

Bernardo Monk, saxophone

Fabián Bertero, violin

Nicolás Zacarías and Roberto Amerise, bass

Julián Vat, flute

Quique Sinesi, guitar

Quintino Cinalli and Daniel Pipi Piazzolla, percussion

 

Ahora en español....

Soy una cantautora, compositora e intérprete de música popular argentina  que ama explorar musicalmente la riquísima tradición folclórica latinoamericana, el tango, los ritmos afro  y mezclarla con ritmos de todo el mundo, incluyendo el jazz y el clásico. Mi especialidad es la exploración de la riqueza de la voz  en todas sus manifestaciones.

Soy hija de inmigrantes italianos y crecí en la Argentina escuchando desde niña música clásica y folklore, gracias a mi padre y tango, gracias a mi madre. En Estados Unidos dejé el mundo académico para seguir mi sueño, el de ser cantante. Me entrené como cantante lírica y posteriormente, interpretando tango en la escena neoyorquina. Compartí los escenarios de NY con muchos de los músicos  más talentosos argentinos de la escena del jazz y el tango nuyorquina, tales como Fernando Otero, Octavio Brunetti, Raul Jaurena, Pedro Giraudo, entre otros,  con los que presentamos  Baladas para mi vida y muerte: Tributo a Piazzolla  en el Blue Note de New York y el Blue Note de Milán en el 2009/10.  La creatividad no tiene límites. Inspirada por la poesía latinoamericana,  le puse música posteriormente a poesías de mujeres y de ahí́ nació mi primer trabajo como compositora y cantautora Corazón de Mujer en colaboración con dos de los mejores músicos argentinos : el guitarrista Quique Sinesi y el percusionista Quintino Cinalli. Corazón de mujer se presentó en el Joe ́s Pub y Blue Note de NY y en diversos espacios de la ciudad de Buenos Aires entre el 2011 y el 2014. 

SOBRE RENACERE: PIAZZOLLA X CANGIANO

Piazzolla, sin embargo, ha sido siempre mi favorito y como dice el dicho, siempre se vuelve al primer amor.  Siento que este nuevo   CD Renaceré se relaciona con el renacer que estoy atravesando habiendo regresado a mi país  después de muchos años de vivir afuera.   Tanto  Piazzolla con yo hemos renacido en esta travesía musical. Con estas canciones mi corazón se llena de música del mundo. No es sólo tango, sino también folclore y música negra latinoamericana, flamenco, clásico, jazz y mucho más. El proyecto fue hecho en colaboración con el jóven y talentoso pianista y compositor Miguel Pereiro.   Y logramos hacer partícipes a los mejores músicos argentinos de hoy en día, incluyendo el nieto de Astor Piazzolla, el percusionista  Daniel Pipi Piazzolla!!!!!!.  Ha sido mucho trabajo y mucha diversión también . Gracias al préstamo del Fondo Nacional de las Artes  grabamos el material y ahora la discográfica  EPSA music una de las más importantes de Argentina lo quiere sacar para que llegue a las mano de nuestro público y a los mejores premios de música del mundo, entre ellos el Latin Grammy. 

 Hoy los músicos independientes tenemos que pagar por la producción de nuestros discos  por eso les pedimos su apoyo para poder lograr el sueño de sacar el CD y que llegue a sus manos y a las de los jueces musicales de dichas competencias.  

Sino pueden participar en la campaña por favor pasen la voz y compártanla con sus amigos, eso nos ayudaría inmensamente. No hay palabras para expresar el agradecimiento por su apoyo

Gracias y gracias y miles de gracias desde el fondo más profundo de nuestros corazones. 

 

MUSICOS  IN RENACERE

Miguel Pereiro, arreglos y piano

Hernán Reinaudo, arreglos

Bernardo Monk, saxo

Fabián Bertero, violín

Nicolás Zacarías y Roberto Amerise, contrabajo

Julián Vat, flautas

Quique Sinesi, guitarrra

Quintino Cinalli & Daniel Pipi Piazzolla, percusión
story_txt:
My name is Maria Cangiano. I am a singer, songwriter and composer from Argentina who loves to explore  the diversity of Latin American music and crossed it with global musical genres, as well as  Jazz and Classical.  Exploring the richness of our voice is one of my expertise. My musical journey is a mirror of my gipsy life: Born in Bs As from Italian family, I grew up listening to Classical and Latin Folk music thanks to my father and Tango, thanks to my mother.  In the US  I discovered Jazz, blues and afro music. Inspired by my Neapolitan grandfather who was an Opera singer, I left the University world to do my dream: to become a singer.  I premiered as an Opera singer, doing mezzo soprano roles in many well-known NY companies, such as Regina Opera, Dicapo Opera and Amato Opera. Then suddenly my beloved Tango came back to my life. I have the honor to perform  Tango songs in many well-known NY venues such as Blue Note, Joe's Pub, Nuyorican Poets Cafe, Cornelia Street Cafe, Tischman Auditorium, Argentine Consulate, DROM, Tutuma Social Club and sharing the stage with  master musicians, icons of the  NY Tango-Jazz scene, such as Octavio Brunetti, Pedro Giraudo, Fernando Otero, Raul Jaurena, Pablo Jofre Romarion among others.  In 2009-10 my first CD tribute to Astor Piazzolla came out at the Blue Notes of NY and Milan: Ballads for my Life and Death. In 2015, this tribute was premiered in Bs as at the prestigious Catalan Theatre Margarita Xirgu. Creativity continued expanding. It has no limits. My own songs came to life in Corazon de Mujer-Heart of a Woman in 2011, a CD with original songs of mine and the words of Latin American women poets. It  was released at the Joe ́s Pub in NY in 2012, and later presented at the Blue Note and other Bs as venues in 2013-2014.ABOUT RENACERE (REBORN); PIAZZOLLA X CANGIANOPiazzolla, however, has always been my favorite,...so you always go back to your first love. This new CD  Renacere (Reborn) is related also to my rebirth returning to my country of origins Argentina, after many years of living abroad.  I feel Piazzolla and  are being born again  through this exciting new musical journey.  My world music heart is inside these songs: they are tango, Latin American folk and afro music, flamenco, classical, jazz and beyond. The project was done in collaboration with a  young master piano and composer from Argentina, Miguel Pereiro. We managed gather some of the best Argentine musicians of today, including Piazzolla´s own grandson Daniel Pipi Piazzolla!!!!!!. It has been hard work and fun at the same time. Thanks to a loan from the Fondo Nacional de las Artes we recorded the material and now EPSA music, one of Argentine leading record companies will distribute it and present it to the Gardel awards and the Latin Grammy. Nowadays, independent musicians need to pay for all the production of their music. That is why we are asking your for your support so we can achieve our dream to have our cd out there and get it not only to your hands but also to major music award competitions. 
If you are not able to help us  financially or pre-order the CD, you could help me spread the word and this would also help a lot!!!!!
There are no words to express our appreciation ...thanks thanks and infinite thanks from the bottom of our hearts!!!!!!!
 MUSICIANS IN RENACERE
Miguel Pereiro, arrangements and pianoHernán Reinaudo, arrangementsBernardo Monk, saxophoneFabián Bertero, violinNicolás Zacarías and Roberto Amerise, bassJulián Vat, fluteQuique Sinesi, guitarQuintino Cinalli and Daniel Pipi Piazzolla, percussion Ahora en español....Soy una cantautora, compositora e intérprete de música popular argentina  que ama explorar musicalmente la riquísima tradición folclórica latinoamericana, el tango, los ritmos afro  y mezclarla con ritmos de todo el mundo, incluyendo el jazz y el clásico. Mi especialidad es la exploración de la riqueza de la voz  en todas sus manifestaciones.Soy hija de inmigrantes italianos y crecí en la Argentina escuchando desde niña música clásica y folklore, gracias a mi padre y tango, gracias a mi madre. En Estados Unidos dejé el mundo académico para seguir mi sueño, el de ser cantante. Me entrené como cantante lírica y posteriormente, interpretando tango en la escena neoyorquina. Compartí los escenarios de NY con muchos de los músicos  más talentosos argentinos de la escena del jazz y el tango nuyorquina, tales como Fernando Otero, Octavio Brunetti, Raul Jaurena, Pedro Giraudo, entre otros,  con los que presentamos  Baladas para mi vida y muerte: Tributo a Piazzolla  en el Blue Note de New York y el Blue Note de Milán en el 2009/10.  La creatividad no tiene límites. Corazón de mujer se presentó en el Joe ́s Pub y Blue Note de NY y en diversos espacios de la ciudad de Buenos Aires entre el 2011 y el 2014. SOBRE RENACERE: PIAZZOLLA X CANGIANOPiazzolla, sin embargo, ha sido siempre mi favorito y como dice el dicho, siempre se vuelve al primer amor.  Siento que este nuevo   CD Renaceré se relaciona con el renacer que estoy atravesando habiendo regresado a mi país  después de muchos años de vivir afuera.   Tanto  Piazzolla con yo hemos renacido en esta travesía musical. Con estas canciones mi corazón se llena de música del mundo. No es sólo tango, sino también folclore y música negra latinoamericana, flamenco, clásico, jazz y mucho más. El proyecto fue hecho en colaboración con el jóven y talentoso pianista y compositor Miguel Pereiro.   Y logramos hacer partícipes a los mejores músicos argentinos de hoy en día, incluyendo el nieto de Astor Piazzolla, el percusionista  Daniel Pipi Piazzolla!!!!!!.  Ha sido mucho trabajo y mucha diversión también . Gracias y gracias y miles de gracias desde el fondo más profundo de nuestros corazones. 
 
MUSICOS  IN RENACERE
Miguel Pereiro, arreglos y piano
Hernán Reinaudo, arreglos
Bernardo Monk, saxo
Fabián Bertero, violín
Nicolás Zacarías y Roberto Amerise, contrabajo
Julián Vat, flautas
Quique Sinesi, guitarrra
Quintino Cinalli & Daniel Pipi Piazzolla, percusión

story:
Hello everyone!

My name is Jay Terrell and I am raising money to pursue my passion in a music career.  I am 25 years old and have been creating music for nearly half of my life. Music is a very big part of my life and I believe that it is one thing that everyone in the world has in common, no matter who they are or were they are from. While spending 4 years in the Marine Corps, meeting many people and seeing a lot of the world, my friends and I all joked around about me having a music career when I got out. I parted ways with the Marine Corp June 2016. Since then, I actually have tried to take my music seriously. This led me to release of my first single "Drinks Up". Recently I also found out that my beautiful wife is pregnant with a baby boy! I would love to continue releasing and sharing my music with the world but as you can guess it is not that cheap. This indiegog fund is to raise money for me to be able to release my first EP. All of the funds will cover studio cost and the release of more of my music. Every contribution will be a blessing and very much appreciated. Money is not everything though and if you are not able or simply do not feel comfortable giving your hard earned money away I totally understand. Passing along the word will be just as appreciated. Thank you so much for your time and contribution! Have a wonderful day!

story:
Summary

'Evolution' is about growth and change. This is on a mental, physical, musical, and/or spiritual level. There can be positive or negative evolution, which is a reflection of the decisions one makes in life. I wrote this album from the perspective of my personal  evolution, as a reflection of myself. The songs were written over the past year, each being written directly from the state of consciousness I was in at the time. I did my best to not compromise any of the music by overthinking and such, but to just let whatever I was feeling flow through me naturally. In that way, the songs are just who I am. I might also add that without realizing my own ability to control my evolution, the album and a lot of the things I do wouldn't exist. I want this album to show people that they can transform their lives and help others through the necessary effort. It doesn't matter how low or high you are, you can make the decision to evolve yourself to whoever you want to be. It just takes focusing all of yourself on that person and following your heart. This album and my story is meant to be a testament to that. With your help we will be able to achieve this project's full potential. 

Osis consists of young and very talented musicians from Utah. That includes:

Myself (Tyler Webb) - Composer, Trumpet, Piano

Jacob White - Tenor Sax, Soprano Sax

Johnny Stallings - Piano, Wurlitzer

Ashton Young - Electric Guitar

Sebastian Arias Bonilla - Electric Bass

Chris Shemwell - Drums

Our music draws from many stylistic sources, which is why we call ourselves a 'jazz fusion group.' It includes elements of improvisation as jazz does, but also draws inspiration from funk and hip-hop. We do our best to please all ears, by including complexities in the music while maintaining a groove that feels good to listen to. Our music is meant for all ages and types of people, and we hope that through this campaign we will be able to spread the music to those people.

Fundraising Goal

To do this project right, we are going to need a total of $5500. Broken down, that looks like:

Recording - $2000

Mixing/Mastering - $2700

CD Production - $500

Marketing/Promotion - $200

Album Art - $100

Creating an album like this is expensive, that's why any sort of donation is greatly appreciated and taken with love. Osis' wants to make it worth it for you too, so in return for your donations we are offering things like: digital downloads, signed hard copies, skype/face-to-face private lessons, a night to jam with the band, comp tickets to the album release show, and even private performances. Most importantly, we will be able to share our music with you.

As this is our debut album, we wanted to do it right, and that's why we are reaching out for support. Even if you can't donate, a simple share on social media makes a big difference. We appreciate anything, and we can't wait to share the final product with our supporters! Thank you for taking the time to read, and stay tuned for what's to come!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Chris Walsh, and I am an American singer and conductor who lives in Riga, Latvia. 

Music has the power to inspire action and draw attention to important causes and events, and the Middle Eastern refugee crisis is arguably the most important cause of our time. I would like to raise awareness for the crisis - to tell stories that show that the refugee experience is universal, whether it's Syrians in 2016 or Latvians in the 1940s. I have asked the accomplished British composer Gabriel Jackson to tell these stories in a new commissioned work of music: a 25-minute classical piece for four solo voices.

This new work will interweave stories of modern-day refugees with the words of Latvian emigré writers from the 20th century. And though our work is limited in scope to the story of two refugee crises, we know that the words will be identifiable for anyone who has been impacted by the refugee experience in the last century. We hope that this piece will encourage audiences to reflect on what it means to be a refugee, and what it means to help.

What We Need & What You Get

Of course, commissioning and performing a new piece of music costs money. Though it doesn't represent the complete cost of the project, I am seeking to raise $10,000 to get this project started on stable ground. We will seek additional support in the form of grants and corporate donations to help make this project a reality.

Your donation will help to cover all of the costs involved in this undertaking: paying the composer for his work, compensating the singers for their time and talents, organizing and publicizing performances in Latvia and in countries impacted by the refugee crisis.

We've created perks that will bring our donors as close as possible to the creative process, offering direct connections with the composer and performers. We hope that these perks will provide donors a rare glimpse into the process of creating a new work of art and show how their donation is making a difference in the world.

Any money that we raise beyond our $10,000 goal will support our efforts to perform this new work for as many audiences as possible.

The Impact

It is easy to go about our daily lives without considering how the refugee crisis affects us, or what we would do if we were placed in that situation. However, I think that many would be surprised to realize that the refugee experience is part of their own family history. It will soon be part of mine: my fiancee's grandparents fled the Soviet Union in the 1940s, and they met in a displaced persons camp in Germany.

As we connect the stories of modern-day refugees with those of 20th century Latvian refugees, we hope that audience members will consider whether the refugee experience has impacted their lives and their history. While this work may not encourage audience members to open their homes, we hope that it will encourage them to open their hearts and support displaced persons around the world in whatever way they can.

This is not just a project about the past and the present - it is a project about the future. Today's refugee crisis will not be the last, and we must all consider what we would do if we were placed in that position. How would we want the world to respond?

Risks & Challenges

While developing and performing a new work of music is a complicated process, Gabriel Jackson and I are experienced in bringing projects like these to a successful conclusion.

Gabriel's portfolio of works includes hundreds of successful, powerful pieces for a variety of ensembles. He has written works for the BBC Singers, BBC Proms, church and collegiate choirs throughout the United Kingdom, and the famous Youth Choir "Kamēr..." in Latvia.

As a graduate of the Choral Conducting program at Northwestern University, I learned the ins and outs of commissioning new works from Donald Nally - one of America's most prominent conductors of new music who has successfully commissioned hundreds of pieces throughout his career.

Other Ways You Can Help

I hope that you will consider donating to help this project come to life. However, if you are unable to donate at this time or if you are looking to do more, there are other ways to help:

- Spread the word about this project. Social media is a powerful tool, and your Facebook posts, tweets, Snapchats, Instagrams, and blog posts all help to share our campaign with new audiences. Of course, a personal recommendation is even stronger - please email this campaign to those who you think will find it interesting, or tell them in person. No publicity is more powerful than word of mouth.

- Donate to other organizations. This New York Times article is a helpful resource to find other organizations that need our help. 

- Volunteer. Whether it's by helping out at a local relocation center, advocating to elected officials, or simply praying, there are many ways that you can give your time to improve the lives of refugees. Check out this article for some tips.

story:
SO! 

My name is Sanah Kadoura! It has been my whole life! 

.....AND I PLAY THE DRUMS!

I've spent the last 5 years writing the music for this album "Hawk Eyes" And now its time to get the band in the studio and record!

I have been very lucky to have some of the most AMAZING musicians in the world behind this project and inspiring me from the beginning. "Hawk Eyes" will feature ALL ORIGINAL COMPOSITIONS. Telling a story. Ups and downs. Love. Anger. Sadness and everything in between.

 

A LITTLE about me:

Calgary, Alberta is where it all started.......... 

One day I was walking along... and a saw a drum set...  We locked eyes.. Well, actually, i saw it, it didn't see me.... it was black and had fire coming up from the bottom... It was the first time i ever fell in love... I was 12.

I got my hands on some drumsticks when i was 14. I went to memorize every drum line solo in the movie 'Drum line'  on its VHS case in my room (its in shreds now)  (Someone tag Nick Cannon... lol) (Maybe he wants to donate lol)

Anyways, that's where it started... I went on to do my Bachelors Degree in Jazz Studies and then my Masters Degree in Music in Jazz Performance (Drums) which brought me to New York City. 

 

I now live here, perform, compose, produce, teach and do whatever i can to help music grow!

 

WHERE YOUR DONATION WOULD GO!

~Studio Cost

~Musician Funding

~Editing/Mixing

~Mastering

~Art Work/Design

~Merchandise Production

~Radio Promo

~Press Promo

 

HAWK EYES

First of all. My heart. I may be a goof ball in real life, but i've never been so serious. 

Music saved my life. Now i want to do that for other people. Hopefully many other people.

If you cant donate, there are other ways to help! You can spread the word and share the news!

If you can, there are some pretty awesome things to check out in the 'perks" section!

Enjoy!

AND

Thank you for reading! 

Sanah!

It has been my whole life! .....AND I PLAY THE DRUMS!I've spent the last 5 years writing the music for this album "Hawk Eyes" And now its time to get the band in the studio and record!I have been very lucky to have some of the most AMAZING musicians in the world behind this project and inspiring me from the beginning. "Hawk Eyes" will feature ALL ORIGINAL COMPOSITIONS. Telling a story. Ups and downs. Love. Anger. Sadness and everything in between. A LITTLE about me:Calgary, Alberta is where it all started.......... One day I was walking along... and a saw a drum set...  We locked eyes.. Well, actually, i saw it, it didn't see me.... it was black and had fire coming up from the bottom... It was the first time i ever fell in love... I was 12.I got my hands on some drumsticks when i was 14. I went to memorize every drum line solo in the movie 'Drum line'  on its VHS case in my room (its in shreds now)  (Someone tag Nick Cannon... lol) (Maybe he wants to donate lol)Anyways, that's where it started... I went on to do my Bachelors Degree in Jazz Studies and then my Masters Degree in Music in Jazz Performance (Drums) which brought me to New York City.  I now live here, perform, compose, produce, teach and do whatever i can to help music grow! WHERE YOUR DONATION WOULD GO!~Studio Cost~Musician Funding~Editing/Mixing~Mastering~Art Work/Design~Merchandise Production~Radio Promo~Press Promo HAWK EYESFirst of all. My heart. I may be a goof ball in real life, but i've never been so serious. Music saved my life. Now i want to do that for other people. Hopefully many other people.If you cant donate, there are other ways to help! You can spread the word and share the news!If you can, there are some pretty awesome things to check out in the 'perks" section!Enjoy!ANDThank you for reading! Sanah!

story:
~I would like to make a smooth jazz album for the entire world to enjoy~

My goal is to become a saxophone player whose music can be enjoyed all over the world.
There are still so many things I need to learn and experience though.
In order to take my first step I would like to produce an album which breaks down all boundaries

WaKaNa's Profile

Born in Chiba, Japan.
Central member of the young and upcoming pop instrumental band LUCA.
Participated in the Monster jazzy hip-hop compilation album "IN YA MELLOW TONE", a series which has sold over 340,000 copies.
Has performed with numerous musicians both in Japan and overseas.
A featured artist of instrument maker Cannonball, performing at the Cannonball 20th anniversary concert in Los Angeles USA. Currently active both in Japan and overseas.

- Hello to everyone from INDIEGOGO This is WaKaNa, a sax player from Chiba, Japan.

It has been 14 years since I started playing the saxophone in my high school brass band. As a professional, I have spent 10 years searching for the sound that is "me".
After graduating from the Shobi Musical College, I have been performing both in LUCA, the band which I joined during my time as a student, and also as a solo artist.
I have experienced so many different types of music, and increasingly had chances to perform in Japan and in Asia as well.

 

-Is Wakana’s CD different from LUCA’s? -

- Yes. It is also instrumental music with saxophone, but I would like to try a little bit different sound. I’m proud of playing with LUCA’s members. I think my solo activity also gives publicity to LUCA’s music. So from this point, I would like to perform in both styles,


Re:plus at Movement Fest Korea


Play Japanese national anthem at QVC Marine field



- Up until now, The thought of performing in not only Japan, but overseas has carried me to my goals. However, in 2016, when I traveled to Los Angeles, which is the center of my beloved smooth jazz, I was able to see the concerts of artist I admired and was even able to jam with them. I felt the urge to find the music that was me, "WaKaNa's Music", to make an album, and have my own concert in the USA even stronger than before.


Los Angeles, USA

 


What is Smooth Jazz?

- Smooth Jazz is usually instrumental. In place of vocals, usually a saxophone, keyboard or string instrument will play a catchy lead melody, backed by a groovy rythm. Elements of R&B, Soul and Jazz are found in this genre.

Perhaps not many people are familiar with smooth jazz, however there are actually many chances to hear it in cafes, shopping centers, and around town. In Japan, smooth jazz is not a major focus of magazines or TV shows, and it is difficult to consider it a major music genre. When I went to America in 2016, I was touched by how much the audience appreciated smooth jazz and felt showed a love for the music.

I wish to take the lead and share that love with everyone. Because smooth jazz is not well known in Japan, I wish to give more and more people in Japan a chance to hear smooth jazz and know what wonderful music it is.

 

What kind of CD?

- I plan to produce a CD with Greg Manning, who is a talented and wonderful music producer.
I also plan to have Los Angeles musicians participate in this CD. I promise to make an album which is gorgeous, groovy and smooth, which I am sure that everyone will enjoy.

We will produce smooth jazz with genuine smooth jazz players.
 


Greg Manning's profile    http://greg-manning.com/bio/
 


Message from Greg

“I was cruising the internet when I came across a YouTube video of a young sax player. The phrasing and the tone of the horn immediately grabbed my intention. The fact that she’s cute as a button didn’t even enter my mind … ;-)

I later found out that her name is Wakana Inamura. Fate would have it that she had planned a trip to the Newport Beach Jazz Festival and it just so happened that I played there.
It was the perfect occasion to meet her for the first time and talk about a future collaboration.

I’m very excited to be working with Wakana on her new CD that is geared towards the US market. You can never predict how the audience will react to a CD, but Wakana has all the right stuff to make a big impact in this genre.” 　


What happens by doing crowdfunding?
- It will be a great opportunity to let the people I haven't met yet know my music. My hometown, Chiba prefecture, is close to Tokyo, and also a place full of nature.
Of course, there is plenty of space for big concerts or events. If my crowdfunding is successful, I will hold events like music festivals and call together musicians from all over the world. It will  let a lot of people know about my hometown and my music.

In particular,  “Smooth Jazz” music has not spread throughout Japan yet, and it needs opportunities to be heard. I would like to take a lead in planning events or concerts. I think my first CD will be a work by us all together. I hope it will be something special for us!
 

How to send WaKaNa's CD to people around the world.
- We would like to distribute this music to the world by using digital distribution systems like iTunes. Also, we will sell music at my official site and music sales sites both within and outside Japan. In addition, we will put CDs on sale at record shops.


Return

For a gift of
＄30.00 or more;
 - the physical CD, signed by WaKaNa

＄50.00 or more;
 - the physical CD, signed by WaKaNa + mp3 downloads of unreleased songs

＄100.00 or  more;
 - the physical CD, signed by WaKaNa + mp3 downloads of unreleased songs +"Thank you"movie

＄300.00 or  more;
 - the physical CD, signed by WaKaNa + mp3 downloads of unreleased songs +"Thank you" movie + a cover song of your choice played by yours truly, or record a sax track to your song! (1 song)

＄500.00 or  more;
 - the physical CD, signed by WaKaNa + mp3 downloads of unreleased songs +"Thank you"movie + A cover song of your choice played by yours truly, or record a sax track to your song! (1 song) + your name in the credits


Thanks for message！
 

Jack Cohen
Producer Smooth Saturdays with Aysha TV Show
The SmoothJazzLiveRadioShow.com


 

I had the pleasure of meeting the lovely Japanese Saxophonist/ Composer Wakana Inamura in Tokyo, Japan.
Also I spent several days with her in the USA during Namm Week. Wakana is an energetic charismatic and skilled performer

who played with many elite Jazz musicians during the week at the Cannonball Saxophone Jam, Legere Jam, Innervision Records Jam

Darryl Williams Jam session and many more. Many highly respected musicians complimented her playing and she brought the house down wherever she went.

I have also played Wakana's compositions on my Radio Station and I can tell you she is a gifted composer who writes beautiful melodies.

Please support Wakana's project and help bring her gorgeous melodies to the world.


Tevis Laukat
President of Cannonball Musical Instruments


“The first time I met Wakana was in Japan, where I shared the stage with her in one of our dealer’s music stores. As she introduced herself to me, I immediately felt her warmth and sincerity, which transferred beautifully to her playing when we were on stage. She is a vibrant, exciting player who has a gift for telling stories through her improvisation. We were also interviewed by a magazine while we were there, and in that interview I was very impressed with her comments about our instruments and how it helps her to express what is in her heart. Cannonball is proud to have her represent us in Japan as one of our endorsers. We feel that she has a very bright and promising future as a saxophonist because of her interesting approach to every musical situation.”

Peter White
Guitarist,Producer

Wakana is one of the brightest upcoming stars of saxophone. I love her soulful sound!


Gabriel Mark Hasselbach
Recording artist and producer 

Wakana is a stellar sax stylist, unique to Japan, but competitive in the industry and ready to break into the world stage! 

and more!!


Finaly
 

I am not sponsored by a company. But having graduated from a music college, I have the confidence to do this project on my own.

Wanting to play in a variety of venues, I have been performing not only at live house, but also on the street, on ships, on the beach, at restaurants, shopping centers, ballparks events in many places, and.

Sometimes I succeeded, but sometimes not. Anyway I am very happy now because I can continue to play the saxophone and music. I want to express my life and character through playing the saxophone.
First of all, via successful crowdfunding, I hope to create a very unique CD, full of meaningfull moments + memories,

I will try my best to give you the benefit. Thank you very much for your support.
 

Official HP : http://vvakana.wixsite.com/wakana/
Facebook : www.facebook.com/WaKaNa.playsax

（映像協力 8centi）

story:
Hello World,

My name is Manny Cabo.  You may or may not recognize me from my four chair turn rendition of Whitesnake's iconic song  "Here I Go Again" on The Voice.  That moment, that song and that journey was a testament to my 17 year career of perseverance as an artist like so many millions out there trying to solidify their dreams.  For me, it was never about winning; it was about living in the moment and embracing the opportunity to not only show the world my passion through music but to also embark on a journey with a family of other beautiful artists in their pursuits as well while also helping them bring their dreams to fruition through appreciation, motivation and inspiration.  I was flattered by the millions of supporters who thought I could win it all. Pharrell Williams  even called my voice "Stratospheric" hence the title of my first EP which took #1 as the most played and top rated POP ROCK EP"s worldwide since it's release this past April; but as far as I was concerned, I won the moment I was called out to Hollywood for the executive auditions.  My career up until this point both as a commercial fashion photographer as well as a musician, was comprised of a series of hardships and setbacks that have all lend themselves to my over all gratitude of life because they made me realize the clarity was always in the contrast but so many of us fail to see it and hence terminate their careers prematurely due to the deceptive imagery of fear.  Since my last note on the voice, I have made it my mission to touch as many lives by giving them hope and encouragement through my efforts of spreading love and peace especially within the artistic community.  I have performed for the American Cancer Society, donated my first guitar for charity, spoken about the tragedies steming from Bullying in the inner city school districts while inspiring them to be unique, raised awareness on autism and even supported one of my biggest supporters by attending his graduation and even support the protection of our wildlife and the lands they inhabit.  I have always shared the spotlight in my concert events with fellow voice contestants and up incoming artists to give them the opportunities that I was never given.  The truth is the bigger I become the more I can give and inspire others to do the same but the Grimm reality is that I cannot do this on my own.  I am only as strong as my team of global supporters dictate.  The #MannyPack group was created by my most passionate supporters ( Atira Hatton and Justin Drummond) predicated on the belief that I can touch the world through my passion for giving and pursuit of Peace and Love and this new EP is my dedication towards that belief.  To Join the #MannyPack Group visit https://www.facebook.com/groups/875009605960458/.   I lost everything with respect to income going on the voice but my faith kept my career going with all your support and I ask all of you who believe in my passions to assist me in the financial responsibilities of consummating this campaign with me.  I estimate  the total  sum of $13,600 will assist me in solidifying the following:

1.  Record, Mix and Master "TIMELESS"  (4 Song EP)

2. Design the artwork, print and submit all materials for distribution.

3. Social Marketing Upkeep 

4. New merchandise and all paraphernalia  for up and coming shows, events,

     benefits,  and giveaways.  

5. A video for the "Selected" song to launch the release campaign.

6. To pay for all postage towards rewards and admin responsibilities.

7. Transportation expenses to and from recording facilities, radio interviews etc. 

8. Artist photoshoot, postproduction, equipment rentals.

 

I have done my very best to approximate this budget but we all know Murphy's Law but thankfully I will sustain my optimism in all scenarios.  My disclaimer in closing is simply this; I'm not out to change the world I just want to do my part in spreading Love and Peace the only way I can and that is through my artistic passions with high hopes of making this amazing world we live in a better place.  Please help me get the word out by sharing this campaign with your friends and loved ones on all social media platforms.  Follow me @mannycabomusic   As Always, Much Love & Peace.

story:
Cow Haus Presents 20th Anniversary 

In the fall of 1996, The Cow Haus, the now legendary Tallahassee live music venue, re-opened in it's new location on St. Francis St in the All Saints neighborhood and Cow Haus Presents was born! Brent Pitts, Brett Brewer, and myself, Brian Giblett, were the owners and I booked all the bands. Now, 20 years later, after booking shows at The Cow Haus, The Beta Bar, The Engine Room, The Side Bar and many other great venues here in town, we are celebrating with a series of shows featuring the reunions of some great Tallahassee bands as well some current bands who have ties going back to that scene. This kicks off with shows on Friday Nov. 4, Saturday Nov. 5 and Sunday Nov. 6 at The Side Bar!

In order for these shows to happen, members of some of these bands have to fly back to Tallahassee, and, since most of these musicians aren't particularly wealthy, we are trying to help pay for the costs of these flights, along with other show expenses, such as advertising, sound and lights/rental of the venue, and the production of Cow Haus 20th Anniversary merchandise, which will be available for sale at the shows and is also offered in perks that you can receive for donating here.

The more money that we raise here, the more of these expenses we can cover. And that means that more of the money that comes in from advance tickets and day of show tickets can go to these bands who have been so gracious and willing to put in the time and effort to make these shows possible, instead of only covering expenses.

The Shows

Here's more info on all the shows that this campaign is supporting:

Friday, November 4 @ The Side Bar - Parachute Pants (80s cover band) w/ The Casual T's & The Mustardseeds - doors @ 8pm, show @ 9pm, $10 advance, $13 day of show, $2 under 21 fee charged at the door

Saturday, November 5 @ The Side Bar - Baccone Dolce w/ Insect Fear & Buffalo Buffalo - doors @ 8pm, show @ 9pm, $10 advance, $13 day of show, $2 under 21 fee charged at the door

Sunday, November 6 @ The Side Bar - Dr. Feelgood (Mötley Crüe tribute) w/ The Stronghold & 27 South - doors @ 7pm, show @ 8pm, $10 advance, $13 day of show, $2 under 21 fee charged at the door

More info about these first three shows is available in the Facebook event page for them here:  https://www.facebook.com/events/1039898462745612

Advance tickets for these 3 shows go on sale to the general public Fri Sept 23 at 10am, but supporters of this campaign have a chance to get tickets NOW and reserve your spot at the show of your choice, or at all of them!

This campaign will also be supporting these shows:

Saturday, November 19 @ The Side Bar - The Cabrones (Ramones tribute band) w/ Quiver & bands tba

Saturday, December 10 @ The Side Bar - The Revolution (Prince tribute band) w/ Frankenfinger & Little Sluggers

What We Need

We are trying to raise at $4500 to put towards these shows. Here is where that money will be used:

  • For the 5 shows listed above, we will need to pay for at least 6 round-trip plane tickets to Tallahassee that will cost around $400-$600 each.
  • The cost of renting the club (including sound & lights and security) will be about $350-$500 per night
  • The cost of producing the Cow Haus 20th Anniversary merchandise will run about $800-$1000
  • We are not expecting to pay for all costs from this campaign but hope to raise enough to make a significant dent and then be able to pay each of the bands playing a much bigger portion of the show revenues.

What you can get for your generous donation:

  • Codes and links to download/stream music from Baccone Dolce, Frankenfinger and Insect Fear
  • A package of copies of 10 vintage Beta Bar fliers from the early 2000s
  • A chance to buy individual tickets or a 3-noght pass before the general public and a chance to buy 4 or 5 night passes which are not available anywhere else
  • A package of Cow Haus Presents 20th Anniversary merchandise including a t-shirt, a sticker, and a button
  • Original fliers designed for these 5 shows, each one signed by all members of each band that plays
  • Passes to all Cow Haus Presents shows for the rest of fall 2016, for fall of 2016 and spring of 2017, or for the next 5 years!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, there's still plenty of ways to help fund these shows:

  • Help get the word out about this campaign. Share the link for this page on all of your social media sites, like Facebook and Twitter, using the share tools at the top of this page!
  • Tell your friends to check out our campaign and to come to the shows when they happen
  • Support local music in Tallahassee! Whether it's a Cow Haus Presents show or a house show, go out and see local bands, support the scene, expose yourself to new music!
story_txt:
Cow Haus Presents 20th Anniversary 
In the fall of 1996, The Cow Haus, the now legendary Tallahassee live music venue, re-opened in it's new location on St. Francis St in the All Saints neighborhood and Cow Haus Presents was born! Brent Pitts, Brett Brewer, and myself, Brian Giblett, were the owners and I booked all the bands. Now, 20 years later, after booking shows at The Cow Haus, The Beta Bar, The Engine Room, The Side Bar and many other great venues here in town, we are celebrating with a series of shows featuring the reunions of some great Tallahassee bands as well some current bands who have ties going back to that scene. This kicks off with shows on Friday Nov. 4, Saturday Nov. 5 and Sunday Nov. 6 at The Side Bar!
In order for these shows to happen, members of some of these bands have to fly back to Tallahassee, and, since most of these musicians aren't particularly wealthy, we are trying to help pay for the costs of these flights, along with other show expenses, such as advertising, sound and lights/rental of the venue, and the production of Cow Haus 20th Anniversary merchandise, which will be available for sale at the shows and is also offered in perks that you can receive for donating here.
The more money that we raise here, the more of these expenses we can cover. And that means that more of the money that comes in from advance tickets and day of show tickets can go to these bands who have been so gracious and willing to put in the time and effort to make these shows possible, instead of only covering expenses.
The Shows
Here's more info on all the shows that this campaign is supporting:
Friday, November 4 @ The Side Bar - Parachute Pants (80s cover band) w/ The Casual T's & The Mustardseeds - doors @ 8pm, show @ 9pm, $10 advance, $13 day of show, $2 under 21 fee charged at the door
Saturday, November 5 @ The Side Bar - Baccone Dolce w/ Insect Fear & Buffalo Buffalo - doors @ 8pm, show @ 9pm, $10 advance, $13 day of show, $2 under 21 fee charged at the door
Sunday, November 6 @ The Side Bar - Dr. Feelgood (Mötley Crüe tribute) w/ The Stronghold & 27 South - doors @ 7pm, show @ 8pm, $10 advance, $13 day of show, $2 under 21 fee charged at the door
More info about these first three shows is available in the Facebook event page for them here:  https://www.facebook.com/events/1039898462745612
Advance tickets for these 3 shows go on sale to the general public Fri Sept 23 at 10am, but supporters of this campaign have a chance to get tickets NOW and reserve your spot at the show of your choice, or at all of them!
This campaign will also be supporting these shows:
Saturday, November 19 @ The Side Bar - The Cabrones (Ramones tribute band) w/ Quiver & bands tba
Saturday, December 10 @ The Side Bar - The Revolution (Prince tribute band) w/ Frankenfinger & Little Sluggers

What We Need
We are trying to raise at $4500 to put towards these shows. Here is where that money will be used:

For the 5 shows listed above, we will need to pay for at least 6 round-trip plane tickets to Tallahassee that will cost around $400-$600 each.
The cost of renting the club (including sound & lights and security) will be about $350-$500 per night
The cost of producing the Cow Haus 20th Anniversary merchandise will run about $800-$1000
We are not expecting to pay for all costs from this campaign but hope to raise enough to make a significant dent and then be able to pay each of the bands playing a much bigger portion of the show revenues.

What you can get for your generous donation:

Codes and links to download/stream music from Baccone Dolce, Frankenfinger and Insect Fear
A package of copies of 10 vintage Beta Bar fliers from the early 2000s
A chance to buy individual tickets or a 3-noght pass before the general public and a chance to buy 4 or 5 night passes which are not available anywhere else
A package of Cow Haus Presents 20th Anniversary merchandise including a t-shirt, a sticker, and a button
Original fliers designed for these 5 shows, each one signed by all members of each band that plays
Passes to all Cow Haus Presents shows for the rest of fall 2016, for fall of 2016 and spring of 2017, or for the next 5 years!


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate, there's still plenty of ways to help fund these shows:

Help get the word out about this campaign. Share the link for this page on all of your social media sites, like Facebook and Twitter, using the share tools at the top of this page!
Tell your friends to check out our campaign and to come to the shows when they happen
Support local music in Tallahassee! Whether it's a Cow Haus Presents show or a house show, go out and see local bands, support the scene, expose yourself to new music!

story:
ABOUT US

Isimila Festival 2016 will take place on September 3rd/4th 2016.

The festival will feature music from across Tanzania, from traditional village groups in the local area, to renowned Tanzanian artists and international musicians, as well as a full programme of arts, crafts and performance.

As well as the entertainment programme, the festival will celebrate the diversity, culture and history of the Southern Highlands of Tanzania. Educational displays and exhibitions will serve to strengthen local community integration and cultural exchange, whilst also promoting the Southern Highlands to guests from across Tanzania and beyond.

A range of local causes will also be present and supported, from conservation efforts in Ruaha National Park to local community development.

In the coming years, it is expected that Isimila Festival will continue to grow and become a mainstay of a thriving music, arts and culture scene in the Southern Highlands of Tanzania.

 

SUPPORTING ISIMILA FESTIVAL

The festival organisers are a dedicated team of volunteers investing their own time and money into making this happen.

Our Indiegogo campaign is seeking to raise funds that will specifically cover:

- Local artists' costs (travel/food/drink costs, enabling local Tanzanian artists to be on the stage at the festival)

- Equipment and labour (vital festival infrastructure, including sound and lighting, facilities, security and construction)

Your contributions, great or small, will help to make this event a great success, and the first in a long line of annual festivals for the Southern Highlands.

story:
~ Hello there! First of all, thank you for checking out our page! ~

Few words about the band

Bátor, Péter, Előd, Arnold (from left to right). We are a rock and roll band called Palma Hills. We started to play together 4 years ago in our hometown (Székelyudvarhely, Romania) where we attended at the same high school. At that time we did not really think that the music we make together would be so important for us someday like it is today.
First thing to know about us is that we don't have any musical background, so we have not learnt music officially. (All we have done is trying to find our way around our instrument with the help of the internet based on our instincts.)
From the beginning, writing our own songs has been the most important thing for our band. This is what we have always considered as real process.

Past recordings

We have released two EPs so far. The first one was Private Section, reliased in 2014, which included 4 of our earliest songs, the second one, We’re On The Way, There’s No Worry, was released in 2015 with 5 songs on it.

Our latest EP here:

 

Our new album and our expectations

It will be our first full length album with 11 songs, but we are also planning to add some extras. 
Since we have always tried to get the best out of every studio record we make, it took us more than a year to compose these songs to find the most satisfying sound and to build a concept around them that makes this record an album that we can be proud of, even after years of time.

Until the lunch of this campaign we have recorded 6 songs of the album. We already released one of these songs as a single earlier this year, with a music video and we can tell you that we are pleased with the result.

 


It is obvious by now that making music is what we want to do in our life. In the past few years we managed to achieve a lot of things that we thought to have been out of our reach, like: we played big festivals, traveled many miles while touring and met some incredibly nice people. Today we look on each of these memories as milestones of our journey. Our achievements and the love of music help us to keep going.

We believe that this record will help us to get to the next level with our music. This means more touring inside and outside our homeland, showcasing, finding our audience and improving in what we are doing.

Bet that you are asking now: What’s the matter then? Go on and make things happen!

The truth is that we lack the funds to finish what we have started. We’ve been supported by a program, called Cseh Tamás Program, who´s aim is to help young bands to start their career, so they gave us a certain amount of money for the making of this record but we did not managed to finish everything with that. Since we want to form this album the most monumental thing we have ever created, we need some more help to get to the finish line.

Raising money

We would need 2000 € to pay for our last recording session, mixing and mastering and for the production of the copies of the album.

Recording: 

We decided to record the whole album in Budapest, at Origo Studio where we can record almost everything live, when the band is playing together, because it is really important for us to make these songs sound like live music. We are working with the help of producer István Beke.

Mixing: 

The same producer who is working with us at the recording part will do the mixing of the album.

Mastering: 

For this part we chose to use analog methods, to get the raw, vintage sound we prefer.

Production of the copies: 

In the first round we will release 500 copies on CD. We would love to release this album also on Vinyl, so if we happen to exceed the perk of this campaign we will use the rest of the funds to record our material on Vinyl.

Your contribution.

By contributing to this project you will help a young band to create its first record to take a step further to achieve its goals and you will also support live music.
You can contribute by purchasing some of the items or packages that you find on the right side of this page. You will get these items as soon as the campaign is over and the production has been finished.

What happens if we don't manage to raise the full amount of the money we need? 

We will make this record anyway. The only difference is that the process will be delayed.

For further information please feel free to contact us by clicking Ask questions on the top right corner of this page.

If you believe that we deserve it, please help us to finish what we have started! Also, in case you have friends who might feel the same about this, don’t hesitate to share our case with them.

Thank you!

story:
The DK Journey!

Hey everyone! I want to begin by telling you a little bit about my journey. After 15+ years being a sideman with some of the most talented artists in the industry, I decided it was my turn to be up front. Two years ago I decided to embark on a new path. I put myself center stage and became a solo artist. Since then, I have recorded two albums which I am so incredibly proud of. I was also fortunate to fund both of these albums on my own. Both records gained much success on radio, including a single that made it all the way to #3 on the jazz charts. I've been featured in two major jazz magazines, gained multiple endorsements and have toured across the U.S. All of this success has landed me in the hands a marketing and booking team that is the best in the business.

So It's now time for me to record another album. Only this time we plan to create something bigger and better than before. We will be using one of the most sought after producers in smooth jazz - grammy nominated producer and saxophonist Darren Rahn. We will also be having some cameo appearances by some of the biggest names in smooth jazz. With this kind of vision, comes a higher price tag than before. We all know the music industry has changed. Less people are buying albums, more people are streaming music, and artists are not generating revenue because of this. So this can be a huge financial burden for indie artists which is why we have to find new and creative ways to connect with our fans and generate that revenue which allows us to keep making music. So this is where you come in.

So ... What do I need?

I need to raise $12,000+ to help pay for the production and recording costs of this new album. Yes that is a high price tag just for the recording - but this is what it takes to create a high-quality album that doesn't lack the musical integrity that I strive for. 

Just to put things into perspective, I paid roughly $50,000 out of my own pocket for the last two albums I have recorded. This can make the process very stressful and not all that sustainable. Now, more than ever, is the time to keep pushing forward. My passion to deliver innovative and inspiring music to the world keeps me motivated. I am hopeful that with your help I can continue to leverage the success and ride the wave of momentum I have created to make my mark on the music industry. 

So ... what do you get?

I have thought about this incredibly hard and put together, what I think are, some very unique and exciting packages that will allow you to be a part of the entire process along with me! From creating a cartoon version of you to star in a fully animated music video to a trip to Minneapolis to hang with me at my CD release party, I wanted to create packages that connect us together and keep you engaged from beginning to end.

Finally ...

Please help me continue on this amazing journey by supporting this campaign and sharing with all of your friends and family. I have an amazing fanbase and consider you all to be a part of my team.  I couldn't do this without you. I want to thank you all from the bottom of my heart for your continued love and support. 

Peace, love and music ya'll!
- Danny Kusz
