story:
(한국어 버젼은 밑에 참조)

SORI Showcase 2017: Help Bring the Global Sounds of Korea to You

Support SORI’s NYC premiere showcase and we need your help bringing our global music project to life!

 

WHAT/WHO IS SORI?

SORI (meaning “sound” in Korean; 소리) is a New York City based creative producer and promoter specializing in Korean music and arts.  Founded in 2016, SORI is committed to promoting the engaging, lively, and high-caliber sounds of Korea to diverse global audiences.

 

WHAT WE WANT TO BRING

With your support, SORI will showcase these three Korean world music groups live at the APAP Global Performing Arts Conference and Marketplace in New York City on January 5, 2017.

  • SSING SSING: Authentic Korean traditional vocals combined with rock band music, featuring an extravagant visual style and stage presence.  

 

  • BLACK STRING: Korean contemporary improvisational music group led by a multi-award-winning composer and classically trained Geomungo (Korean zither) virtuoso, Yoon-Jeong Heo.

 

  • HAN CHUNGEUN BAND: Contemporary Korean folk music played with serene and soulful sound of bamboo flutes combined with modern instruments. 

 

What’s the APAP conference? APAP is the Association of Performing Arts Presenters. The conference, held every January in New York City, is the world’s largest gathering of performing arts professionals. By showcasing at APAP, SORI will have the opportunity to introduce the beauty of Korean world music to a global audience. That will ideally promote booking tours of our artists throughout the U.S. and abroad.

 

WHY IS THIS SO IMPORTANT?

Music is a universal language that unites people across cultures and transcends boundaries in the global community. It is the one thing that can be understood by EVERYONE, EVERYWHERE. Our project has unique cultural significance not only because of our artists’ high quality but also because it highlights a unique Korean culture that is rarely experienced by the general public in the U.S. With your support, SORI will introduce powerful works of Korean music to a global, culturally curious audience in NYC and beyond; build a supportive platform for Korean global music artists; and create a new and unique experience we hope you and your friends will enjoy and find inspiring.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Most of the initial challenges of this project are financial. Showcasing at APAP involves significant conference expenses including registration, promotions, and booth fees, and a number of other expenses such as artist honorarium, showcase venue fees, crew and production costs, marketing and promotional costs, travel expenses, and performing group visas. We project the total budget of $47,000.

We were able to secure international air travel and lodging funding (which is the steepest expense) for the artists, but still need to raise at least $10,000 to be able to present this project on the stage.

Below is a percentage breakout of what your contributions will cover.

 

MEET THE TEAM

We are very lucky to have a fabulous group of professionals who donate their time and expertise to support our artists and make this project happen, including June (operation); Jeff (publicity); Bona (production); Lina (design); Sua (photography); Phil and Junmo (video); Shawn (marketing & management); and others who want to be anonymous.

 

YOU GIVE & YOU GET

Every contribution comes with perks, including digital music, signed CDs, concert tickets, SORI’s fashionable goodies, dining credit, VIP access, professional services, round-trip airline tickets, and a big “thank you” shout-out to every donor! Please check out the list of detailed perks on the right-side of the campaign page.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can help move this project forward:

  • Come see the SORI showcase at APAP on Thursday, January 5, 2017 at Rockwood Music Hall in Manhattan.
  • Share this Indiegogo campaign on social media.
  • Donate your time, ideas, and talents to the project. (see our contact info below)

 

THANK YOU!

We are grateful for and appreciative of any donation you can make. Every dollar helps us get closer to our goal. From the entire SORI team, thank you for your support, and we hope to see you and your friends at our showcase event on Thursday, January 5, 2017 at Rockwood Music Hall.

 

KEEP IN TOUCH

Do you have questions, recommendations, comments or feedback?

Do you have some great ideas and want to get involved?

If so, please contact the SORI Director Shawn Choi at shawn@sori.nyc; or join our friend list at www.sori.nyc.

 

(KOREAN)

뉴욕에서 최초로 시도하는 2017 소리 쇼케이스! 글로벌한 한국음악을 소개하는 새로운 프로젝트가 실현될 수 있도록 여러분의 도움이 필요합니다.

 

소리 (SORI) 란?

소리 (SORI)는 뉴욕에 기반을 두고 한국음악과 문화를 알리는 프로듀서 및 프로모터 에이젼시입니다. 2016년에 시작한 SORI는 신명나고 역동적인 최고 수준의 한국음악을 다양한 글로벌 관객들에게 소개하는데 목적이 있습니다.

 

우리가 소개하고자 하는 것

여러분의 도움으로 SORI는 한국 최고 수준의 월드뮤직 그룹들의 쇼케이스를 뉴욕 최대의 공연마켓플레이스인 “APAP 컨퍼런스”에서 선보입니다.

씽씽: 한국전통 민요가 록음악을 만나다. 환상적인 비쥬얼과 무대매너를 자랑하는 6인조 밴드.

블랙스트링: 거문고 명인 허윤정을 주축으로 한 컨템포러리 한국 음악 그룹.

한충은 밴드: 한국의 깊은 소리를 담은 전통악기인 대금, 소금과 기타와 퍼커션 등의 현대 악기로 연주하는 컨템포러리 한국 전통음악 그룹.


APAP 컨퍼런스란? APAP은 미국 공연 기획자 협회를 뜻합니다. 매년 1월 뉴욕에서 열리는 컨퍼런스는 세계 최대 규모의 공연관계자 모임이라고 할 수 있습니다. APAP에서 쇼케이스를 가짐으로서 SORI는 아름다운 한국음악을 글로벌한 관객들에게 소개할 수 있는 기회가 생기고 미국과 세계 곳곳에 우리가 소개하는 한국음악 아티스트들의 공연 기회를 만들 수 있을 것입니다.

 

이 프로젝트가 중요한 이유는?

음악은 세계 공통 언어로서 다양한 문화의 사람들을 통합시킬 수 있고 글로벌 사회의 여러가지 장벽을 허무는 힘이 있습니다. 이는 어디에서나 누구에게나 통할 수 있습니다. 우리의 프로젝트는 아주 중요한 문화적 의미가 있습니다. 이는 우리 아티스트들이 가진 최고 수준의 퍼포먼스 뿐 아니라 미국에서 쉽게 경험하기 어려운 특별한 한국의 문화를 소개하기 때문입니다.

여러분의 도움으로, SORI는 강력한 힘을 가진 한국음악을 뉴욕뿐만 아니라 다른 많은 지역의 글로벌한 관객들에게 소개하는 동시에 한국 음악인들을 위한 지원 플랫폼을 만들며, 나아가 여러분이 새롭게 즐기고 크게 감동받을 수 있는 특별한 경험을 제시할 것입니다.
 

걸림돌과 과제들

첫 시작의 가장 큰 걸림돌은 예산입니다. APAP에 쇼케이스를 위해서는 컨퍼런스 등록, 멤버십, 쇼케이스 등록, 부스비용 등을 비롯해 공연장 렌탈, 크루 용역 및 진행비용, 홍보, 교통, 공연비자 등 많은 비용이 필요합니다. 현재 책정 예산은 총 $47,000입니다.

그 중 가장 많은 부분을 차지하는 아티스트들의 한국-뉴욕간 항공료까지는 확보된 상태이며 이 프로젝트의 현실화를 위해 최소 $10,000의 예산이 필요합니다.

다음은 여러분의 도네이션이 어떻게 쓰일지를 보여주는 차트입니다. (위의 그림 참조)
 

우리의 팀을 소개합니다

SORI는 뉴욕에서 활동하는 다양한 분야의 프로페셔널들- June (운영); Jeff (홍보); Bona (기술); Lina (디자인); Sua (사진); Phil and Junmo (비디오); Shawn (마케팅 및 총감독); 그리고 무기명으로 돕는 다른 몇 명까지- 자신의 시간과 전문성을 투자하여 프로젝트를 만들고 있습니다.

 

기부와 혜택

모든 도네이션에는 다양한 혜택이 따라옵니다. 디지털 음원, 싸인 음반, 공연티켓, 음료티켓, VIP 멤버십, 왕복항공권 그리고 감사 메시지입니다. 캠페인 오른쪽 페이지에 기재된 자세한 혜택 리스트를 확인하세요

 

SORI를 도울수 있는 다른 방법들

금전적인 도네이션이 아니더라도 이 프로젝트에 다른 방법으로 기여할 수 있습니다.

● 2017년 1월 5일 뉴욕 맨하탄 락우드 뮤직홀에서 열리는 SORI 쇼케이스에 참여하세요.

● 이 크라우드펀딩 캠페인을 온오프라인으로 소개해 주세요

● 시간, 아이디어 그리고 여러분의 재능을 공유해 주세요. (아래 연락처 참고)

 

감사합니다

여러분의 어떤 기부에도 진심으로 감사드립니다. 아무리 작은 도움도 우리의 프로젝트의 실현에 도움이 됩니다. 우리 SORI 팀원 모두 여러분의 도움에 감사드리며 2017년 1월 5일 락우드 뮤직홀에서 열리는 쇼케이스에서 뵙길 기대하겠습니다.

 

KEEP IN TOUCH

질문이나 조언이 있으신가요?

좋은 아이디어나 이 프로젝트에 참여하고 싶으신가요?

그렇다면 shawn@sori.nyc 로 이메일 주시거나 www.sori.nyc 오셔서 친구 등록을 해주세요.
story_txt:
(한국어 버젼은 밑에 참조)SORI Showcase 2017: Help Bring the Global Sounds of Korea to YouSupport SORI’s NYC premiere showcase and we need your help bringing our global music project to life! WHAT/WHO IS SORI?SORI (meaning “sound” in Korean; 소리) is a New York City based creative producer and promoter specializing in Korean music and arts.  Founded in 2016, SORI is committed to promoting the engaging, lively, and high-caliber sounds of Korea to diverse global audiences. WHAT WE WANT TO BRINGWith your support, SORI will showcase these three Korean world music groups live at the APAP Global Performing Arts Conference and Marketplace in New York City on January 5, 2017.
SSING SSING: Authentic Korean traditional vocals combined with rock band music, featuring an extravagant visual style and stage presence.   
BLACK STRING: Korean contemporary improvisational music group led by a multi-award-winning composer and classically trained Geomungo (Korean zither) virtuoso, Yoon-Jeong Heo. 
HAN CHUNGEUN BAND: Contemporary Korean folk music played with serene and soulful sound of bamboo flutes combined with modern instruments.  What’s the APAP conference? APAP is the Association of Performing Arts Presenters. The conference, held every January in New York City, is the world’s largest gathering of performing arts professionals. By showcasing at APAP, SORI will have the opportunity to introduce the beauty of Korean world music to a global audience. That will ideally promote booking tours of our artists throughout the U.S. and abroad. WHY IS THIS SO IMPORTANT?Music is a universal language that unites people across cultures and transcends boundaries in the global community. It is the one thing that can be understood by EVERYONE, EVERYWHERE. Our project has unique cultural significance not only because of our artists’ high quality but also because it highlights a unique Korean culture that is rarely experienced by the general public in the U.S. With your support, SORI will introduce powerful works of Korean music to a global, culturally curious audience in NYC and beyond; build a supportive platform for Korean global music artists; and create a new and unique experience we hope you and your friends will enjoy and find inspiring. RISKS & CHALLENGESMost of the initial challenges of this project are financial. Showcasing at APAP involves significant conference expenses including registration, promotions, and booth fees, and a number of other expenses such as artist honorarium, showcase venue fees, crew and production costs, marketing and promotional costs, travel expenses, and performing group visas. We project the total budget of $47,000.We were able to secure international air travel and lodging funding (which is the steepest expense) for the artists, but still need to raise at least $10,000 to be able to present this project on the stage.Below is a percentage breakout of what your contributions will cover. MEET THE TEAMWe are very lucky to have a fabulous group of professionals who donate their time and expertise to support our artists and make this project happen, including June (operation); Jeff (publicity); Bona (production); Lina (design); Sua (photography); Phil and Junmo (video); Shawn (marketing & management); and others who want to be anonymous. YOU GIVE & YOU GETEvery contribution comes with perks, including digital music, signed CDs, concert tickets, SORI’s fashionable goodies, dining credit, VIP access, professional services, round-trip airline tickets, and a big “thank you” shout-out to every donor! Please check out the list of detailed perks on the right-side of the campaign page. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPEven if you can't contribute financially, you can help move this project forward:
Come see the SORI showcase at APAP on Thursday, January 5, 2017 at Rockwood Music Hall in Manhattan.
Share this Indiegogo campaign on social media.
Donate your time, ideas, and talents to the project. (see our contact info below)
 THANK YOU!We are grateful for and appreciative of any donation you can make. Every dollar helps us get closer to our goal. From the entire SORI team, thank you for your support, and we hope to see you and your friends at our showcase event on Thursday, January 5, 2017 at Rockwood Music Hall. KEEP IN TOUCHDo you have questions, recommendations, comments or feedback?Do you have some great ideas and want to get involved?If so, please contact the SORI Director Shawn Choi at shawn@sori.nyc; or join our friend list at www.sori.nyc. (KOREAN)뉴욕에서 최초로 시도하는 2017 소리 쇼케이스! 글로벌한 한국음악을 소개하는 새로운 프로젝트가 실현될 수 있도록 여러분의 도움이 필요합니다. 소리 (SORI) 란?소리 (SORI)는 뉴욕에 기반을 두고 한국음악과 문화를 알리는 프로듀서 및 프로모터 에이젼시입니다. 2016년에 시작한 SORI는 신명나고 역동적인 최고 수준의 한국음악을 다양한 글로벌 관객들에게 소개하는데 목적이 있습니다. 우리가 소개하고자 하는 것여러분의 도움으로 SORI는 한국 최고 수준의 월드뮤직 그룹들의 쇼케이스를 뉴욕 최대의 공연마켓플레이스인 “APAP 컨퍼런스”에서 선보입니다.씽씽: 한국전통 민요가 록음악을 만나다. 환상적인 비쥬얼과 무대매너를 자랑하는 6인조 밴드.블랙스트링: 거문고 명인 허윤정을 주축으로 한 컨템포러리 한국 음악 그룹.한충은 밴드: 한국의 깊은 소리를 담은 전통악기인 대금, 소금과 기타와 퍼커션 등의 현대 악기로 연주하는 컨템포러리 한국 전통음악 그룹.APAP 컨퍼런스란? APAP은 미국 공연 기획자 협회를 뜻합니다. 매년 1월 뉴욕에서 열리는 컨퍼런스는 세계 최대 규모의 공연관계자 모임이라고 할 수 있습니다. APAP에 쇼케이스를 위해서는 컨퍼런스 등록, 멤버십, 쇼케이스 등록, 부스비용 등을 비롯해 공연장 렌탈, 크루 용역 및 진행비용, 홍보, 교통, 공연비자 등 많은 비용이 필요합니다. 현재 책정 예산은 총 $47,000입니다.그 중 가장 많은 부분을 차지하는 아티스트들의 한국-뉴욕간 항공료까지는 확보된 상태이며 이 프로젝트의 현실화를 위해 최소 $10,000의 예산이 필요합니다.다음은 여러분의 도네이션이 어떻게 쓰일지를 보여주는 차트입니다. (위의 그림 참조) 우리의 팀을 소개합니다SORI는 뉴욕에서 활동하는 다양한 분야의 프로페셔널들- June (운영); Jeff (홍보); Bona (기술); Lina (디자인); Sua (사진); Phil and Junmo (비디오); Shawn (마케팅 및 총감독); 그리고 무기명으로 돕는 다른 몇 명까지- 자신의 시간과 전문성을 투자하여 프로젝트를 만들고 있습니다. 기부와 혜택모든 도네이션에는 다양한 혜택이 따라옵니다. 디지털 음원, 싸인 음반, 공연티켓, 음료티켓, VIP 멤버십, 왕복항공권 그리고 감사 메시지입니다. 캠페인 오른쪽 페이지에 기재된 자세한 혜택 리스트를 확인하세요 SORI를 도울수 있는 다른 방법들금전적인 도네이션이 아니더라도 이 프로젝트에 다른 방법으로 기여할 수 있습니다.● 2017년 1월 5일 뉴욕 맨하탄 락우드 뮤직홀에서 열리는 SORI 쇼케이스에 참여하세요.● 이 크라우드펀딩 캠페인을 온오프라인으로 소개해 주세요● 시간, 아이디어 그리고 여러분의 재능을 공유해 주세요. (아래 연락처 참고) 감사합니다여러분의 어떤 기부에도 진심으로 감사드립니다. 아무리 작은 도움도 우리의 프로젝트의 실현에 도움이 됩니다. 우리 SORI 팀원 모두 여러분의 도움에 감사드리며 2017년 1월 5일 락우드 뮤직홀에서 열리는 쇼케이스에서 뵙길 기대하겠습니다. KEEP IN TOUCH질문이나 조언이 있으신가요?좋은 아이디어나 이 프로젝트에 참여하고 싶으신가요?그렇다면 shawn@sori.nyc 로 이메일 주시거나 www.sori.nyc 오셔서 친구 등록을 해주세요.

story:
About Lyric Opera Berlin

After having moved here alone from the US, I started Lyric Opera Berlin as a collaborative effort in early 2015. The goal was to reach new audiences of all ages, and bring singers together in a safe and fun space for us to share our passion. The problem was, I didn't know anyone in Berlin! I posted in a Facebook group asking if anyone would like to work on concerts and productions together, and the response I got back was overwhelming! Since that day, we've had a dozen successful concerts featuring over 50 artists from all corners of the globe. The last two years have been amazing, and we are excited to offer our first full opera in May of this year! 

Staying true to our mission, we chose an opera which is not only beautiful and fun, but an instant fan-favorite: Donizetti's L'elisir d'amore! It features the famous tenor aria "Una furtiva lagrima," and many other recognizable numbers. L'elisir d'amore is a comedy featuring love, jealousy, and a certain travelling quack salesman peddling the eponymous Elixir of Love. Is it truly the fabled love potion? Will the boy get the girl? With your help, our dedicated, young professional singers can bring this story to life in a traditional staging of this classic. We can't wait!

More good news: we're teaming up with Raucous Rossini of Scotland! We love this group's mission, and decided to partner up to ensure our first production will be of the highest standard! Led by Raucous Rossini's Maximilian Fane, our production will be performed with string quintet and piano. Visit their website for more information about this fabulous group! 
http://www.raucousrossini.com/

Don't forget to bookmark https://www.lyricoperaberlin.com for more information about direct donating and our work. Connect with us on Facebook as well to be the first to know about future opportunities and performances!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Unfortunately, opera isn't cheap! To give the audience the best experience possible, we aim for quality. If we reach our full goal (and beyond!) we'll be performing in a beautiful venue with string quartet and piano, costumes, sets, and some of opera's future stars in the cast. With your help, we can provide a much-needed paid opportunity for those involved, and offer a lower ticket price so that audiences of all ages and backgrounds may enjoy the show.  

Your generous donation will be applied toward the following budget items:
€5500 (minimum) - Artists' fees (Conductor, director, orchestra, pianist, 10 principals, and chorus)
€2250 - Theater rental for performances
€500 - Rehearsal space rental
€250 - Advertising
€250 - Costumes and props
€250 - Miscellaneous (GEMA taxes, unforeseen costs, etc)

Of course, this is the bare minimum, and with your help we can surpass our goal to offer higher quality production for everyone involved! We offer several tiers of contributions with very special benefits at each level. Any amount is greatly appreciated! 

If we don't reach our goal, for any reason, 
that does NOT mean we will cancel the production. As they say in the biz, the show must go on! :) 

At $1,000 we can offer a significantly reduced version of the show with 3 singers and piano in a small venue.
At $2,500 we can offer a reduced show (5 singers) with piano in a small venue.
At $5,000 we can offer the full show (5 singers) with orchestra in a small venue. 
At $7,500 we can offer the full show with two casts and orchestra in a large venue.
At $9,000 we can offer the full show with two casts, chorus, and orchestra in a large venue!

All additional proceeds will go to compensating the artists.

Any amount helps! The more people who get involved, the more jobs we create, and the more music we make! So make some noise about us ;) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If a monetary donation isn't possible, don't worry! There are plenty of ways you can help:

  • Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign and production!

    • Use the Indigogo share tools to make it even easier!

    • Someone you know could LOVE this project. You'll make their day!

  • Offer a space!
    • An easy way to cut costs is a free place to rehearse and perform!
  • Offer your services!
    • Web Designers, PR Magicians, Translators, and more... we'd love to have you aboard!
  • Donate your time!
    • There is a lot of work to be done. Ask us how you can help!

 

Thank you again for your support!

We love this group's mission, and decided to partner up to ensure our first production will be of the highest standard! Led by Raucous Rossini's Maximilian Fane, our production will be performed with string quintet and piano. Visit their website for more information about this fabulous group! http://www.raucousrossini.com/Don't forget to bookmark https://www.lyricoperaberlin.com for more information about direct donating and our work. Connect with us on Facebook as well to be the first to know about future opportunities and performances! What We Need & What You GetUnfortunately, opera isn't cheap! To give the audience the best experience possible, we aim for quality. If we reach our full goal (and beyond!) we'll be performing in a beautiful venue with string quartet and piano, costumes, sets, and some of opera's future stars in the cast. With your help, we can provide a much-needed paid opportunity for those involved, and offer a lower ticket price so that audiences of all ages and backgrounds may enjoy the show.  Your generous donation will be applied toward the following budget items:€5500 (minimum) - Artists' fees (Conductor, director, orchestra, pianist, 10 principals, and chorus)€2250 - Theater rental for performances€500 - Rehearsal space rental€250 - Advertising€250 - Costumes and props€250 - Miscellaneous (GEMA taxes, unforeseen costs, etc)Of course, this is the bare minimum, and with your help we can surpass our goal to offer higher quality production for everyone involved! We offer several tiers of contributions with very special benefits at each level. Any amount is greatly appreciated! 
If we don't reach our goal, for any reason, that does NOT mean we will cancel the production. As they say in the biz, the show must go on! :) At $1,000 we can offer a significantly reduced version of the show with 3 singers and piano in a small venue.At $2,500 we can offer a reduced show (5 singers) with piano in a small venue.At $5,000 we can offer the full show (5 singers) with orchestra in a small venue. At $7,500 we can offer the full show with two casts and orchestra in a large venue.At $9,000 we can offer the full show with two casts, chorus, and orchestra in a large venue!All additional proceeds will go to compensating the artists.Any amount helps! The more people who get involved, the more jobs we create, and the more music we make! So make some noise about us ;)  Other Ways You Can HelpIf a monetary donation isn't possible, don't worry! There are plenty of ways you can help:
Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign and production!
Use the Indigogo share tools to make it even easier!
Someone you know could LOVE this project. You'll make their day!


Offer a space!An easy way to cut costs is a free place to rehearse and perform!

Offer your services!Web Designers, PR Magicians, Translators, and more... we'd love to have you aboard!

Donate your time!There is a lot of work to be done. Ask us how you can help!

 Thank you again for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Few years ago I moved to Norway, and I had to start my life again from the scratch. Its not usually easy, starting all over again. I left my music (my dream) because I needed first to find a regular job and make a living, as music is hardly a full time job in Norway. This was a difficult decision for me. I came from a family of musicians and I have always hoped to be more successful than my uncles and aunts who were well loved for the richness of their voices back home. But I did not give up. I kept on believing that someday, somehow I will find my way back to my dream. It took some years though, but finally six months ago, life happened as it usually does. I started recording new songs. Then a Music video, and here I am today, getting ready for my first music concert in Norway. I am profoundly grateful for all the wonderful people I have met in this journey including you. I believe that people cross paths in life for a reason. Your help will go a long way in helping me realise this dream and I will not take it for granted. Music is what I have always longed to do. It means the world to me.

With your help, I can be able to pay for the venue of my concert as well as the professional instrumentalists playing with me.

What I Need & What You Get.

What I need for my Concert is 4000 dollars or 40000 kroners

This money will be used to:

  • Part pay for the venue of my concert,
  • Six instrumentalists playing with me,
  • Five dancers,
  • 1 sound technician,
  • 1 lighting technician,
  • 4 guest artistes and
  • Promotional materials (posters and flyers) .​​

 

  • All donations of 25 dollars or 250 kr will get a ticket to the event. I will add your name on the guest list. You just mention your name at the door.
  • All donations of more than 25 dollars or more than 250 kroners will get a ticket to the event plus a ringtone of my song "Grow old with you"
  • All donations of 500 dollars and above or 5000 kroners and above will get a ticket , a ringtone of my song "Grow old with you" and a hand written Thank you message from me.

The Impact

The main idea of ​​the concert is to encourage people to get their relationships to work so that they can grow old together. Because it is always best for children that parents remain together, respect and love each other and take good care of each other. That is also why we chose to have the concert in February (Valentine month). We planned this concert to give all couples who are there a good reason to renew their love and passion for each other. In the music video of "Grow old with you" we have used real couples who have been together for 4, 12 , 46 years etc. To show that every relationship is a journey . The inspiration for this concert came from my own personal experience after a broken relationship which has created a wound in my heart that will always be there. Now, I have found Love again. I just wish to use my songs to encourage everyone in a relationship. I want to convey the lessons life has taught me which is that one can always make an effort to get a relationship to work. "We fall in love by chance, but stay in love by choice" is a good expression of what I am trying to convey.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially, I'd love for you to listen to and share my music on Spotify, Itunes, Tidal, Deezer etc.  Share my YouTube videos, join me on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter @iamappyday and send me a message of encouragement from time to time. Your words mean the world to me.

  • Remember to share this my campaign on your facebook so others can also lend a hand.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
(Deutsche Version - siehe unten; wenn du das Video auf Deutsch sehen willst, klicke im Videofenster rechts unten auf "deutsche Untertitel ein") 

 

Tickets sind nun auch über NTRY erwerbbar! :)

 

 

ME

This is me. And this is how everything kinda started.

 

I believe, that all forms of art connect us. It brings us back to the actual MOMENT.

We suddenly open our hearts and minds to more than only rationality.

 

Always seeing, hearing, feeling and sensing the beauty in everything we all are surrounded with,

I found my ways, already by an early age, expressing these feelings through all kinds of art like sculpting, paper dipping, photography, acting, poetry and music etc.

 

I'm Katrin Spiegel, and it wouldn’t feel sincere to me, if I would now describe myself here more detailed.

I think, my work, my passion speaks better for me and I want to leave this space open to you to get your own impression and if you have any questions, I’m happy to recieve and answer them.

 

 

MOMENT

In February 2017 I'm going to perform & record my first album live, analogue, unplugged in Vienna, Austria at Casino Baumgarten, connected to the legendary vintage, analogue Preiser Record Studios. 

 


 

 

It was always important to me - especially since the digital age, to bring music 'back to the roots' - back to this unaltered, genuine 'nude' sound.

 

To have YOU, the audience, being part of the process, the making, having your good vibe on the record.

 

And also giving you the space for interpretation, time to slow down and fall into the now, the actual 'MOMENT’.

 

the Casino <3 

 

With the Album and the way it will be recorded and left unaltered, I want to create an acoustical directness and intimacy that leads to an almost unbelievable reality to the listener.

 

That's the beautiful 21" tape recording machine on which the whole concert will be recorded.

 

YOU

And I would love to have YOU being part of the whole process.

 

I invite you – and rely on you to share this campaign and my work widely

 

-PLEASE SHARE it with your Facebook Friends & Instagram followers

(click on the "share" links on the upper left of this page)

 

-Send an email directly to people who care about music & art

 

           

COSTS & REWARD

As the whole project is also connected to high costs, I need your help! So I don’t end up being a starving artist :P

And I made myself many thoughts about what I could give you in reward that makes you happy.

 

Creating products with consciousness for our environment and one another is very important to me. Lead by that, I decided to only create products and perks that are less consume minded but therefore more experience creating and minimalist - focused & reduced to the core, low waste products.

 

With your donation you help me cover the costs for the great team that is helping me to realize this project.

Including

Photo/Videographer/Cut/Editing

Graphic Design

Projectmanagement

Musicians

Webdeveloper

PR

Sound Ingeneers/Technicians

Eventassistants

 

Also, you help me to cover the costs of/for

Locationcost

Crewcatering

Eventmanagement

Pre Production e.g. arranging, recording, mixing, mastering

Production/Manufacturing for the Vinyl, CDs, licensing, copyrights, mechanical rights

Materials e.g. for the artworks, special equipment, covers

Marketing & promotion such as posters, postcards, advertisements

Fees & Payment Processing

Fulfillment

 

Any funding beyond this crowdfundinggoal up to 15.000€ will go towards the promotion for the album. If we reach an ever higher crowdfundinggoal it will go towards other art projects I’d love to realize in 2017. Like an exhibition of some of my photographies transferred on different upcycled materials and a light series out of iron scrap, concrete and feeling bodies.

 

THANK YOU!

 

I love the work I do and I’m honored to do that work with you and with your support. 

Your presence, your support and your financial investment helps my work reach well beyond the concert & live recording session.

 

I’m very grateful for you, your amazing, generous, loving and understanding supporters!

 

LOVE,

Katrin

 

 

 

 

ICH

Ich bin Katrin Spiegel und ich wäre nicht ich, würde ich mich hier jetzt noch detaillierter beschreiben.

Ich denke, meine Arbeit, meine Leidenschaft, beschreibt mich besser als wenn ich mich hier nun in eine Schublade stecken würde um mich und mein Schaffen zu definieren. Diesen Raum für deine eigenen Eindrücke und Interpretationen lass ich dir hier sehr gerne offen. Solltest du dennoch Fragen haben, freu ich mich über jede Einzelne!

 

 

MOMENT

Im Februar 2017 werde ich das erste Konzert zu meinem ersten Album ‚MOMENT’ im Casino Baumgarten, zusammen mit den Preiser Record Studios in Wien geben. Gleichzeitig wird das Album Live vor Ort, analog, auf Tonband und unplugged aufgenommen.
 

Für mich war es immer sehr wichtig, speziell seit Musik immer weniger nachvollziehbar wird, Musik 'back to the roots' – zurück zu diesem unverfälschten, echten ‚nackten’ Klang zu bringen.

 

Mit dir diesen Moment, diesen Schaffensprozess zu teilen. Und wie du mit deiner Anwesenheit zum Teil des Albums wirst. Einen Raum für Interpretation zu schaffen und Zeit zum Fallen lassen.

 

Mit dem Album und die Art wie es aufgenommen werden wird – wie es gelassen wird, möchte ich eine akustische Direktheit und Intimität schaffen, die den Live Moment, schon fast surreal nach Hause ins Wohnzimmer bringen darf.

 

 

DU

Ich freue mich sehr, dich als Teil des Ganzen einzuladen.

 

Bitte unterstütze mich auch dabei, diese Kampagne zu TEILEN.

 

- teile sie mit deinen Facebook, Twitter, Instagram Freunden.

 

- verschicke Emails direkt an Freunde und Bekannte denen Musik und Kunst wichtig ist.

           

KOSTEN & DANKESCHÖN

Das gesamte Projekt ist mit hohen Kosten verbunden. Deswegen bitte ich um Deine Unterstützung.

Und natürlich habe ich mir auch sehr viele Gedanken darüber gemacht, was ich im Gegenzug als Dankeschön für deine Unterstützung geben kann und dich glücklich macht.

 

Für mich war es schon immer wichtig, Produkte zu schaffen die Sinn machen. Sinn im Sinne von, keine Wegwerfprodukte, ökologisch und sozial korrekt. Den Fokus aufs Wesentliche gelenkt. Momente, Erlebnisse, Erinnerungen schaffen. 

 

Mit deiner Investition hilfst du mir, die Kosten für das Team welches mich bereits super bei der Realisierung unterstützt, zu einem Großteil abzudecken.

Photo/Video/Schnitt/Bearbeitung

Grafikdesign

Projektmanagement

Musiker

Webdeveloper

PR

Tontechnik

Assistenten

 

Zudem hilfst du mir die Kosten für...

Location

Crewcatering

Eventmanagement

Pre Produktion z.B. Arrangement, Aufnahme, Mix, Master

Produktion Vinyl, CDs, Lizenzen, Urheber-/Aufführungsrechte

Materialien z.B. für die Artworks, Equipment, Hüllen

Marketing & Promotion wie Poster, Postkarten, Anzeigen

Gebühren & Geldtransfers

Umsetzung

.... zu decken

 

Alle Beträge die über das Crowdfundingziel hin bis zu 15.000€ hinaus gehen, werden für die Promo des Albums verwendet. Und wenn wir ein noch höheres Ziel erreichen werde ich diese in 2017 geplante Kunstprojekte investieren. Wie eine Austellung von Einigen meiner Fotografien übertragen auf unterschiedliche upgecyclete Materialien und eine Lampenserie fühlender Körper aus Eisenschrott und Beton.

 

DANKE!

 

Ich liebe meine Arbeit und ich fühle mich geehrt, diese Arbeit mit dir zu teilen, mit deiner Unterstützung zu verwirklichen und mit dir umzusetzen.

Deine Anwesenheit, dein Support und dein finanzielles Investement, hilft mir meine Arbeit, weit über das Konzert und die Live Aufnahme hinaus zu verbreiten.

 

DANKE für dein Vertrauen, deinen Support, deinen Beitrag!

 

LOVE,

Katrin

story:
Kaoticradio.com needs YOU

  • I am Dutchie Hollands, co-owner with Brandon Barber, and DJ on Kaoticradio and passionate music fan
  • We want your money but not for free, you donate and get back some great stuff and save this station. We give a lot to our community, help us to continue doing this and at the same time keep the best in internet radio entertainment on the air.
  •  With your help we can keep kaoticradio.com on the air and build for the future, without your help there may be no more Kaoticradio.com. YOUR HELP IS HUGE.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need $3000 to pay for 
  1. Rent for the studio.
  2. Utilities, phones, internet and electricity.
  3. Station equipment, headphones, microphones , cables for instruments.
  4. What do you get? Well if you donate you get something in return, tickets or t-shirts etc, but what you REALLY get is some unbelievable free internet radio entertainment.
  5.  Kaotic radio has the best local talent that goes out worldwide, the BEST free entertainment, links through apps, the web, live streaming, top bands guesting on shows, top comedians, ALL FOR FREE.
  6. The perks, the giveaways? WOW, Tickets for some great upcoming shows, some great signed memorabilia and some great fun trips with kaotic hosts.
  •  EVERY penny , whether or not we reach the goal, will go into the station to keep us on the air.

The Impact

 

  •  We, you, need and love entertainment, WE DO, So the more choice you have the better we enjoy life, Kaoticradio.com gives you more choice, yup we play a lot of punk, we have comedy, we have sport, so we have a lot to offer. For me , as an owner and a DJ and a lover of all we offer I want to give to you, I want to be able to keep us giving to you so we can all give to each other and have fun in life.

Risks & Challenges

 

  •  In just 5 years kaotic has brought some of entertainments biggest and brightest stars, we are proud of what and who we have a brought to you, we try to keep ads to a minimum to bring YOU more entertainment, no bullshit, after playing in a punk band since I was 15, playing pro soccer , working construction and travelling the world, moving from London to Los Angeles in 1991 , kaotis radio is the most exciting project I have EVER been involved in and I know with you help we can not only survive but also get bigger and better. As with all of these things tha we enjoy it costs $$$$$
  • Kaotic has run for 6 years with ZERO profit, always on the edge, but always surviving, I have been the owner the since  August of 2016 and aim to add more shows, more hosts, more outside events, including live comedy, live music events and sponsorship, If we can do this we will grow and catapult the station to the next level.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Spread the word, we know YOU KNOW, but who doesn't know about kaoticradio.com who doesn't listen? Share this , facebook, twitter, Instagram, friends EVERYONE
  • Donate items, giveaways, anything and everything helps.

And that's all there is to it.

I am Dutchie Hollands, co-owner with Brandon Barber, and DJ on Kaoticradio and passionate music fan

 EVERY penny , whether or not we reach the goal, will go into the station to keep us on the air.

The Impact
 
 We, you, need and love entertainment, WE DO, So the more choice you have the better we enjoy life, Kaoticradio.com gives you more choice, yup we play a lot of punk, we have comedy, we have sport, so we have a lot to offer. For me , as an owner and a DJ and a lover of all we offer I want to give to you, I want to be able to keep us giving to you so we can all give to each other and have fun in life.

Risks & Challenges
 

 In just 5 years kaotic has brought some of entertainments biggest and brightest stars, we are proud of what and who we have a brought to you, we try to keep ads to a minimum to bring YOU more entertainment, no bullshit, after playing in a punk band since I was 15, playing pro soccer , working construction and travelling the world, moving from London to Los Angeles in 1991 , kaotis radio is the most exciting project I have EVER been involved in and I know with you help we can not only survive but also get bigger and better. As with all of these things tha we enjoy it costs $$$$$
Kaotic has run for 6 years with ZERO profit, always on the edge, but always surviving, I have been the owner the since  August of 2016 and aim to add more shows, more hosts, more outside events, including live comedy, live music events and sponsorship, If we can do this we will grow and catapult the station to the next level.


Other Ways You Can Help
 

Spread the word, we know YOU KNOW, but who doesn't know about kaoticradio.com who doesn't listen? Share this , facebook, twitter, Instagram, friends EVERYONE
Donate items, giveaways, anything and everything helps.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who is this guy and why should I give him $$?   

Hello!  My name is Stuart Fuchs and I am a touring musician and teaching artist - these days I hang my hat in New Hampshire.  For over two decades I have been lucky enough to have made my living in the arts & creative education...and for this I count my blessings everyday.  Along the way I've met some inspiring folks and have performed many styles of music...from Django Reinhardt's gypsy jazz to classical guitar, rock n roll, funk & world beat, experimental music, and my own genre bending ukulele instrumentals.  For eight years I worked as a professional artist-in-residence at a cancer hospital and later received a composition grant from the National Endowment for the Arts for a healing music project.  I currently tour worldwide offering workshops, concerts and performing with the internationally renowned Sacred Chant artist Snatam Kaur.

RIGHT NOW, I'm in the process of recording my 2nd solo album entitled "After All This Time".  I've created this Indiegogo campaign because I could really use your help to complete it.   For everyone over the past three years who has asked me "when, when, WHEN is your next album coming out??!"...well, it's almost here!  

Your generous financial support will help me to complete this project - I'm poised for a late May 2017 release...will you help me reach my goal?

You mean like in soccer?

Um, well...no.  My goal is for $12,000.  My team and I have looked long and hard at what our goals are and feel this amount will create the best album possible.  If we reach this goal, you will have helped us to make this dream a reality!  

Your contribution will be spent on the following production related expenses:

  • Studio time for tracking, mixing and mastering this album
  • Hiring a highly qualified recording engineer for the sessions
  • Paying for professional musicians to add their talents to the music (and feeding them too!)
  • Hiring a professional graphic designer to design a beautiful package for the album
  • Printing the packaging for the album
  • Hiring a media promotions professional from a major media market (NYC, L.A., Chicago, etc.) to get this new music played on radio stations around the world

If the goal is not met, thats okay - we will still use your contribution along with our own personal funds to complete the album.  If we exceed the target amount...those extra funds will be used to start the NEXT recording (60% of the songs for a 3rd solo album are already written).   

We hope you'll join us in helping this campaign to succeed!

CD's?  Aren't those extinct like the Wooly Mammoth and the passenger pigeon?

Nope, CD's are still alive and well - some folks still like to put on an album, kick back & and listen all the way through (maybe you're one of them?)   Usually they're sold at concerts, then autographed and sold years later for a massive profit.  CD's sound fantastic in car stereos and even keep dust off your coffee table!

What's on your CD?

The music, like the ukulele, is both playful and humorous, soulful and deep.  This new album is a collection of beautiful instrumentals played on ukulele and guitar, uplifting original songs that explore themes of gratitude, wonder, loss, acceptance, and living anchored in the present moment.  I've composed music that sets the beautiful and inspiring poetry of the Persian Sufi poet Hafiz and Vietnamese Buddhist master and teacher Thich Nhat Hanh.  There also a few surprises on the album as well as my Didjeridoo and Native American flute.

"After All This Time" is an album that will bring together some fantastic musicians and friends - and and a recording that bridges together two of my passions - music and meditation.  

The Perks of contributing to his campaign

There are perks to joining in this campaign, both energetic and tangible :)  As a thank you for your gift to this campaign, take a look at some of the cool gifts we're offering - they're listed on this page.  

In addition to the gifts listed here, SO much gratitude will be beamed your way for your support!  Enjoy your perks while knowing that you helped to make a beautiful, playful, meditative and ukulele centric album a reality!   Supporting independent artists is a super hip thing to do :) ...but for real - your generous donation will make a HUGE difference!

 

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help by making some noise about the campaign.  Please click and share this campaign - it's easy and very much appreciated!

If you can't contribute at this time, that's okay!  There are are other ways you can help this campaign to succeed.  

  • Share this campaign with you friends to help get the word out.  We appreciate you making some noise about this project. If you were able to contribute, please make some noise too!! 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

story:
The Deal

I'm Shannon Vetter. I've been playing music for about 15 years. Mostly saxophones. Some guitar and drums and keys - I'm not as good at those - but luckily i know a lot of people who are. I know a lot of good musicians in general. This album features 11 songs I wrote and arranged that i sing and play on. This album also features 18 musicians from right here round Paducah, KY. 
I think that's a pretty big deal. 
With their help i made a really good record. I think you should hear it. 

So why are you doing crowdfunding?Everyone does this and it's annoying.


Well, making records is expensive. And i need your help. I've dedicated my life to music which as you know is not always the most lucrative of professions. If i was a lawyer I could probably afford it (but then the music wouldn't be as good)  It's being mixed right now by Jordan Lehning (Trace Adkins, Kacey Musgraves, Justin Townes Earl) I still have the mixing and the mastering and the printing to pay for.  I believe in this album, and I believe in all the musicians who made it with me. It's a good album and i need your support to finish it. 

The Money

Don't think of it as a fundraiser. Think of it as a Pre Sale! You don't really feel how much these things cost until you're the only one paying for it. Gideon's Rifle albums were a breeze!  Alex Coltharp and Jake Siener may have been doing most of the engineering and graphic design work. (God bless em)
I'm spending around 7,500 on this project. That includes the tracking, mixing, mastering, and production of 200 cds and 100 vinyl. I'm hoping to make that money back eventually. But for now i'm trying to raise 3,000 specifically to pay for the mixing and to get some people interested in the album. The album was tracked right in Paducah at Loud and Clear. But Jordan Lehning (Kenny Rogers, Randy Travis, Justin Townes Earl ) Is mixing it. 
He's one of the best. 

Why can't I just buy it at your show, in a store like cd central or terrapin station, or when i see you in person? 

You can! But i could really use your support now. I'm trying to do stuff a little cheaper on the pre- sale so get the good deal here first and feel good about it. Plus we have lots of perk packages from amazing people and businesses from the area. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page on your facebook. Share my music with your and your sister's producer friend, publisher, promoter, bar booking guy/girl, blogger friend, music reviewer, music enthusiast, musician buddies, college radio DJ, etc. 

Or burn it for a friend. Do people still do that? My new mac doesn't even have a thing for cd's or dads. 

Thanks heaps

story:
Dear world music lovers. I am proud to introduce you to my first album of Persian/Flamenco music, which has been in the making for over 3 years. But in a way, it has been taking shape over many decades as I grew up in Iran and then found a new home in Canada as an adult. The Album is a unique combination of two deeply rooted musical traditions, Persian and Flamenco.

 

It is my hope that I can give a voice to my fellow Female singers in Iran and also bring dignity to my place of birth and its kind people.

Who am I?

  • My name is Farnaz, I was born and raised in Iran and moved to Canada in 1990.
  • I have always had music in my life but it was in 1998 that I started formally studying flamenco dance and music
  • In 2005 I started exploring singing Flamenco.
  • But in 2012 I understood that in order for me to find my authentic voice, I had to find my heart song. I had to tell my OWN story. And that is when I went back to where I have come from.
  • I began exploring putting Persian Poetry to traditional Flamenco forms, something that I believe I am in the unique position to create, because I have been blessed to have experienced both cultures.

This album is pure joy. It is a dream come true. Every song, has been chosen carefully, every word has been selected thoughtfully and there is a story behind every decision. Even the frequency we recorded at (432 Htz) has been carefully chosen. Why you ask?

  • Because the album is the poetry of my heart
  • Because no other vehicle other than Flamenco would work for expressing all that is inside me
  • Because 432 Hz (a kinder, gentle frequency) would help the listener to let go and join the sound journey that this album is

The album tells the story of restrictions put on me as a woman wanting to perform in public while growing up in Iran. Every note is a loud and definitive "NO!" to every no I heard. I am lucky. I was given wings to fly once I found my way to Canada. Many are not. Many women still battle restrictive, sexist, archaic laws that prevents them from raising their voice in the oldest human expression: song.

What I Need & What You Get

Help me make the album come to life. The music has been composed and the recording is now finished but there is still much left to do, from the physical print of the album itself and graphic design to the concert that I am organizing to celebrate accomplishing this monumental achievement.

  • I am joined by the most amazing team of musicians and performers from many corners of the world
  • In order to produce the best album possible and to put together an amazing and unforgettable concert to launch it all, it only makes sense that I work with the very best
  • Many local stars will grace the stage with musicians from Italy, Canada, Armenia, Israel and Spain which encompasses a big part of the budget

  • I am also working closely with an amazing duo team of graphic designers (Nomadic Alternative, and Dados) to create an entire graphic package, not only for the live show in the form of beautiful slides but to also put together a gorgeous CD package, beautifully printed, accompanied with translated lyrics in both English and Farsi. We are even thinking about a more elaborate version of the booklet in digital form.

  • I have also created unique merchandise that feature some of these graphics so you may wear them proudly and have a story to tell when everyone compliments you and wants to know where you got them from!

  • But wait! There is more! I am also a visual artist and I love to draw. Every single contribution will received a hand written thank you card from me, as well as a card that will feature one of my drawings. For more generous contributions, these drawings will be unique, hand drawn (not printed) and will even include hand written lyrics to a song, in Farsi!

  • In the event that contributions might exceed the amount I am asking for, the money will go towards more broad promotions and publicity.

 

Final Word:

I realize that I may be asking for a lot but creating good art requires funds. Join me. Help me realize this dream. Help me give a voice to Iranian women who are denied. Help me restore some dignity to wonderful Iranian people through Flamenco, which is the voice of the oppressed.

I have been a performer, a designer and an artist all my life. I have never shied away from projects that have seemed impossible. This Album at times seemed so grand, so big and so very out of reach but here we are and I could not be more proud.

I have performed in over 300 shows and since 2012 I have sang various reincarnations of these songs at various venues and each time, every Iranian who hears them is touched. Every Flamenca who hears them wants to know more.

Trust me in this journey. Come with me and immerse yourself in a newly found expression of world music.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I am grateful for every kind word, every pat on the back and every smile from near and far. If you are not able to contribute would you consider sharing it with your friends? And would you ask them to share with THEIR friends?

  • There are many ways you can share this campaign or even just news of this album coming out. Using the Indigogo Share buttons is one way. Or you can use twitter, Facebook, website, blog, word of mouth ...
  • I will be updating the campaign every day. Share those updates if you can. Let people hear about this.

And that's all there is to it.

Ready? LETS DO THIS!

story:
ADJ-S1 Ableton Dj Controllers

As full time Ableton producers and DJ's yearning for Ableton specific controllers the ADJ-S1 setup was created.

Standard DJ midi controllers specifically designed for Ableton live.

The ADJ-S1 comes as a set of two ADJ-S1 controllers no need to purchase additional decks (unless you want them).

Each Deck Features:

  • Aluminum road ready enclosure
  • 8 Sanwa arcade buttons
  • 2 Pro Audio sliders
  • 3 Rotary encoders
  • Stop/Play Buttons
  • 2 FX buttons
  • USB MIDI HID compliant ( unplug/plug-in without Ableton restart)
  • Tractor compatible
  • MIDI mapping for most DAW's  
  • USB powered

Rotary encoders select effects and control effect amount.

Push and release effect controls buttons.

The two pro audio sliders on each deck use a HiPass LoPass filter system to control both Volume and EQ at the same time.

Stop and play buttons can be set to control the launching of the first and last cue points on both decks or single deck control.



Custom ADJ-S1's will be available with wooden and other materials laser cut with special designs.

Including templates and tutorials for DJ's, warping and music organization.

Our first prototypes created in two months from thought to beta product. Fully tested on stage by multiple DJ's.


Funding Goals

We are ready to start production on our first round of controllers for our perk contributors.

Funding goes towards:

  • PCB electronics manufactured
  • Aluminum  enclosures water jetted
  • Custom wooden sacred geometry enclosures manufactured
  • Bulk materials purchase for cost reduction


Shipping for our perk contributors will start Dec 2016 - Jan 2017

story:
Team Harmony ! Tim Welvaars & Naomi Adriaansz, professional jazz musicians from The Netherlands, are performing "Jazz with more than love".

Our mission 
..is to bring harmony and unconditional love to all our fellow human beings in this world. Via our music. In our unique way... Tim by playing his beautiful chromatic harmonica and Naomi her Silver Satin tenor sax.  

 

ABOUT our 'L.A. Project'
There are daily chances, but - every now and than - there are lifetime opportunities ! And that is how we feel about this "L.A. Project". We are so grateful that this opportunity crosses our path. 

We will make a world class soulful & funky smooth jazz album with multi grammy award winning producer PAUL BROWN, in his studio in Los Angeles, with some of the best American musicians of the scene. 

Additionally we will invite a couple of famous special guests to contribute to our album, including jazz fusion guitarist Marc Antoine. And Fourplay bass legend Nathan East!

This project will open new doors and pave new ways for us to fulfill our mission. Globally! 

As our friend and fan you can become part of our love and harmony, and help us open these new doors by funding our upcoming "L.A. Project".

Your Funds
Your funds will be fully used for producing and promoting the album. The more we can spend, the more impact this album will have! We are grateful for every donation.  

Even when we don't fully reach our goal of 10.000 euros, we can keep all the donations that have been given by our friends. So, your donation will be used for our album anyhow! 

Help us by sharing our campaign with your friends, family and jazz lovers. Via Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn etc. 

We send our intense love & gratitude...

Tim Welvaars & Naomi Adriaansz, professional jazz musicians from The Netherlands, are performing "Jazz with more than love".Our mission ..is to bring harmony and unconditional love to all our fellow human beings in this world. Via our music. In our unique way... Tim by playing his beautiful chromatic harmonica and Naomi her Silver Satin tenor sax.  
 ABOUT our 'L.A. Project'There are daily chances, but - every now and than - there are lifetime opportunities ! And that is how we feel about this "L.A. Project". We are so grateful that this opportunity crosses our path. We will make a world class soulful & funky smooth jazz album with multi grammy award winning producer PAUL BROWN, in his studio in Los Angeles, with some of the best American musicians of the scene. Additionally we will invite a couple of famous special guests to contribute to our album, including jazz fusion guitarist Marc Antoine. And Fourplay bass legend Nathan East!This project will open new doors and pave new ways for us to fulfill our mission. Globally! As our friend and fan you can become part of our love and harmony, and help us open these new doors by funding our upcoming "L.A. Project".Your FundsYour funds will be fully used for producing and promoting the album. The more we can spend, the more impact this album will have! We are grateful for every donation.  Even when we don't fully reach our goal of 10.000 euros, we can keep all the donations that have been given by our friends. So, your donation will be used for our album anyhow! Help us by sharing our campaign with your friends, family and jazz lovers. Via Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn etc. We send our intense love & gratitude...

story:
INTRO

Throughout the years of writing, composing, taking long breaks, learning the ins and outs of what it means to express ourselves through music, we want to make our vision for a full length debut album a reality. 

Up to today, everything from studio sessions to music videos has been funded by us, and now, we're reaching out to you. Friends, family, strangers - we want you to be a part of the process. Help us achieve what we've dreamt about for years; not just an album, but creating a world where people feel inspired, moved, and challenged. 

WHAT IS "PT.1"?

Part one of this crowd funding is solely for pre-production, which means the culmination of work that goes into the album before we head into the studio. These funds will be going towards a trip in November where we will be connecting with producers and musicians in LA. Our duration of the trip will be 2-3 weeks. 

$3,000 covers basic trip expenses - flights, accommodations, and car rental. What will not be used on this trip will be put towards recording the album. 

THE PERKS

We've designed limited edition prints to help raise money for pre-production. These prints are 8.5x11 in. Numbers are limited so get them while they're fresh!THE ALBUM

We envision an album with a concept: our personal struggles, hopes, and questions reflected through a surreal world of characters and narrated in the form of sounds, visuals, and words. 

We envision the combination of rhythms and textures from various musical influences, inspired by the music we grew up with (Michael Jackson, 60's instrumentals, gospel, etc).

We want the entirety of the project to be unique, challenging, and refreshing.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Share the project with friends, family, etc. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, we are Brooklyn-based bands Lazy Queen and LADY, and we’re here to ask you for money. Both bands have come up through New York’s flourishing DIY scene over the past couple of years, with plentiful of shows both in and around the city. The LADY boys stem from Long Island, while Lazy Queen have members from NYC, Norway and Puerto Rico.

Last January LQ had a blast touring Puerto Rico, and now we want to hit the road again. This time we are setting our sights for the west coast. We'll be driving from NY to Washington, making several stops between Seattle and San Diego in a 10 day tour, before driving all the way back home. This is an important and big step for both groups in getting out there and expanding our reach, and something we’ve been dreaming of doing for a long time. We all have friends and fans on the west coast that we are extremely eager to share our music and live performances with.

Your support in making this happen means the world to us all. Thank you for taking the time to look over this campaign of ours.

What We Need & What You Get

The main expenses we are looking at on this tour are van rental, gas, stupid human needs such as food and hydration, and the occasional lodging when we are not crashing on floors or in the van. We are definitely not asking for the full coverage of our budget, but by our estimates $1000 will at least help us out with getting covered some of the gas or some of the van rental, and of course, should we be so lucky as to exceed out goal, all of the additional money will go to cover these other expenses.

But hey, we’re not just going to ask you to toss money at us with nothing in return, so we’ve tried to put together some neat little perks for you:

The Court Jester Package:

You make us smile and bring joy to our otherwise joyless hearts. With this package you get a digital download of both Lazy Queen’s Drift and LADY’s Washer. And our eternal love of course.

The LADY Love Package:

You are our lady-loves. We love you. You get the same as in the Jester Package, but in addition you get a signed gig poster, buttons and a physical copy of Drift on tape.

The Lazy Knight Package:

We knight you a Knight of the IKEA Table. You get the a digital download of Lazy Queen’s Drift and of LADY’s Washer from last year. In addition, by signing up for this package you are preordering a signed copy of Lazy Queen and LADY’s upcoming split EP. We’ll also add some merch goodies such as buttons and signed photos/posters.

The Queen’s Guard Package:

You are in the most trusted circle of the Queen’s protectors. Our lives are in your hands. You get everything in the Knight Package, but all three EPs will be signed tapes and come with a digital download. We'll also paint you a most lovely custom post card.

The I've-run-out-of-package-names Package:

But that doesn't mean that it's not a great package. You get everything included in the Queen’s Guard Package, but we’ll also add a limited edition Lazy Queen/LADY t-shirt, and as if that wasn’t enough to tickle your bones; you’ll get the phone number of one member of your choosing from either band for your own misuse.

The Audience with the LADY Queen Package:

The Queen is most pleased with your offering and sends us, her loyal subjects, to show you her appreciation. We’ll come play your private or public event (as in we don’t care if it’s a show you’re putting on or if you just need some background music for cleaning your place on Sunday afternoon (help with cleaning comes with an extra fee)) as long as it’s in a 40 mile radius from our home base of Brooklyn, or along the route of our tour on the west coast IF we can work it into the schedule. We’ll also bring with us some of the aforementioned merch goodies and EP’s for you to flash at the gig so you’ll look way cool in front of your friends.

If you can't spare 10 bucks, it's fine, any contribution helps. And if you see us at a show and can prove you gave anything at all we'll slip you some buttons and a hug.

It’s important to us that you know that even if we don’t reach our goal the money will go towards the tour. We will make this happen regardless. We’ll just have to get creative about acquiring the rest of the money. I saw a solid YouTube tutorial on how to rob a bank, so I feel like we’ve got that down at least.

The Impact

We’re not going to claim that this tour will in any way change the world, but you would be supporting 8 guys in spreading music they’ve put blood sweat and tears (occasionally of joy) into. And hopefully we’ll be able to create some memorable nights for our old and new friends on the west coast, which wouldn’t be possible at this time without your help. Your contribution will in a small way help to keep the spirit of DIY and grass-roots art alive. Support you local scene, and, in this case, support your local scene to reach other scenes.

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, life squeezes the very last penny out of your wallet, and it’s hard enough without strangers and friends asking you to give them money to play their silly music. But fear not, there are other ways you can help! Please share this campaign to all of your rich friends. Indiegogo is asking us to remind you to use the Indiegogo share tools, so yeah, go ahead and do that.

Much love always,

- Lazy Queen & LADY

Reyson, Duke, Julian, Ricardo, Steve, JP, Patrick and Henrik

story:
​Adrian Weiss - Criminal Record​

​
 

​​​Hi, I am Adrian Weiss, an American rock and metal guitarist living in Germany and currently active in the power metal band Gloryful with whom I recently released the band’s third album, 'End Of The Night'. Before Gloryful, I was active in the progressive metal bands Forces At Work and Thought Sphere.

In addition to my band activity I began my solo career and released two instrumental solo albums, in 2011 and 2014, and also formed a trio to perform this music live. I have had the pleasure to share stages with many renowned artists such as Christian Münzner, Victor Smolski, Animals As Leaders, Powerwolf, Accept, Hammerfall, Rage and many other well-known acts with my bands and trio.

As you may have guessed, releasing solo albums without having a big name in the guitar scene is not an easy thing to achieve, especially since the production of music on a professional level is expensive and album sales nowadays are rather low in general.

Although I really can't complain – the press’ and fans’ reactions to my CDs being overwhelmingly positive – I am still quite far away from breaking even financially.

In the late fall of 2016 I am releasing my third instrumental album entitled 'Criminal Record'. This time I have decided to reach out to you – my friends, fans and supporters – to help me with the funding of the new album prior to its release, and at the same time to give you the chance to be the first to acquire the new album via a pre-order.

 

In addition this campaign will offer you the possibility of bargain deals on my previous solo albums and aforementioned band CD-back-catalogues of 

Gloryful, Forces At Work and Thought Sphere.

  

             

What I Need & What You Get

I have paid for most of the drum, bass and guitar recording already, so the funds I want to raise with this campaign will mainly be used for the cost of 

 

-  final mixing,  

-  the CD mastering, 

-  the artwork (album cover, 12-page booklet, inlay etc.)  

-   the pressing of 1000 CDs, 

-   costs of promotion, shipping etc.

altogether amounting to roughly € 3000. 

 

By contributing to this campaign you will help me cover the remaining costs of the album production and be one of the very first to get ahold of the CD or download – several weeks before its official release.

 

The Perks

Your perks of choice will be mailed out to you as soon as this campaign ends - along with an e-mailed immediate download-link to the new album. The perks consist of the following items:

 

Adrian Weiss - Criminal Record (CD 2016, 9 Tracks, 47:30 min.)

 

            

 

Check out the album trailer here to get more impressions of the new album!  

 

 

The Official Criminal-Record-T-Shirt:
 

         

  

 
In addition to my new solo album (digital or physical format) you can also get bargain deals on my previous solo albums and band CDs as well as my official T-shirt by choosing the respective perks on the right. My back catalogue contains the following albums (limited to digital format where indicated):
 

Adrian Weiss - Easy Game (CD 2014, 12 tracks, 53 min.)

Adrian Weiss - Big Time (CD 2011, 11 tracks, 47 min.)

 

Check out the videos below to get more impressions from my previous solo albums.
 

Gloryful - End Of The Night (CD 2016, 10 tracks, 46 min.)

             

 

 

Forces At Work - Straight (CD 2012, 10 tracks, 52 min.)

Forces At Work - Reverse Feng-Shui Audio Guide (CD 2006, 5 tracks, 30 min.)

Forces At Work - Forcilized (EP 2004, 5 tracks, 22 min. - digital only)

Forces At Work - Coldheart Canyon (EP 2003, 6 tracks, 26 min. - digital only)

 

 

  

 

Thought Sphere - Eos (CD 2002, 9 tracks, 43 min.)

Thought Sphere - Gold (Maxi-CD 2001, 4 tracks, 13 min.)

Thought Sphere - Vague Horizons (CD 2000, 12 tracks, 51 min.)

Thought Sphere - Eden's Shore (CD 1998, 10 tracks, 49 min.)

Thought Sphere - Grailkeeper's Gate (CD 1997, 8 tracks, 42 min. - digital only)

 

 

 

 

The official Big Time T-Shirt is also available:

 

 

 

 

 

Don´t worry! Even if I don´t reach the desired funding goal, all orders will be sent out as soon as this campaign is over, a good three weeks before the album will be released on Dec 16 2016.
 
Criminal Record Line-Up and Credits:

 

Drums - Lars Zehner

Bass - Marcel Willnat

Guitars - Adrian Weiss

Production - Tim Schulte

Mastering - Eroc

Artwork - Killustrations

The album contains 9 songs with a total running time of 47:30 minutes and features guest performances by 

Jen Majura (Evanescence), 

Michael Dietz (Warrant), 

Jimmy Pitts (Eternity's End, Pitts/Minnemann Project, Fractured Dimension), 

Niels Loeffler (Orden Ogan), 

Stefan Weber (Axxis, Lion Twin, Rebattered)

Tom 'Fountainhead' Geldschläger (Obscura, Pitts/ Minnemann Project) 

 

Also check out my previous video clips:

 

 

More and more, the personal relation between musicians and music lovers and the mutual support is becoming the basis of a new form of music industry.

Your idealistic support and interest in our music is what keeps independent musicians like myself going, so thanks in advance to all of you who are willing to pre-order and thereby financially support the release of this album!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially and still want to support the album campaign, feel free to share this page in your social media and recommend the campaign to fans of instrumental rock music.

Thanks again for your help and enjoy the music!
