story:
Reviving Remarkable Music

Long before “talkies” came along, a beautiful and amazing repertoire of film music was being created by gifted composers, whose work went mostly unrecorded, uncredited and swept away into obscurity when the silent era ended.

Often when people think of "silent film music", they imagine an out-of-tune piano playing for flickering images. But in fact, music of the silent film era was much more than this! During approximately the last 15 years of the silent era leading up to its end in 1929, live orchestras were being used in movie theaters, and a new art form had developed in which some very wonderful, compelling and exceptional music was being written to accompany films. But in 1929 it all came to end as theaters began to convert over to sound. And since live musical accompaniment was no longer needed, this music became almost instantly worthless. Many movie theaters discarded their music libraries, and the composers of this wonderful music are mostly not remembered today.

Famous Players Orchestra believes this music deserves to be heard again! We are dedicated to raising the public's awareness of this wonderful music through live musical performances with films of the period using our 25 piece orchestra, as well as producing new recordings and videos so that future generations can appreciate this remarkable musical treasure.

We are a non-profit whose mission is dedicated to performing and recording this charming and long forgotten music because we feel it is of great cultural and historic importance, not only as an indigenous American musical treasure, but also as a significant chapter in the history and development of cinema.

Our Project

The project we are funding is a CD recording titled: “Music of the Silent Cinema”, Vol. 1. The recording will feature our 25 piece orchestra performing representative works from approximately 20 of the most notable composers of this genre. Members of our orchestra are from among the finest professional symphony and session musicians in Los Angeles. The recording engineers, studio, post production mixing and mastering will be of top quality. Your contributions will help with the numerous production costs of making this recording.

This CD will be our very first recording project, and we have many other exiting projects planned for the future including unique silent film releases on DVD and Blu Ray.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a brief break down of our projected production costs to record:

  • $36,438. for Musicians (25 Piece Orchestra)
  • $7320. for Studio (approx. 15 hours)/Engineer/Mixing
  • $3100. for Mastering/Replicating 

Our Perks

We have some very nice perks planned for our contributors which will include coffee mugs, T-shirts, a copy of our new CD, tickets to our live shows in Southern California, and your name mentioned in our CD booklet. At Level Seven, for $1000. contribution, you'll get everything from the previous levels, plus you'll be our guest at a private screening of silent films with live musical accompaniment. You will really love this perk! 

Where do the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal?

First of all, we will make sure every donor receives the perks they were promised. If you were promised a copy of our new CD as a perk, but we have not yet completed it, the worst this could mean would be a delay in getting your CD. We will continue with every means possible of fundraising until we have raised enough money to complete production of this CD recording project.  Because of the enormity of this project, (and just to be on the 'safe' side) we are estimating delivery of the finished CD by May 2016. Of course it could be much sooner!

On a Personal Note

Hi my name is Scott Lasky, I am the Musical Director of Famous Players Orchestra.  Thank you for checking out our campaign and I hope you will consider becoming a part of our exciting project through your support,

I have an extensive background in music, with over 30 years as a professional musician, composer, and orchestrator.  My love for silent films goes back to when I was a teenager. My friends and I used to collect silent films on 8mm (and super 8!).

It was around 15 years ago when I first came into possession of a box of old music which contained many silent film compositions. At the time, I was mainly interested in this music for study purposes.  But my interest and affection for this music quickly grew, and I soon found myself becoming a devoted collector of silent era scores, steadily adding to my collection over the years.

As a musician, I have been continually impressed by the skill, craftsmanship and training of many of these composers, most of whom were strongly from European musical traditions. Their work firmly reflects values carried over from  the out-going 19th century which prescribed diligence, self discipline and a sense of duty.  I have also been impressed by how sincerely many of these composers felt about the importance of their work, believing that film music was not merely a commercial furor, but a genuine medium with great potential and promise, and one which should be taken seriously by every earnest, legitimate composer.    

Over the years I have sought for a way to do my part in reviving this wonderful forgotten music. My dream was to start an orchestra exclusively for this purpose. Eventually, I and some other enthusiasts formed Famous Players Orchestra as a non profit, so that the public could take part in helping to sponsor our mission.  I feel very fortunate to have such a wonderful group of people serving on our board of directors, which includes some film preservationists, historians, musicians, an accountant and a college professor. We are a relatively new organization and we have a lot of great plans for the future. We recognize that others have done fine work in helping to revive this genre, but at the same time, it must be acknowledged that silent era film music remains a grossly under-served musical genre. We feel we have much to contribute to this cause, and with your kind support, we will!

Please share your love of silent films and this great historic music with a contribution to our campaign.  Thank you!

Scott
story_txt:
Reviving Remarkable Music 
 

Long before “talkies” came along, a beautiful and amazing repertoire of film music was being created by gifted
composers, whose work went mostly unrecorded,
uncredited and swept away into obscurity when the silent era ended. 


Often when people think of "silent film music", they imagine an
out-of-tune piano playing for flickering images. But in fact, music of the
silent film era was much more than this! During approximately the last 15 years of the silent era leading up to its end in 1929, live orchestras were being used in movie theaters, and a new art
form had developed in which some very wonderful, compelling and exceptional
music was being written to accompany films. But in
1929 it all came to end as theaters began to convert over to sound. And since
live musical accompaniment was no longer needed, this music became almost
instantly worthless. Many movie theaters discarded their music libraries, and the composers of this wonderful music are mostly not remembered today. 
Famous Players Orchestra believes this music deserves to be
heard again! We are dedicated to raising the public's awareness of this wonderful music through live musical performances with films
of the period using our 25 piece orchestra, as well as producing new recordings and videos so
that future generations can appreciate this remarkable musical treasure. 
We are a non-profit whose mission is
dedicated to performing and recording this charming and long forgotten music because we feel it
is of great cultural and historic importance, not only as an indigenous
American musical treasure, but also as a significant chapter in the history and
development of cinema. 

Our Project



The project we are funding is a CD recording titled: “Music
of the Silent Cinema”, Vol. 1. The recording will feature our 25 piece orchestra
performing representative works from approximately 20 of the most notable
composers of this genre. Members of our orchestra are from among the finest professional symphony and session musicians in Los Angeles. The recording engineers, studio, post production mixing and mastering will be of top quality. Your contributions will help with the numerous production costs
of making this recording. 
This CD will be our very first recording project, and we have
many other exiting projects planned for the future including unique silent film
releases on DVD and Blu Ray. 

 
What We Need & What You Get Here is a brief break down of our projected production costs to record: 
$36,438. for Musicians (25 Piece Orchestra) 

$7320. for Studio (approx. 15 hours)/Engineer/Mixing 

$3100. for Mastering/Replicating  


Our PerksWe have some very nice perks planned for our contributors which will include coffee mugs, T-shirts, a copy of our new CD, tickets to our live shows in Southern California, and your name mentioned in our CD booklet. At Level Seven, for $1000. contribution, you'll get everything from the previous levels, plus you'll be our guest at a private screening of silent films with live musical accompaniment. You will really love this perk!  Where do the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal?First of all, we will make sure every donor receives the perks they were promised. If you were promised a copy of our new CD as a perk, but we have not yet completed it, the worst this could mean would be a delay in getting your CD. We will continue with every means possible of fundraising until we have raised enough money to complete production of this CD recording project.  Because of the enormity of this project, (and just to be on the 'safe' side) we are estimating delivery of the finished CD by May 2016. Of course it could be much sooner!
 
On a Personal Note
Hi my name is Scott Lasky, I am the Musical Director of Famous Players Orchestra.  Thank you for checking out our campaign and I hope you will consider becoming a part of our exciting project through your support,
I have an extensive background in music, with over 30 years as a professional musician, composer, and orchestrator.  My love for silent films goes back to when I was a teenager. My friends and I used to collect silent films on 8mm (and super 8!). 

It was around 15 years ago when I first came into possession of a box of old music which contained many silent film compositions. At the time, I was mainly interested in this music for study purposes.  But my interest and affection for this music quickly grew, and I soon found myself becoming a devoted collector of silent era scores, steadily adding to my collection over the years. 
As a musician, I have been continually impressed by the skill, craftsmanship and training of many of these composers, most of whom were strongly from European musical traditions. Their work firmly reflects values carried over from  the out-going 19th century which prescribed diligence, self discipline and a sense of duty.  I have also been impressed by how sincerely many of these composers felt about the importance of their work, believing that film music was not merely a commercial furor, but a genuine medium with great potential and promise, and one which should be taken seriously by every earnest, legitimate composer.     
Over the years I have sought for a way to do my part in reviving this wonderful forgotten music. My dream was to start an orchestra exclusively for this purpose. Eventually, I and some other enthusiasts formed Famous Players Orchestra as a non profit, so that the public could take part in helping to sponsor our mission.  I feel very fortunate to have such a wonderful group of people serving on our board of directors, which includes some film preservationists, historians, musicians, an accountant and a college professor. We are a relatively new organization and we have a lot of great plans for the future. We recognize that others have done fine work in helping to revive this genre, but at the same time, it must be acknowledged that silent era film music remains a grossly under-served musical genre. We feel we have much to contribute to this cause, and with your kind support, we will! 
Please share your love of silent films and this great historic music with a contribution to our campaign.  Thank you!
Scott

story:
Will you help us?


We have some exciting plans for 2016 but need your help with it!  As with most klapas, we self finance ourselves with a small amount of assistance from the city of Zadar.  We would be most grateful for any assistance towards our campaign and if you could spread the word!

For 2016, our projects include:

  • Recording our very first CD.  We have already began the recording process and hope to have this completed by early Spring.  Check out our YouTube Channel for some of our recent performances. This for us is the most important thing we have for 2016!

  • New Suits - we have been wearing the same suits for several years now are are worn and tattered.  Several of our newer members also have different suits from the rest.  We are looking to have designed suits traditional suits from the Zadar region so that we are recognized as a klapa from Zadar!

  • Assistance to finance our singing teacher. We need our singing teacher to help us reach our goals.

  • Assistance to help fund our travels around Croatia as well another potential concert outside.  If you would like us to perform in your city - lets us know!!!


The Klapa Kožino Story

Klapa Kožino first started out in 2003 and has kept the original way of singing Dalmatian songs without accompaniment of instruments.

At the beginning of 2012, Kožino experienced a “generational change” and has been performing in this new line-up since.

Its been an exciting and rewarding last few years, Klapa Kožino has performed at the festival "Zlatna školjka" (Golden Shell) in Pakoštane four times and received bronze and silver medals, and in 2013 it won the absolute golden award and the Grand Prix of the festival. In 2015, Kožino won the Grand Prix of the festival!

These last few years have been extraordinary, in 2012 after winning 1st award at Debutants’ Evening at Festival of Dalmatian Klapas in Omiš, in Bol (the island of Brač), it went on to reach the Festival’s Superfinal.

In the final evening of the 47th Festival of Dalmatian Klapas in Omiš (2013), Kožino won the 2nd award of the expert jury (the Silver shield with the emblem of the city of Omiš) and the 2nd award of the audience (the Silver “leut” boat).

In the final evening of the 48th Festival of Dalmatian Klapas in Omiš (2014), Kožino won the 1st award of the expert jury (the Golden shield with the emblem of the city of Omiš) and the 2nd award of the audience (the Silver “leut” boat).

In August 2014, at the 1st International Festival of Klapas in Posušje, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Klapa Kožino won the 1st award of the expert jury (the Tombstone of Posušje) and the 1st award of the audience (the Bora).

And last by not least, in 2015 in Posušje, Klapa Kožino won the 1st award of the expert jury (the Tombstone of Posušje).

Their first international concert was held in London in October 2014 and was a great success.  They also held their own individual concerts on Hvar in August 2014 and in Zadar in September 2014.  We look forward to what 2016 will bring!

Klapa Kožino Members:

Tenors: Duje Stanišić, Stipe Štrkalj

Baritons: Marin Milić, Daniel Vidović

Bass: Jurica Polkovnikov, Mate Stručić, Jure Perica


    About Klapa Singing

    Klapa singing is a multipart singing tradition of the southern Croatian regions of Dalmatia. It was inscribed in 2012 on the Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity. Multipart singing, a capella homophonic singing, oral tradition and simple music making are its main features. The leader of each singing group is the first tenor, followed by several tenori, baritoni and basi voices. During performances, the singers stand in a tight semicircle. The first tenor starts the singing and is followed by the others. The main aim is to achieve the best possible blend of voices. Technically, klapa singers express their mood by means of open guttural, nasal sotto voce and falsetto singing, usually in high-pitched tessitura. Another feature is the ability to sing freely, without the help of notation. Topics of klapa songs usually deal with love, life situations, and the environment in which they live. Bearers and practitioners are skilled amateurs who inherit the tradition from their predecessors. Their ages vary with many younger people singing with older singers. In ‘traditional klapa’, knowledge is transferred orally. ‘Festival klapa’ is more formally organized with a focus on performance and presentation. In ‘modern klapa’, young singers gain experience by attending performances and listening to recordings. Local communities see klapa singing as a central marker of their musical identity, incorporating respect for diversity, creativity and communication.

story:
The Reggie Pittman / Loren Daniels Quartet

Reggie Pittman – trumpet / flugelhorn 
Loren Daniels – piano / Fender Rhodes electric piano / Hammond B3
Mike Richmond – bass
Jonathon Peretz – drums

The quartet is a group of seasoned jazz musicians/educators from all over the U.S. who now reside in the metropolitan NYC area.  Some of the greats that they have played with include: Milt Jackson, Stan Getz, The Mingus Dynasty Band, Blood, Sweat and Tears, Maynard Ferguson, The Allman Brothers Band, Levon Helm, The Duke Ellington Orchestra,  Lionel Hampton, Aretha Franklin, Sarah Vaughan, Clay Aiken, Rufus Reid, Calvin Hill, Craig Harris, Eliot Zigmund and Makonda McIntyre.

All members of the quartet have taught music to all levels from nursery school to graduate school.

The Reggie Pittman/Loren Daniels Quartet plays original compositions by both Daniels and Pittman and innovative arrangements of jazz classics and popular standards.  Their previous release, Point A to Point A, zoomed up the jazz charts and received high praise from the jazz press. 

"Point A To Point A" is a return to the great sounds of jazz legends from the past, brought to us by modern storytellers. Weaving in and out of sonic bliss, the quartet both captures the listener's ear and makes it hard to turn the dial, as the album is packed with hits from open to close. It's rare to find an album without a weak moment, and "Point A To Point A" might be just that."
—Christopher Adams, Cashbox Magazine

Why Should You Support "Smilessence"? 

"Smilessence" is a creative jazz music project that's chock full of original music, composed from the soul and played from the heart! We LOVE doing this, and we wish to share it with as many people as we possibly can. We believe in the positive energy of the creative arts—jazz in particular—and we are looking to share this positivity with the world. With your support, we will be able to bring this out into the world and will be able to continue to write, create, record and perform. 

Help Us to Meet Our Goal! 

We are looking to raise $10,000 to fund this project. This will cover the costs of hiring the musicians, recording, mixing, mastering, manufacturing, marketing and publicizing the release of the CD. In order to bring the highest quality of sound to the music and remain true to the jazz tradition, we record in a professional recording studio with a Grammy-winning engineer.  After post production of the CD, professional marketing and publicity are essential elements to the success of the project. 

Our Thanks To You for Helping

We appreciate you joining the team! In thanks for your support we're offering a wide variety of perks —from digital downloads to private concerts! Please see the Perks offered in the sidebar—we thank you in advance for your contribution to our success!   Please use the IndieGoGo share tools and share out our campaign on all of your social networks. We appreciate your help!

story:
What Greener Pastures is...

I'm finally making an album! After years of thought prayer, different songs and ideas, the time has come! I could not be more excited to step into this project and hope you'll be excited for it too. This album will draw from my southern roots and tell a story of redemption and forgiveness that have made me who I am today!


What This album Needs


  • We are asking for $5,000, this covers the cost to produce, record, mix & master, musician payment and marketing for 7 songs! We really got blessed with this opportunity, and want to take full advantage of it
  • Contributors will receive perks for certain amounts of donations-                            $5- a free digital download of the album                                                                          $10- a hard copy, early release of the album                                                                  $50- early hard copy release of album, and contribution credits on all productions                                                                                                                             $100-   early hard copy release of album, and contribution credits on all productions, and hand written thank you notes from me and everyone in the band!                                                                                                                                         $500-   early hard copy release of album, and contribution credits on all productions, hand written thank you notes from me and everyone in the band and hand-written song lyrics from the album ( theses are notes used to fuel and create what this album will be)                                                                                          $1,500- includes all perks as well as a private showing of the album with the entire band (booking dates would be required)                                                              $5,000- If you fund the entirety of the asking price of this album you will receive all perks packages as well as direct contact (via skype video chat) with the band, updates and exclusive insight on recording as well as production credit on the album!


Why Greener Pastures

This album is my heart on record, my story in ink. I have invested so much time and prayer into every one of these songs and believe the story they tell will further the kingdom of heaven! If this album is even able to speak to one person, then every song, every minuet will have been worth it!


Risks & Challenges

 This album does come with risks and challenges, mainly in the place of timing. We as a band are professional musicians pulled from different ministries from along the east coast all the way to the UK, and this has its difficulties... Like getting everybody into the same room together. Your contributions directly help alleviate a lot of these problems that could come up.


Other Ways You Can Help

 If you are unable to help financially, please spread the word! The more people that get a hold of this, the better! Facebook, twitter, Instagram anything that you can do will be appreciated!

story:
A Christmas Music Project that feeds the hungry!

Since 2011, this annual Holiday Music campaign has raised over $100,000 for charity. Presented by St. Clair College in Windsor, Ontario, the proceeds from this campaign will benefit area foodbanks: The Unemployed Help Centre, The Downtown Mission in Windsor, Ontario and Outreach for Hunger in Chatham-Kent, Ontario.

This will be the 5th time the S’Aints have recorded and performed a holiday album for charity and the 2nd year at Caesars Windsor. Jeff Burrows, a founding member of the S’Aints and also drummer and songwriter of globally successful band The Tea Party, said, “Performing with such a great band at The Colosseum will once again be an epic event. Each year we ramp it up another notch and this year is no exception. Bringing back The Diplomats Drum Line for an extra special set and including St. Clair College students in our choir will elevate this show to heights that have yet been heard”.

The S’Aints features some of the finest musicians in the area, renowned locally and worldwide. They include: Jody Raffoul (lead singer), Jeff Burrows (drums), Garret Bielaniec (lead guitar), Kelly Authier (Vocals & Keys), Mr. Chill Kelly Hoppe (Harp & Sax), David Cyrenne (Bass) and Wes Buckley (Vocals & Guitar). More information can be found at www.holidayharvest.ca.

What We Need & What You Get

The cost of producing and replicating a music CD is very high. We are hoping to raise an additional $10,000 so that more money can be sent to the food banks to feed the hungry during the holiday season!  Join us in our fight against hunger and as our partner, you may be eligible perks such as:

  • Free downloads.
  • Signed individual CD's or full 5 CD box set.
  • 2 seats on stage at the annual Holiday Show.
  • Signed Drum Skin by Jeff Burrows.
  • Signed Guitar by the whole band.
  • Have the band perform 5 songs at your Christmas Party!

All funds go to Food Banks and St. Clair College

Proceeds from this campaign and the sale of concert tickets and “Holiday Harvest” CDs will benefit area foodbanks: The Unemployed Help Centre, The Downtown Mission in Windsor, Ontario and Outreach for Hunger in Chatham, Ontario.

Since 1967 St. Clair College and it’s more than 90,000 alumni have been an integral part of the communities of  Windsor-Essex and Chatham-Kent. A portion of the proceeds from this CD will go to St. Clair College Programs and Scholarships fund so that students of all ages can improve their quality of life through education.

St. Clair College is proud to help put hope on the table again this year with proceeds from this CD being shared with local food banks; The Unemployed Help Centre, The Downtown Mission in Windsor, Ontario and Outreach for Hunger in Chatham, Ontario.

Thank you for helping us provide needy families with food during this holiday season! Together we can help to alleviate some of the pressure of the season and, hopefully, help more families to create lasting memories with their loved ones.

Other Ways You Can Help

You aren't in the position to help us fund this project? You can help us raise funds by purchasing downloads, CDs or concert tickets for this year's ALL AGES show at Caesars Windsor on December 20th!

    For details on purchasing music and/or tickets, visit www.holidayharvest.ca.

Since 2011, this annual Holiday Music campaign has raised over $100,000 for charity. Presented by St. Clair College in Windsor, Ontario, the proceeds from this campaign will benefit area foodbanks: The Unemployed Help Centre, 
The Downtown Mission in Windsor, Ontario and Outreach for Hunger in 
Chatham-Kent, Ontario. 

This will be the 5th time the S’Aints have recorded and performed a holiday album for charity and the 2nd
 year at Caesars Windsor. Jeff Burrows, a founding member of the S’Aints
 and also drummer and songwriter of globally successful band The Tea 
Party, said, “Performing with such a great band at The Colosseum will 
once again be an epic event. Each year we ramp it up another notch and 
this year is no exception. Bringing back The Diplomats Drum Line for an 
extra special set and including St. Clair College students in our choir 
will elevate this show to heights that have yet been heard”.
The S’Aints features some of the finest musicians in the area, renowned locally and worldwide. They include: Jody Raffoul (lead singer), Jeff Burrows (drums), Garret Bielaniec (lead guitar), Kelly Authier (Vocals & Keys), Mr. Chill Kelly Hoppe (Harp & Sax), David Cyrenne (Bass) and Wes Buckley (Vocals & Guitar). More information can be found at www.holidayharvest.ca.
What We Need & What You Get
 The cost of producing and replicating a music CD is very high. We are hoping to raise an additional $10,000 so that more money can be sent to the food banks to feed the hungry during the holiday season!  Join us in our fight against hunger and as our partner, you may be eligible perks such as:  Free downloads.  Signed individual CD's or full 5 CD box set. 
 2 seats on stage at the annual Holiday Show.

Signed Drum Skin by Jeff Burrows.
Signed Guitar by the whole band.
Have the band perform 5 songs at your Christmas Party!
    All funds go to Food Banks and St. Clair College
Proceeds from this campaign and the sale of concert tickets and “Holiday Harvest” CDs will benefit area foodbanks: The Unemployed Help Centre, The Downtown Mission in Windsor, Ontario and Outreach for Hunger in Chatham, Ontario. Since 1967 St. Clair College and it’s more than 90,000 alumni have been an integral part of the communities of  Windsor-Essex and Chatham-Kent. A portion of the proceeds from this CD will go to St. Clair College Programs and Scholarships fund so that students of all ages can improve their quality of life through education. St. Clair College is proud to help put hope on the table again this year with proceeds from this CD being shared with local food banks; The Unemployed Help Centre, The Downtown Mission in Windsor, Ontario and Outreach for Hunger in Chatham, Ontario. Thank you for helping us provide needy families with food during this holiday season! Together we can help to alleviate some of the pressure of the season and, hopefully, help more families to create lasting memories with their loved ones.  Other Ways You Can Help You aren't in the position to help us fund this project? You can help us raise funds by purchasing downloads, CDs or concert tickets for this year's ALL AGES show at Caesars Windsor on December 20th!   For details on purchasing music and/or tickets, visit www.holidayharvest.ca.

XX ABSOLUTE Log 13:01 (The Overview) :

#XXtraterrestrials Unite! 

I, XX ABSOLUTE, have travelled from the outer most reaches of space & time to convey to you a message of love. For decades I have analyzed, indulged in, and absorbed the culture here on Earth, and while doing so have come to understand the power behind art in its multitude of forms. As a creator I have travelled through the darkness of my own illusion to discover true freedom within, and now wish to share with you the secrets of the universe through the medium of my passion; music. 

My new mixxtape 'The 13th Hour' available for free download at : http://www.datpiff.com/XX-ABSOLUTE-The-13th-Hour-Mixxtape-mixtape.738781.html

 

 is a symbolic representation of the transformation I have undergone, and ask for you to listen to this piece of art through with the concepts of transformation, evolution, & duality in mind. Understanding these themes, I've chosen to construct a 5 part music video short film for 'The 13th Hour' to display my vision to you all in a collaborative effort with Gadow Productions.

We're currently pre-production on part 3 of this video collection for my new song 'Slay', a very important piece in all that I look to accomplish as I anticipate this music video, if properly matched with my vision, to propel my art forward into the eyes, ears, and hearts of many. If this goal is reached, I then would be one step closer to reaching my ultimate vision as an artist/creator/ambassador of love, and in turn another step closer to completing my mission here on earth. 

My friend, thank you for taking the time to read over this log, and know that by investing in this piece of art, you are ultimately investing in the belief of love, the belief in the power of music, and the belief in yourself.

With Love,

XX ABSOLUTE

story:
Short Summary

We are Dead Slow Hoot, a 3-piece band from Sheffield who have been playing and gigging together for the last two years. Having released our self-titled debut EP in February of last year we had an action packed 2015, the highlight of which was supporting Billy Bragg at Leadmill during Sheffield's legendary Tramlines festival. 
With the turning of the New Year we are excited to announce that our creative juices have been flowing, and as a band we are blending our existing style with new influences and hip-hop/disco style beats to create a whole new sound. We cannot wait to bring these new songs to our dedicated fans - but we need your help! 

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise £800 to fund the following:

  • Costs of recording and producing a 7 track EP. This will include all recording time, studio hire and mastering costs.
  • Buying CD's.
  • Paying for the biggest night of our musical careers - our EP launch!
What you can get:
  • A whole range of exclusive benefits depending on how much you are willing to give. Everyone who donates a minimum of £5 will receive a physical copy of our EP. For more details on additional benefits, please look at our 'Perks' page.

Risks & Challenges

As we returned from recording our first EP, we skidded in the Sheffield snow, almost destroying hundreds of pounds of valuable musical equipment. Despite the unpredictability of the British weather, we hope to avoid a similar incident this time round. 

In the words of Isaac Newton, "What goes up, must come down."

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel able to donate financially, please take the time to tell your friends about us. We love our music and playing together, and we hope you do too. Also, if you are lucky enough to live in the wonderful city of Sheffield, please take the time to come and support us at the EP launch or one of our subsequent gigs.

Thanks, 

DSH x

story:
Hello!

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit my campaign page.  

About me:

I have been a professional singer for over twenty years, but only started writing songs about five years ago.  Living on my own and in a strange city (with no TV-YAY!!), I started to piece together melodies with chords- and then managed to attach some lyrics.  Coming from a classical background, I didn’t know I could write songs.  Since then, I have played hundreds of benefits and shows, been a finalist in several competitions, played numerous music festivals and even had my music featured in an award-winning independent film.  When I’m not writing or performing music, I am teaching children and adults how to sing and play guitar. 

This summer, I'll be recording a new album with full instrumentation and under the guidance of Jim Salamone (Cambridge Sound Studios). I am raising funds in order to create and promote the best-possible sounding record.

Contributors to my campaign can receive digital downloads, signed copies of the album, mention in liner notes, hand-written lyric sheets or even a house concert! 

Thank you so much for your support. <3

story:
Short Summary

KAO=S started in Tokyo in April, 2011 with Kaori Kawabuchi (Vocals / Sword Dance), Shuji Yamagiri (Acoustic Guitar / Vocals) and Jack (Tsugaru Shamisen). Out of the turmoil that followed the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami, we distilled a new style of Japanese art to bring to the world, which we called ‘chaos’ or, following the Japanese pronunciation, KAO=S (‘Kah-oss’).

Our sounds combine Japanese traditional elements and modern Rock music, along with musical theatre. We developed our music and performance into a ‘‘Japanese Art Rock Band” that we're sure you'll love. Our sound is a blend of vocals and acoustic guitar, overlaid with traditional Japanese instruments such as the three-string Tsugaru Shamisen. Complemented by Kaori’s spellbindingly powerful sword dance, KAO=S has quickly caught people’s attention. We have performed at SXSW in 2012 and 2013, the Japan Expo in Paris, and toured live in Europe and the US. In November 2014, we appeared on the CNN International program "The Art of Movement ", and if you have a chance please take a look! http://edition.cnn.com/videos/bestoftv/2014/12/15/spc-art-of-movement-japan-rock-kaos.cnn

So many of our fans and music companies outside of Japan have reached out to us asking us to perform. We would love to take everyone up on their offers and start bringing KAO=S overseas, but to do that we need to put out a new album to coincide with an overseas tour. You could help us to make an album that lets us showcase our unique Japanese sound and spread our music and Japanese culture to other countries. We don't want to miss this chance - we need your help to release our album and take KAO=S to the world.

We are planning to record eight songs in the album. It is going to be very expensive to record these songs at a level of quality that our fans deserve. We decided to do crowd funding on Indie Go Go to raise funds to that end. Please support us, and help us release the best music we possibly can for you and everyone else who loves KAO=S.


What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to record music in a professional music studio, with a sound engineer and musical instrument arrangement including various traditional Japanese backing instrumentals. A professional synthesizer programmer will be hired to clean up our sound for digital formats. We will be recording in high resolution formats, and all tracks will be professionally mastered to ensure the highest quality possible.

If we don't reach our target funding level, we won't be able to realise an eight track album recorded at a professional quality. Rather than lowering quality based on available funding, if we don't reach the target we will be releasing a shorter album with fewer tracks, which means you will still get the best music we can make at the highest quality possible – just less of it.

Everyone who supports us will receive a copy of the digital album through your choice of iTunes, Google play, or other major online music distributors. In addition, supporters who are able to visit Tokyo by July, 2017 will be eligible for special rewards. Please take a look at the perks for details. All perks will be provided as listed to all supporters, whether the funding target is reached or not.


 The Impact

We are a completely independent band, and started our own production company for KAO=S last year. We manage all of our band activity as an LLC company and are working hard to organise an overseas live booking agent and contract now. We also have offers from overseas music publishing companies to use our music.

We will be putting on live shows using the music from the new album all over the world. We want to spread the music of KAO=S to the people who learend of us through CNN International's program "The Art of Movement" and elsewhere. We hope you enjoy KAO=S's music and performance that mixes the music of tradional and modern Japan.


Risks & Challenges

Even if the funding target isn't reached we will be recording as many songs for the album as we can, and will provide all of the packages promised to supporters. However, if we are forced to reduce the number of songs on the album negotiating its wide-scale release with music distributors may become more difficult. We currently are running a separate crowd funding campaign through a Japan-only site called Motion Gallery too, which should help us towards our goal. Thanks to the great support of all of our fans here in Japan and overseas, we believe that we can gather the funds needed to release the full album.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please support us, and share our campaign with your friends on Facebook and Twitter. Get to know us through our website, on Youtube, Facebook and Twitter. Listen to our music and watch our videos, and if you like us please share KAO=S with your friends. It would be a great help to us if you do.

When you help me in Japanese, please look at the Motion Gallery website.
日本語での支援をご希望の方は、以下のリンクから応援をお願い致します。
MotionGallery web site　「CNN世界放送でオファー激増の和風アートロックバンドKAO=S、新作アルバムで世界に挑む！」

story:
Hey friends (old and new), it’s the boys!

We’ve come from all around the world (Ireland, Turkey, the US) and found ourselves in Nashville, sitting on a bunch of songs that we’ve written that we love and have big ideas for. Wild Love has been a band for 7 years now, with different songs and sounds all along the way, but we really feel these new songs are the most ‘Wild Love’ we’ve ever been, and we’re so excited to share them with you. 

We’ll be honest -- we don’t have a label, a manager, big investors, or buckets of cash sitting around (would be nice though), but what we do have is the visionary mind of Brandon, the business brain of Mike and the hard working hands of Si, as well as a team of amazing creatives we partner with like Ryan Yount (audio engineering, co-production) and Hannah Hall (music videos direction). We love our dream team, and we think with the right budget, we can give these songs what they deserve. 

In order to give these songs everything we think they deserve, and make these songs into something that you deserve, we need a little help. What you can give will be met with t-shirts, handwritten lyrics, meet and greets, exclusive behind the scenes access, special content and more, and what you can give will specifically go towards the costs to record, release and bring these songs to the world, as well as give them a face through artwork and videos, and so much more that we can’t wait to tell you about.

And don’t worry, your money won’t just be spent on green M&Ms or expensive outfits for photoshoots (we make Brandon pay for his own candy and clothes). We have been working with balanced, responsible and smart budgets for years now to use the little we have to make our releases as great as possible. Our latest album, They Call Me Kid brought us fans from around the world through with songs like ‘Tuesday Night’ and music videos like ‘Bitter’, and the singles we released in 2019 led to a performance at Nashville’s Live on the Green Festival (sharing the bill with Grace Potter, Lake Street Drive, Gary Clark Jr. and many more). We plan to have the same responsible approach, making the most of the budget we’ve got...the budget is just a little bigger this time around, and that’s why we need your help!

We also understand that not everyone can contribute financially -- no worries! We still love you, and are just stoked that you read this far. If you can’t contribute financially, you can still help us out by telling your world about Wild Love and what we’re trying to do here. Indiegogo makes it super easy to share this on socials, and we made that video above so it could be shared, so post it on socials or text it to some friends!

Wait...you’ve read this far? Thank you, seriously, even that means so much to us. We hope that you can take a few minutes to tell a friend about this, and give what you can so that we can send you a thank you note, a shirt, or maybe even give you a private acoustic show! 

Whether you’ve been with us for years, or you’re meeting us for the first time on this page, we’re just so happy to know you and that you’re a part of this community. 

If you have questions, there’s some answers below -- if those don’t answer your question though, feel free to shoot us a note at info@wearewildlove.com (or DM us on Instagram @wearewildlove) and we’ll be able to help you out. 

Thanks again, we’ll see you soon!

Love,
the boys

(video above by Ben Sorenson -- thanks Ben!)

New to Wild Love? Check out some of our music and videos below:

Bitter Official Music Video

Listen on Spotify - https://open.spotify.com/artist/2HgUSKcdkOOicatZDmzdn6?si=K0FQf8U3Tzm_gZuvwIDEVw&dl_branch=1

Follow us on Socials

Facebook || Instagram || Twitter || YouTube

We’ve come from all around the world (Ireland, Turkey, the US) and found ourselves in Nashville, sitting on a bunch of songs that we’ve written that we love and have big ideas for. Wild Love has been a band for 7 years now, with different songs and sounds all along the way, but we really feel these new songs are the most ‘Wild Love’ we’ve ever been, and we’re so excited to share them with you. 
We’ll be honest -- we don’t have a label, a manager, big investors, or buckets of cash sitting around (would be nice though), but what we do have is the visionary mind of Brandon, the business brain of Mike and the hard working hands of Si, as well as a team of amazing creatives we partner with like Ryan Yount (audio engineering, co-production) and Hannah Hall (music videos direction). We love our dream team, and we think with the right budget, we can give these songs what they deserve. 
In order to give these songs everything we think they deserve, and make these songs into something that you deserve, we need a little help. What you can give will be met with t-shirts, handwritten lyrics, meet and greets, exclusive behind the scenes access, special content and more, and what you can give will specifically go towards the costs to record, release and bring these songs to the world, as well as give them a face through artwork and videos, and so much more that we can’t wait to tell you about.
And don’t worry, your money won’t just be spent on green M&Ms or expensive outfits for photoshoots (we make Brandon pay for his own candy and clothes). We have been working with balanced, responsible and smart budgets for years now to use the little we have to make our releases as great as possible. Our latest album, They Call Me Kid brought us fans from around the world through with songs like ‘Tuesday Night’ and music videos like ‘Bitter’, and the singles we released in 2019 led to a performance at Nashville’s Live on the Green Festival (sharing the bill with Grace Potter, Lake Street Drive, Gary Clark Jr. and many more). We plan to have the same responsible approach, making the most of the budget we’ve got...the budget is just a little bigger this time around, and that’s why we need your help!
We also understand that not everyone can contribute financially -- no worries! We still love you, and are just stoked that you read this far. If you can’t contribute financially, you can still help us out by telling your world about Wild Love and what we’re trying to do here. Indiegogo makes it super easy to share this on socials, and we made that video above so it could be shared, so post it on socials or text it to some friends!
Wait...you’ve read this far? Thank you, seriously, even that means so much to us. We hope that you can take a few minutes to tell a friend about this, and give what you can so that we can send you a thank you note, a shirt, or maybe even give you a private acoustic show! 
Whether you’ve been with us for years, or you’re meeting us for the first time on this page, we’re just so happy to know you and that you’re a part of this community. 
If you have questions, there’s some answers below -- if those don’t answer your question though, feel free to shoot us a note at info@wearewildlove.com (or DM us on Instagram @wearewildlove) and we’ll be able to help you out. 
Thanks again, we’ll see you soon!
Love,the boys(video above by Ben Sorenson -- thanks Ben!)New to Wild Love? Check out some of our music and videos below:Bitter Official Music VideoListen on Spotify - https://open.spotify.com/artist/2HgUSKcdkOOicatZDmzdn6?si=K0FQf8U3Tzm_gZuvwIDEVw&dl_branch=1Follow us on SocialsFacebook || Instagram || Twitter || YouTube

story:
Hi there 

I’m Marcus Anderson, a contemporary jazz, R&B, and pop artist that has been recording for over 16 years. I’ve released 14 albums as an independent which gave me the creative freedom to pursue whatever direction I felt.  

During the pandemic, I found it difficult to create new music and got the bright idea to do this album different from how I’ve done my others. Normally I write the songs, name the songs, record the video of me recording the songs, do the photo shoot, and lastly create the cover to name the album. This time I decided to start from the end work my way backwards and name the album “Reverse”, this Project will be released Spring of 2022.  

You may be asking yourself, why do I (an established artist) need to hold an Indiegogo fundraising campaign to make this album? With us coming off a pandemic and musicians not working for over a year. Starting new projects has been a challenge with me being a solo independent artist. Here are some major benefits as well that help complete this project: 

1. The money raised here will go directly towards the making of this album and photo shoot and video recording of the making of the project. Since I’m an indie artist, this is all out of pocket. That’s right, all funded by just me. What is raised will be poured directly back into completing the project and post marketing of this album. 

2. The more we raise, the more we can do to cover the cost of reversing the project. My costs include (session musician fees, production cost, horn section, string arrangements, mixing fee, mastering costs, studio rental recording fees, publicist, radio promotion, photo shoot, music videos, album artwork design, printing, other marketing expenses, etc. which all add up to well over $20,000.   

3. Lastly, at the $25 level and up, I’m going to include an EXCLUSIVE BONUS TRACK that only YOU will get via digital download, as I like this special treat as a giveaway. This song will NOT be released to the public, ever!  

My goal is to raise $15,000 here on Indiegogo, however, the net from that after Indiegogo and Credit Card fees plus fulfillment costs will be around $3,000 which will leave a remaining $12,000. Therefore, if we could raise more, that would be amazing!  

This is my 2nd Indiegogo campaign 

And if you are unable to contribute at this time, you can still help ‘spread the word’ via your social media (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, etc.). Any mention would be sincerely appreciated! 

Help me “Reverse” the project,  

 

~Marcus 

 

 

Perks 

This is where WE can use YOUR help... 

In order for me to pay for the rest of the ‘Project’ costs (I’ll break it down for you shortly), I really need your financial support to finish it. Our projections show an additional $15,000 is needed to complete everything (my goal here on Indiegogo is $15k which covers the rest of the cost of Studio Recording, Paying session Musicians, Producers, Graphics, Comic book Printing, Animated Video, mixing, mastering. Since I remain an independent artist, I simply don’t have the deep pockets of the major record labels to do projects like this.  Any and every dollar given will greatly be appreciated and used to the completion of this Project. 

Here’s the breakdown of where the money raised is going: 

• Mixing of the music. 

• Mastering of the music. 

* Comic Book Pressing and design cost. 

* Video Animation Creation to match the Cartoon. (including the editor and post-production.) 

• Artwork & Design (for both the Album and Video documentary behind the scenes and CD/Calendar packaging). 

• Manufacturing & Shipping cost. 

•Marketing Expenses.  

*Musician studio cost. 

*Producer cost. 

• and more...  

 

This is all on top of what has already been done and paid for, including: 

• Pre- Production for music. 

* Studio Session Musician recording. 

* Pre-Artwork and Characters design. 

* Some Sample Printing for Calendar and posters. 

* Some Pre-Video Behind the scenes recordings. 

As you see, this is a lot into completing a finished commercial release. Obviously, there is a lot more to it than just putting out another album.  

YOU can help contribute to this project via the many ‘Perks’ available to choose from. Starting at just $25 all the way up to $8,000 :) 

And if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help get the word out. Please tell your friends, family, and co-workers about this campaign, and feel free to use the 'share' tools right here on the Indiegogo site. It would be so appreciated. 

I sincerely thank you for any and all support and can’t wait to get this done.

story:
What this album is about

STEM: the Musical Explains the Universe! is a groundbreaking edutainment musical production that has been performed live for over 50,000 students. Now, for the first time, you can listen to the inspirational soundtrack anytime you want!

The show was designed to inspire students of every background, teaching them that their dreams matter, and that there is a path for each of them. Our audiences come away educated, entertained, and inspired for a lifetime of learning. With educational content that's delivered in fun, upbeat songs in a variety of musical styles, audiences of all ages are immediately engaged, and delight to the rhymes and music that never stops.

Enthusiastically described as “Hamilton for the sciences” STEM: the Musical Explains the Universe! is the first theatrical production to receive the prestigious educational TrustMark, granted by STEM.org. The high-energy score features pop, Latin, techno, and funk (among others!), along with science and math content drawn directly from state educational standards.

Follow four students - Stella, Tre, Eric, and Maddie - as they navigate their way through the STEM disciplines, learning important lessons along the way. During their journey, they discover that science and math are integral parts of their everyday lives, and that any dream is possible if you believe in yourself and work hard.

 

We need your help!

The album was recorded in 2019, and we need your help to put the finishing touches on it, and get it out there for you to hear! By contributing to this campaign, here's what you're helping us accomplish:

  • Editing and mixing the recordings: $1450
  • Mastering: $550
  • Production costs and distribution: $1000

 

Sharing is caring. If you can't contribute financially, that's ok! Just spreading the word is a huge help. Sharing the campaign is easy with share tools above, or you can just copy & paste the link. We're immensely grateful to you for being a part of the process and helping in any way you can!

 

Perks!

Note: You do NOT need to select a perk in order to support this campaign. You can contribute any amount, not just the perk amounts. If you ARE interested in one of our exclusive perks, then read on!

  • $15 - Handwritten Thank You Postcard

Thank you for supporting us! You will receive a custom STEM: the Musical postcard with a handwritten note from Amy Pruitt and Kevin Badanes, the writers and creators of STEM: the Musical.

  • $25 - STEM: the Musical Explains the Universe! Cast Album

Be the first to hear the cast album that's been three years in the making! The cast's performances on this recording are not to be missed. You will receive the album as a digital download before it's available for sale. You will also receive our sincere gratitude for helping bring this labor of love to life!

  • $50 - Album and T-Shirt Bundle

Own a piece of edutainment history with an exclusive, backers-only STEM: the Musical Explains the Universe! show t-shirt! The graphics will be personally designed by show producers Amy & Kevin, and will never be sold anywhere else. With this perk, you'll also receive a digital album download before it's available to the public.

  • $100 - Thank You Video From the Cast

You are the BEST! Thank you for helping to complete this amazing project! In recognition of your awesomeness, the cast will record a personalized Thank You video for you, in which we will sing you a song of appreciation! For this generous contribution, you will also receive an exclusive backers-only show t-shirt, and digital album download.

story:
Hi Friends and Family <3.

 

Come One Come All!

I Invite you to be a Part of this Magical Journey that Halfy is about to Embark Upon.

 

The Album is all but FINISHED!!! I now only need to pay the costs involved with getting it pressed and everything else that goes along with that(...and some of the album launch expenses)!!!

 

As you well maybe aware, producing an album can cost a lot of money…

It has been a LONG road (over a year) to get this album done...with lots of ups and downs that life has to offer...and its all pretty much finished! I’m Super Stoked with how it Sounds, and Now I get to do an Album Launch

 

Im so Excited to do the Album Launch, yet needing funds to get the final bits of this procedure finished as I want to have the first pressing of the album (in cd's) for th album launch!

 

Which is why I am asking for $3500 to help pay for some of these expenses.

 

This money will be used  for the printing costs of the cd’s, paying the producer, setting up the album launch, getting the website up and running and the other costs involved.

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Now check this, Its not even half-bad!

If you donate between $11-$22 you will receive One Golden Ticket to the Album Launch…which is pretty hush hush a the moment as its TOP SECRET(and not quite finalised yet lol)!!!
It will be A LOT OF FUN though, I'm looking forward to it, There will be a film crew and it will be extremely enjoyable for all involved.

 

If you donate between $22-$44 you will receive One Signed Copy of the Tasty New Album.

 

Anyone who Donates $150-$300+++ (Thank You !!!) will get a personal gig for you and 10 Friends and a signed copy of the album.

Live and unplugged with Halfy! Half in the Flesh Half in the Mind!!!...With Time for Questions and Answers after the Questions are Answered Inside

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


I thank you all for the support you have already shown me and I look forward to sharing more of my art into the future. Your physical and emotional support will help go a long way to getting this show started!

Life is to be Loved, Lived and Laughed...Come along for the beginning of the Journey and watch as we creatively Expand, Grow and Inspire!

 

With Love,

 

Halfy <3

story:
Short Summary

If you are too busy for reading prose you can see all the details of the proposed concerts that we are fundraising for here:  https://www.hennesseybrownmusic.com/concerts

Cressida and I were busy working as freelance musicians and played in Santiago Quartet together. In Santiago Quartet we put together a successful Indiegogo campaign, raising money to pay for the recording and release of an album called "Language of the Heart." As a result of this release the quartet played live on In Tune (BBC Radio 3), Front Row (BBC Radio 4) and Six Music, on the Tom Robinson show. Our investors enjoyed hearing radio plays across various BBC radio three shows and on Classic FM, where we got to number 9 in the classical album charts.

We raised money for MIND, Help Musicians U.K. and Oakleaf Enterprises, a charity in Guildford with the slogan"Making Life Work with Mental Illness." Cressida and I played across the country with the quartet and across the world as freelance musicians.

Then a combination of physical injuries, parental responsibilities and COVID-19 persuaded us to start a music management company and dedicate the second part of our careers to helping other musicians. The devastation of the music industry and seeing dozens of friends having to retrain, give up on their careers and rely on government freelance payouts for survival was very sad. The emotional void left by having nowhere to perform was tough for us all. Being a musician is more than a job, it is part of who you are; your identity. 

Cressida and I realised that we had to do something so we set up the Hennessey Brown Music Concert Series.  We managed to put on 15 events with online concerts, interviews, recorded concerts and a live concert to audience in our inaugural season, which coincided with the worst year for the arts since World War Two! Our motto evolved to be "Making Music Happen."

We realised that we were passionate about helping other musicians of the highest calibre come out of this crisis with work and a fully formed management company behind them. We set the concert series up to offer work specifically to musicians on our roster.

We also have cultural inclusion at the heart of our mission statement and are constantly looking for opportunities to promote and collaborate with women musicians, musicians and composers who are black, indigenous or people of colour (BIPOC) and to gradually diversify the socioeconomic backgrounds of our audience. As international travel opens up we intend to invite the Latin american musicians already on our roster to perform in the series.

In this series we are delighted that our own composer Dominique Le Gendre https://www.hennesseybrownmusic.com/classical-musicians/dominique-le-gendre-composer-curator-amp-producer Dominique has agreed to have her "Riff for Strings and Snare" performed in our International Women's Day concert. Plans to collaborate with Dominique and the Chineke! orchestra are advancing well. https://www.chineke.org/chineke-orchestra This orchestra was set up by Chi-chi Nwanoku, specifically to provide opportunities for young black and ethnically diverse musicians in the U.K.

The season closer of our own concert series at Guildford Cathedral will also feature Cecilia Macdowall's "The Girl From Aleppo" with our violinist Harriet Mackenzie returning for the season closer. This event will have 100% women composers, performers and conductors. Your contribution will help towards the possibility of offering concessions and even free tickets to those who might mistakenly think that music is "not for them." 

We will be supporting two charities by giving  5% of the funds raised in this campaign to Help Musicians U.K https://www.helpmusicians.org.uk/&nbsp and collection for them at concerts, with online donations also possible. At the closing concert in Guildford Cathedral there will be a collection for Amie's Freedom Choir, a group made up of women refugees living in the U.K:  https://www.pan-arts.net/projects/amies

We have no sponsors or members at the concert series as we are just establishing ourselves. We hugely want to enrich the cultural life of Guildford, bring music to youngsters who wouldn't normally be able to afford such concerts by offering heavy ticket concessions, and introduce people to a richer sense of diversity in the classical music of our area.   

 What we need and what you get

Your contributions will make the concert series happen, simple as that! We have to pay musicians the fees that they deserve, their travel, hire the venues, piano tuners, print and design for programmes, ticketing companies and more. If we are not relying solely on ticket sales to "make music happen" we can make our concerts accessible and affordable to the many not the few. From a solo piano recital at the United Reform Church performed by Fali Pavri, a violin recital with Harriet Mackenzie flying in from the Greek Islands to perform with Peter Donohoe at Holy Trinity Church, to a large celebration of music at Guildford Cathedral for International Women's Day. We will bring diversity, fun and accessibility to music lovers across the world.

The international side of things will occur due to the calibre of musicians performing and your investment into paying camera crew and sound editors. With High Definition recordings available we can bring the majority of the concerts into your home or even hospitals to sooth those who are unwell via YouTube streams. We can also gift video recordings of the concerts to friends and contacts in Latin America and beyond.

A close friend watched our last digital concert of the 2021 series performed by 'cellists Tim Gill and Joely Koos from their kitchen in a ski lift in the Rockies! We live in a different world in terms of accessibility and the potential for variety. 

If you live locally or are prepared to travel to the Guildford area you can watch any or all of these concerts live, meet other music lovers and hear high quality music, or even meet the musicians between rehearsal and concert. More about that later! 

Your presence will support the musicians and enable us to move into a third season. We want you to enjoy yourself so will be providing drinks in the interval and encourage all our performers to talk to you and discuss the music that they are playing. There will be an "any questions" section at each concert and brief talks about Help Musicians UK and Amies Freedom Choir, the charities that we are collecting for. 

 

To cover our costs for all 7 concerts planned we need £28,085.76 

This includes.

Musicians fees including VAT and travel: £10,700

Video, sound and editing: £7,400

Programmes, brochures and advertising posters: £1,834

Venue Hire: £2,500

5% to Help Musicians UK = £1185.44

5% to Indiegogo for administrative costs= £1185.44

10% to Hennessey Brown Music for administration and coordinating entire project £2370.88

Print Design: 7X £80= £560

Social Media advertising 7X £50= £350

PERKS:

 You are more than welcome to donate simply to support the project but we do like to offer "perks" and exciting opportunities for you in return. Here is a list of all the different offers and possibilities from having a lesson with one of the musicians to your own brochure signed by all the musicians and delivered to your house. You can have a season ticket to all the concerts, best seats in the house or even attend a closed doors dress rehearsal whilst sipping a glass of bubbly before taking in our 7 p.m. concert and going out for dinner. A great date night or anniversary present for a loved one! Here is the complete list of perks: 

£1000 "Sponsor Special"

Attend one concert with up to 9 guests as we celebrate the return of hospitality.

Company logo on our programmes and series brochure.

Meet and greet the musicians at the dress rehearsal

Place a mailing list at the back of the venue and hand out literature.

£750 "Hennessey Brown Heroes"

Attend a dress rehearsal and meet & greet the artist.

A season ticket to, with the best seats in the house and a complimentary drink.

A thank you in all programmes 

Series brochure signed by all the musicians 

£300 "Mingled, sipped and signed."

Attend a closed doors dress rehearsal and meet and greet the artists at one concert

Reserved seats with a glass of bubbly

Signed programme

 £200 "Season Ticket Special"

Admission for all 7 concerts.

Reserved seats. 

Complimentary glass of bubbly or non alcoholic drink.

£150 "Masterful Music Lesson"

One hour music lesson with one of a selection of HB Music roster performers.

(As arranged with the artist and subject to availability.) 

£100 "Zoom Lesson"

One hour online music lesson with one of a section of artists from our roster. Can be FaceTime  or WhatsApp

Still masterful but from the comfort of your home! 

£50 "Couch Concerts Combo." Ideal for very hard-working folks that aren't so keen on travelling or perhaps have childcare issues.

High definition recordings of at least four concerts sent to your private email address. You can watch them from your couch and keep them forever! 

£35 "Relax and Sip." No need to rush or arrive too early as you have a reserved seat with a welcome drink. (price per concert.) 

£22 "Virtually Perfect."

Digital recording of the concert. 

Digital Programme 

Available to keep.  (We can send to your email address.)

£12 "Couch Concert"  

 High definition private YouTube link to the recording of the concert to enjoy at home with your feet up! 

If we don't reach our target your donations will go towards funding some of the concerts and other concerts will simply have their date deferred. If you have paid for a season ticket you will receive free tickets to concerts in 2022/2023 and our entire back catalogue of high quality recordings made in the 2020/2021 season.  

The Impact

These concerts will help keep Hennessey Brown Music going as a start up company trying to make its way as a music management company. They will bring much needed joy to classical music lovers, many of whom have not been able to leave their homes for concerts for 18 months or more. They will provide an opportunity to create funds for two wonderful charities and provide income for highly skilled musicians who have dedicated their lives to their art. Also they will help bring music to youngsters in the area who might not normally be able to afford to go to concerts. We will make sure of that by targeting State Schools and using our relationship with the wonderful Surrey Arts who provide instrumental lessons and much more for schools across the county.  

Risks & Challenges

We are fully aware that COVID-19 is not just going away in June 2021 and that concerts and events might, and probably will, have limits on capacity or even have postponements. If this has to happen we will provide alternative concert dates and or formats to watch the events. This is one of the main reasons that we have gathered a highly professional and skilled team of camera crew, sound engineers and editors. If a date changes you are likely to be offered various alternative dates to come to a live concert and a myriad of free videos to compensate you and ease any disappointment.  

Sometimes musicians that are booked might be offered a tour or a series of concerts that they simply can't turn down. We support the overall musical development and careers of the musicians that work for us and would not stand in their way in such instances. IN the unlikely event of a replacement musician being needed due to illness or any other reason their replacements will be of the highest calibre and your enjoyment of the music will not be diminished. We know dozens of musicians across the industry and there is no shortage of demand for work, especially at the moment. So you needn't worry. If the government say there can be any kind of a concert there will be one.

We take your safety very seriously. All COVID-19 and government guidelines will be followed at all of our concerts and we will regularly use our membership of the Musicians Union and the Incorporated Society of Musicians for the latest rules and regulations.  We follow suggestions on Music Mark for keeping young audience members and performers safe at our events. 

Other Ways You Can Help

In these times that have been so difficult economically for so many we are well aware that some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help:

Please share our campaign link with a friend or loved one that might be able to afford to help, share the campaign on social media, on Facebook Pages that might be relevant, Twitter, Instagram or on WhatsApp groups. If everybody that read this spent 10 minutes thinking of who might support the project and sent them the details we might just hit our target...

Thanks for reading and for giving us a good chance to keep: "MAKING MUSIC HAPPEN!"
story_txt:
Short Summary
If you are too busy for reading prose you can see all the details of the proposed concerts that we are fundraising for here:  https://www.hennesseybrownmusic.com/concerts
Cressida and I were busy working as freelance musicians and played in Santiago Quartet together. In Santiago Quartet we put together a successful Indiegogo campaign, raising money to pay for the recording and release of an album called "Language of the Heart." As a result of this release the quartet played live on In Tune (BBC Radio 3), Front Row (BBC Radio 4) and Six Music, on the Tom Robinson show. Our investors enjoyed hearing radio plays across various BBC radio three shows and on Classic FM, where we got to number 9 in the classical album charts.
We raised money for MIND, Help Musicians U.K. and Oakleaf Enterprises, a charity in Guildford with the slogan"Making Life Work with Mental Illness." Cressida and I played across the country with the quartet and across the world as freelance musicians.
Then a combination of physical injuries, parental responsibilities and COVID-19 persuaded us to start a music management company and dedicate the second part of our careers to helping other musicians. The devastation of the music industry and seeing dozens of friends having to retrain, give up on their careers and rely on government freelance payouts for survival was very sad. The emotional void left by having nowhere to perform was tough for us all. Being a musician is more than a job, it is part of who you are; your identity. 
Cressida and I realised that we had to do something so we set up the Hennessey Brown Music Concert Series.  We managed to put on 15 events with online concerts, interviews, recorded concerts and a live concert to audience in our inaugural season, which coincided with the worst year for the arts since World War Two! Our motto evolved to be "Making Music Happen."
We realised that we were passionate about helping other musicians of the highest calibre come out of this crisis with work and a fully formed management company behind them. We set the concert series up to offer work specifically to musicians on our roster.
We also have cultural inclusion at the heart of our mission statement and are constantly looking for opportunities to promote and collaborate with women musicians, musicians and composers who are black, indigenous or people of colour (BIPOC) and to gradually diversify the socioeconomic backgrounds of our audience. As international travel opens up we intend to invite the Latin american musicians already on our roster to perform in the series.
In this series we are delighted that our own composer Dominique Le Gendre https://www.hennesseybrownmusic.com/classical-musicians/dominique-le-gendre-composer-curator-amp-producer Dominique has agreed to have her "Riff for Strings and Snare" performed in our International Women's Day concert. Plans to collaborate with Dominique and the Chineke! orchestra are advancing well. https://www.chineke.org/chineke-orchestra This orchestra was set up by Chi-chi Nwanoku, specifically to provide opportunities for young black and ethnically diverse musicians in the U.K.
The season closer of our own concert series at Guildford Cathedral will also feature Cecilia Macdowall's "The Girl From Aleppo" with our violinist Harriet Mackenzie returning for the season closer. This event will have 100% women composers, performers and conductors. Your contribution will help towards the possibility of offering concessions and even free tickets to those who might mistakenly think that music is "not for them." 
We will be supporting two charities by giving  5% of the funds raised in this campaign to Help Musicians U.K https://www.helpmusicians.org.uk/&nbsp and collection for them at concerts, with online donations also possible. At the closing concert in Guildford Cathedral there will be a collection for Amie's Freedom Choir, a group made up of women refugees living in the U.K:  https://www.pan-arts.net/projects/amies
We have no sponsors or members at the concert series as we are just establishing ourselves. We hugely want to enrich the cultural life of Guildford, bring music to youngsters who wouldn't normally be able to afford such concerts by offering heavy ticket concessions, and introduce people to a richer sense of diversity in the classical music of our area.   
 What we need and what you get


Your contributions will make the concert series happen, simple as that! We have to pay musicians the fees that they deserve, their travel, hire the venues, piano tuners, print and design for programmes, ticketing companies and more. If we are not relying solely on ticket sales to "make music happen" we can make our concerts accessible and affordable to the many not the few. From a solo piano recital at the United Reform Church performed by Fali Pavri, a violin recital with Harriet Mackenzie flying in from the Greek Islands to perform with Peter Donohoe at Holy Trinity Church, to a large celebration of music at Guildford Cathedral for International Women's Day. We will bring diversity, fun and accessibility to music lovers across the world.
The international side of things will occur due to the calibre of musicians performing and your investment into paying camera crew and sound editors. With High Definition recordings available we can bring the majority of the concerts into your home or even hospitals to sooth those who are unwell via YouTube streams. We can also gift video recordings of the concerts to friends and contacts in Latin America and beyond.
A close friend watched our last digital concert of the 2021 series performed by 'cellists Tim Gill and Joely Koos from their kitchen in a ski lift in the Rockies! We live in a different world in terms of accessibility and the potential for variety. 
If you live locally or are prepared to travel to the Guildford area you can watch any or all of these concerts live, meet other music lovers and hear high quality music, or even meet the musicians between rehearsal and concert. More about that later! 
Your presence will support the musicians and enable us to move into a third season. We want you to enjoy yourself so will be providing drinks in the interval and encourage all our performers to talk to you and discuss the music that they are playing. There will be an "any questions" section at each concert and brief talks about Help Musicians UK and Amies Freedom Choir, the charities that we are collecting for. 
 
To cover our costs for all 7 concerts planned we need £28,085.76 
This includes.
Musicians fees including VAT and travel: £10,700
Video, sound and editing: £7,400
Programmes, brochures and advertising posters: £1,834
Venue Hire: £2,500
5% to Help Musicians UK = £1185.44
5% to Indiegogo for administrative costs= £1185.44
10% to Hennessey Brown Music for administration and coordinating entire project £2370.88
Print Design: 7X £80= £560
Social Media advertising 7X £50= £350

PERKS:
 You are more than welcome to donate simply to support the project but we do like to offer "perks" and exciting opportunities for you in return. Here is a list of all the different offers and possibilities from having a lesson with one of the musicians to your own brochure signed by all the musicians and delivered to your house. You can have a season ticket to all the concerts, best seats in the house or even attend a closed doors dress rehearsal whilst sipping a glass of bubbly before taking in our 7 p.m. concert and going out for dinner. A great date night or anniversary present for a loved one! Here is the complete list of perks: 
£1000 "Sponsor Special"
Attend one concert with up to 9 guests as we celebrate the return of hospitality.
Company logo on our programmes and series brochure.
Meet and greet the musicians at the dress rehearsal
Place a mailing list at the back of the venue and hand out literature.
£750 "Hennessey Brown Heroes"
Attend a dress rehearsal and meet & greet the artist.
A season ticket to, with the best seats in the house and a complimentary drink.
A thank you in all programmes 
Series brochure signed by all the musicians 
£300 "Mingled, sipped and signed."
Attend a closed doors dress rehearsal and meet and greet the artists at one concert
Reserved seats with a glass of bubbly
Signed programme
 £200 "Season Ticket Special"
Admission for all 7 concerts.
Reserved seats. 
Complimentary glass of bubbly or non alcoholic drink.
£150 "Masterful Music Lesson" 
One hour music lesson with one of a selection of HB Music roster performers.
(As arranged with the artist and subject to availability.) 
£100 "Zoom Lesson"
One hour online music lesson with one of a section of artists from our roster. Can be FaceTime  or WhatsApp
Still masterful but from the comfort of your home! 
£50 "Couch Concerts Combo." Ideal for very hard-working folks that aren't so keen on travelling or perhaps have childcare issues.

£22 "Virtually Perfect."
Digital recording of the concert. 
Digital Programme

£12 "Couch Concert"
