story:
Confinée 2020 is the product of two talented friends from different musical backgrounds collaborating on something new! 

The main ingredients:

Jakub Szpakowicz: pianist, producer, dj and sound engineer.

Katie Kraw: Jazzy Vocalist and Singer/Songwriter. 

 

Featuring the spices:

Natalie Nova - Rap and Vocal

AJMAN - Polish Rap Artist

Livia Ferandon-Bescond - Harpist

Juliette Boyer - Double Bass

Philip Maniez - Drums

Noé Berne - Guitar and Electric Bass

Jean Patrice Remilliard - Mastering 

 

How did ol’ jazz bones diva Katie Kraw end up making an electronic music album?

Let me tell YA!

Its June 2020 in Paris, France - I’d just been confined for a month furtively writing music to stay sane and to fill the roster for an upcoming project produced by Erin Costello (stay tuned for that 2021) meanwhile Rosabelle Selavy gets in touch and wants to make a burlesque music video with original music - I am thrilled to be involved in a creative project and excited about my pocket full of song sketches- I call one of my oldest and truest friends who is also a talented musician and producer: the incredible aforementioned Jakub Szpakowicz.  I go to the studio trepidatious and unsure about making electronically produced music - and within an hour we record Confinée our hot title track.

In awe of the rapidity, effortlessness and FUN of making electronic music with Jakub - I book the rest of the week and we record the basis of this album. Thrilled and invigorated by this creative collaboration we brought in a slew of our talented artist friends and had a total blast.

 Followed by months of tweaking, adjusting, and re-inventing we finally have finished our first baby - born during the confinement(s) we are so proud to present: Confinée Deux-Mille-Vingt! 

Jakub and I had so much fun making this project - we've decided to open our own music studio to help people like me make albums like this!  I cannot express how vital it has been for me to tap into and share the joys of making music and I’m looking forward to facilitating this process for other artists. Keep your eyes and ears peeled for Groove Lab Studios - we’re taking bookings in February.

Huge thank you to Mary Mulderry for the perfect Album Art and Teyama Alkamli for the gorgeous fundraising video. 

Stay tuned for some incredible music videos featuring the mega talented dancer/ stylist/ performer/ loveofmylife: Fifi Fantome! Filmed by darling Nicolas Catovic and edited by our fave multimedia mogul Mary Mulderry. It has been such an honor being able to create art with so many beautiful talented folks during these turbulent times. 

Funding this album is funding not only me and my creations, but also my creative team and artistic dream: Making Music with lovely people for all of you lovely people!

 

DON'T MISS OUR LIMITED OFFER PRE-SALE PACKAGES!

PRE-SALES END DECEMBER 1st! ALBUM LAUNCH DEC.10th. 

Signed Lyric Sheet: 5€ 

Katie Kraw Tote Bag: 10€

Digital CD: 10€

Physical CD: 15€

Lyric Sheet Sketch: 20€ 

I love drawing and doodling over everything - get some unique and original art by commissioning a personal unique doodled upon Lyric Sheet. 

Vinyl: 25€ 

HOT COMBO:  45€

A Digital Download, signed CD, signed Vinyl, Lyric Sheet Doodle, Tote Bag, and an original sketch from Katie Kraw's jazzmen series; live ink drawings of from jazzclubs around the world. Retail value of 100 euro! 

 

KARAOKE QUEENS PACKAGE: 100€ 

Includes a high quality digital album, 3 signed Physical CDs, 2 supa cute Katie Kraw tote bags 2 copies of signed lyric sheets of all 11 songs AND a download of the instrumental tracks so you can be the star and sing along with your chic lyric sheets.

 

ONLY FANS PACKAGE: 200€

Includes a digital album, 4 signed physical CDs, 2 signed Vinyls, Signed and doodled upon Lyric Sheets, 3 tote bags, a download of the instrumental tracks, a Katie Kraw original drawing and a private live 20 minute Online Concert.

 

PATRON OF THE ARTS PACKAGE 400€

Includes a digital album, 5 signed physical CDs, 2 signed Vinyls, Signed Lyric Sheets, 3 tote bags, a download of the instrumental tracks and a private online live 30minute Concert. Katie Kraw will interpret, record, and send you a cover song of your choice. Your name will be credited in the liner notes as producer. 

 

PRODUCE ME PACKAGE 1000€

Whatever combination of merch your heart desires - I mean it! Along with a private concert, executive producer credit on the album AND the chance to make music with Katie and Jakub - They will help you write, record, and produce your own song! Release the writer within! OR it could make a great gift for the musician in your life! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Streaming! Social Media sharing! And of course, tell your friends!

story:
Who is ZXK ?

 

Z : Greetings ! My name is Zoë Despina a.k.a Zodëss and I’m a singer/songwriter musician !

I've been doing music for as long as I can remember.  The music scene has taught me a lot about myself and the industry. The struggle of the underground artist is real ; schedules may clash and projects can fall apart.  At this stage in my journey, I’m very confident with the project we put together and I adore my team. 

K :  Yo I’m Nicolas Lajeunesse, a.k.a KOLA and I’m a multi-instrumentalist, singer and record producer.

 I’ve been involved with music since I was a little kid. Going to F.A.C.E. Later on in high school I started making beats for my friends who were rapping over beats they downloaded online. In 2013 I enrolled in Musitechnic’s Audio Production program in Montreal which led to me gain a lot of knowledge and confidence. 

 

 

How we met 

 

 We met through a mutual collaborator who goes by the name FREED. We made a song together and recorded a live video session of it . It’s called Ataraxia by FREED on youtube.

K : After working on this project together, I sent Zödess a beat. She wrote a full song with sick melodies and lyrics and came over to record it. It was a fun time laughing and making music and I knew then we could make great music together. Later Zoe suggested we make a music video and then brought in Rosalie to direct it. We met up with her and she had great energy and a super well prepared presentation of her vision for the video so we decided to move forward together. 

Z : I had enjoyed collaborating with Kola on Ataraxia so when he asked me to work with him again I was happy to embark on this new project. As one of our songs progressed I became inspired to make a video clip of it. That's when I thought of Rosalie. We use to be roommates and we would bond a lot creatively. We even talked about collaborating on something together in the future. The timing felt right so I gave it a shot and she was thrilled to participate  !

 

What the song ''Get it on'' means to us

 

Z : The meaning of the song for me is about embracing my power as a wxman : Taking charge of my sexuality and honouring it . Owning my flaws , being unapologetically dominant, independent and a tease. I think it's a perfect beat for when you want to ''get it on'' if you know what I mean . 

K : For me ‘Get it on’ is an homage to the classic Funk and R’n’b songs I grew up listening to when my dad played his music on our long drives to baseball games. But it’s also heavily influenced by Trip-hop from the 90’s where bands would have sexy female vocals over a dope Hip Hop beat. On the surface it’s a smooth banger, perfect for your late night hangs playlist, but if you listen deeper, it’s about feminine empowerment and fearless, authentic self-expression. 

 

Why a music video ?

 

K :  The video is important for us because in today’s climate, with the music industry being over-saturated with artists,  we want to make an impact and stand out from the crowd. A dope video will be a great asset to accompany and enhance our music. Making a video is proof that we are serious about getting our music heard by all the people who could potentially appreciate it because we know they will enjoy it as much as we do. 

Z : It would mean a lot to me to have the opportunity to make this video clip. I had so much fun writing the synopsis and I know for a fact that our director Rosalie will bring it to life beautifully !

K :  The video is important for us because in today’s climate, with the music industry being over-saturated with artists,  we want to make an impact and stand out from the crowd. A dope video will be a great asset to accompany and enhance our music. Making a video is proof that we are serious about getting our music heard by all the people who could potentially appreciate it because we know they will enjoy it as much as we do. 
Z : It would mean a lot to me to have the opportunity to make this video clip. I had so much fun writing the synopsis and I know for a fact that our director Rosalie will bring it to life beautifully !

story:
Our Debut Album Launch

Hi! We are Mountains in the Sea, a husband-and-wife indie blues pop (is that a genre? we are making it one!) duo from Spokane Valley, WA. You all have been asking for a CD and we've been listening... so we are going to release our debut full-length album on 8/28/20!

Once we set out to release the CD, we realized this was quickly turning into something bigger than we originally intended. We believe God has given us the green light on this project and we are stepping out in faith!

At first, we set out to just make some CDs at home. Then we felt the nudge to have a run of professional CDs made. Then, a new run of limited edition t-shirts. Then, to release it all online, too. Then, to set up an Indiegogo campaign so you all could partner with us in this project and get some limited-time perks. So, here we are! Haha!

We want to help people and help light up this world with our music. We realized it's time to make it available for you all to partner with us in this project and help launch our music out into the world so more people can hear it. Your support will help us to make that happen. 

Launch Details

Our self-titled debut album will have 10 songs, including 7 of our previous singles polished up and remastered, and 3 brand new tracks:

1. Beginning

2. Higher

3. Let's Go

4. Wavin' to My Haters

5. With You

6. Better Way

7. I'll Keep Running

8. Long Way Home

9. Thank You

10. Then the Rains Came

We are also excited to have tons of brand new merch you've never seen before, including a limited-edition T-Shirt exclusive to this album launch! (When they're gone, they're gone!) This brand new T-Shirt will be a white Gildan Soft Style tee with ALL of the album lyrics on the front and a big Mountains in the Sea logo over top, printed in an aqua color that coordinates with the album cover. We will have a wide range of sizes from adult Small to XXXL!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are setting a goal for $10,000 on this project. Making music is a very expensive process. This funding will be SO helpful to cover the costs of plugins/software used to mix and master the album, professional physical CDs and cases, brand new limited edition t-shirts, wristbands, hats and other exciting new merch, and marketing the album in the best way possible,  
  • We are offering some really exciting and super-exclusive perks you'll never see again! Click on each of the perk options to see more details about what they include.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will still go towards those things listed above. If we do reach our goal, we will be able to get even more merch you guys have been asking for (like vinyl?!) and more. All the funding will go towards reaching people with our music in the best ways possible.

 


 

The Impact

Guys, I'm going to be real honest. We want to change the world with our music. We want to light up this country and the world, help people, and leave a legacy in music. We are ridiculously determined and we aren't going to give up. We are going to follow wherever God leads, and we know He's got some really good plans.


 

Risks & Challenges

We are doing all of this without the help of a label. Over the years, we've made the decision to stay independent so that we can be 100% true to who we are and to our message. It can be challenging to wear so many different hats, but we love it. Your backing helps us be able to stay independent and get our music heard.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share this on social media using Indiegogo's share tools.
  • Pray for us! That's the most helpful of all.

We love you guys! Thank you so much for reading and for your support!

-Phil & Angela

Mountains in the Sea

WWW.MOUNTAINSINTHESEA.COM

mtnsinthesea@gmail.com

spotify

instagram 

facebook

twitter

@mtnsinthesea


P.S. Here's a mock up of the hats we are going to have! You can choose between "dad cap" style or trucker hat, both with a sweet embroidered logo patch! 

Black Dad Cap Style:

Charcoal Trucker Hat Style:

story:
¡Hola!

  • Soy Melody Astacio, una joven cantante dominicana. En Mayo del 2020 inicié con mi sencillo "Cantaré" y espero contar con tu apoyo para lanzar mi primer Álbum: Florecer.  Con esto, me ayudarías a crear el impacto para el cual sé que Dios me trajo al mundo. 

Qué Necesito de Ti 

  • Para la producción musical y audiovisual del álbum el presupuesto estimado es de USD8,000. Esto incluye producción musical, producción audiovisual, línea gráfica, estilismo, promoción y gastos de distribución. 
  • Como contribuyente, tendrás acceso exclusivo al material audiovisual del proyecto, así como divertidos souvenirs del disco. 
  • Ninguna contribución es muy poquita. Sé que la meta de ocho mil dólares se ve gigante, pero podemos llegar de uno en uno.

Impacto

Ayúdame a llevar un mensaje de impacto, que edifique a nuestra comunidad. 

Los retos y riesgos

Sé que no es tarea fácil, pero con la ayuda de Dios, tarde o temprano, podremos alcanzar la meta. 

  • Esto es una campaña flexible, así que si no alcanzamos la meta, igual podré invertir tu colaboración en alguna parte del proyecto y tendremos nueva música pronto. 
  • Si no estás seguro de la plataforma, puedes hacer el pago a través de PayPal https://paypal.me/lavidaenmelodias
  •  

Otras Maneras de Ayudar

  • ¡Suscríbete a mi canal de Youtube!

Esto es SUMAMENTE importante, ya que la monetización de las plataformas digitales depende, inicialmente, de alcanzar mil suscriptores entre otros requisitos.

  • ¡Comparte mi música!

Compartiendo mi música me ayudas un montón

  • Ora por Mi

¡Creo que esto es lo más importante! Ora para que el Señor abra las puertas y sobre todo haga Su voluntad en este proyecto.

story:
NOTE: UNABLE TO PAY WITH CREDIT CARD? NO PROBLEM! JUST SEND ME A DIRECT MESSAGE THROUGH THIS SITE, ON FACEBOOK OR MAARTENRISCHEN@YAHOO.COM FOR PAYMENT WITH BANK, PAYPAL, WECHAT ETC. 

Thank you for existing, and for reading this page while doing so.
My name is Maarten Rischen, a Dutch musician currently residing in the Thai mountains after getting stuck in the mountain village of Pai.
Please allow me to introduce the thing closest to my heart apart from my left lung:

THE MOMENT

A visual album.

15 tracks, 15 music videos

from an abandoned paradise.


Moments make music.
It took me years to realize that. Music that bows the heartstrings is really authored by a myriad of ontological factors, that what we call the moment: location, people, states of minds, words uttered, thoughts thought, and if there are any dogs around. 

As you can see in my introduction video, a long weird road of moments lead me to a place where the moments - excuse my woo - vibrate with magic. However, I arrived here as a musician in COVID times, which means: no work, all play, but er... no pay. Therefore, no money from or for projects whatsoever.  Irony at its finest, as there is no better place on earth to finish this album.

So let's team up, and let's do it together!
 

 

 

Maarten Rischen

  • Born in Holland, graduated Master of Arts at the Royal University of Groningen with a rather chaotic treatise on overtone systems in nature and No-Wave.
     
  • Played in several bands, most notably Shaking Godspeed and Tommy Ebben & The Small Town Villains. released 10+ albums on Dutch and international labels, toured like a madman, wrote for and played in theatre and dance performances, recorded and produced albums for dozens of other artists, made music for the odd commercial, owned and operated recording studios in Holland and China, never got stung by a bee for some strange reason.
    Full portfolio (and a truckload of videos) on maartenrischen.com

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • Please see the cost breakdown below, my most honest and realistic perspective on the financial side of things. With your involvement, I will have the means to finish 15 tracks and 15 music videos. The production, in tandem with the music videos, will happen in Pai, Thailand (pictured above, check out the last perk to come visit!).
     
  • For you, after a few months of incubation, there will be an exclusive super high quality download - way before the public mp3 quality release. That means all the songs and video in uncompressed huge format,  for projecting on the side of your house. It will also include more portable versions of just the audio.
     
  • If you choose the Behind The Scenes perk or  higher, you will also receive extensive behind the scenes material for learning and entertainment. You'll see us creating both the music as well as working on the set for the videos, with us often talking to the camera often for some clarification and/or instructional content.
     
  • Want to dive deep into the logic behind the usually huge music sessions? I'm also offering Music Breakdown sessions, going over all the elements that make up the music, my favourite plug-ins and instruments and how it's all mixed. For fellow production nerds and interested beginners alike, working in any software.
    INCLUDES HANDMADE SAMPLE PACK FROM PAI
     
  • Want to make your own music out of my music? By all means, do! I'm honoured. All songs will have remix stems available. (Coming soon.)
     
  • All of the above comes pre-loaded on the world first degradable 8 GB wooden USB stick. Not sure if it's degradable though, but why would you throw it away anyway? These are going to be full of goodies, see details on the right. 
     
  • If you want my original handwritten chord sheets for decoration or to simply steal my ideas, I'll happily send them over as soon as I'm done recording what's written on them. Will even put my signature on them, just as unreadable as the rest of my handwriting but it comes from the heart!
     
  • The internet connection here is surprisingly good for being tucked away in the mountains, so there's a multitude of ways to connect personally! I'd love to, in fact. Music lessons? Walking the dogs together? Interactive live-stream during the creation process? A tailor-made song and/or video for your own campaign, commercial or business? All possible!
     
  • If you are more of the listening kind, there is a package including a VERY LIMITED AMOUNT of handmade coconut speakers by my friend Karta in Chiang Mai. The first Bluetooth/ aux cable speaker I've encountered that looks beyond fantastic AND sounds like an actual high-grade speaker. 
 

Cost Breakdown

It is always hard to exactly pin down the costs involved in something as multi-faceted as releasing an album, let alone an album accompanied by music videos.
The breakdown below is based on 15 songs and videos, with some of of the music already done and current production primarily taking place in Thailand. So the rent of the studio where I set my gear up, for example, is relatively low while the price of quality equipment not necessarily so. In the latter category, by the way, I accounted for an essential computer hardware upgrade, a new audio interface to expand number of inputs, two condenser mics, video equipment (depending on whom is working on the project and their own equipment), an iRig interface for live streaming and some auxiliary cabling and software for the studio multi-camera BTS setup.

INITIAL GOAL: € 7975,-

  • Studio rent: 1000,-
  • Gear and software: 1400,-
  • Compensation for the artists involved and any materials used (videographers, musicians, performers, graphical artists): 3500,- 
  • Promotional costs (website, ads, streaming services): 1000,-
  • Indiegogo fees (5% + 3%): 575,-
  • Contingency costs: 500,-

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This has been a rough year for all of us, so I fully understand if you currently do not have the funds to partake in this album financially. But just sharing this page (short url under this paragraph) to your friends and family helps a LOT. Thank you!!
https://igg.me/at/maartenrischen​
maartenrischen.com

 

Stretch Goals

The above projection is to get a high quality but very budget conscious incarnation of the visual album, but while the sky is not the limit, technically the amount of money raised is. So with fitting modesty and realism I'd like to take a look into some possible outcomes of this campaign and what that would entail for the project.

€ 10.000,-

  • At this level of funding I'll be able to make it into a first live configuration for touring. If touring is going to be a possibility after the apocalypse, though. Otherwise we'll live on the internet streaming our hearts out, but playing these songs in person will happen.
  • Also it will enable me to join forces with even more artists, not just in Pai but all over the world. If I would start talking about the people I want to work with, that'd be a whole different document but trust me, it'll be great.


€ 20.000,-

  • First thing I'd do if this amount of support is given, is to organize a festival for the launch. Not a gig, but a festival, including local artists and a good compensation for their performances. Live streamed anywhere of course, but hopefully with as many backers physically present as possible. I can only dream of this day, but dreaming I shall

 

Add-on Perk: € 5 Donation to Pete's Mission Animal Rescue in Pai 

This extra option with your order is all about Pavlov's Hierarchy Of Needs: art and self-actualization for you, food, medicine and shelter for the dogs and other animals at Pete's Mission Animal Rescue in Pai. The owner, Ryan Godden, has a heart bigger than most planets, caring for anything that breathes and is in trouble. He'll probably build a utopia for pigs or pay for the surgery of abandoned dogs with the money raised, or something else fantastic. petesmission.org

story:
Short Summary

Hi All!

Scott Edwards better known as D.E.F is a vocalist, rapper and multi-instrumentalist based in Nottingham. His output blends traditional hip hop roots, punk rock, alternative indie and a touch of grime.

Born in North London, D.E.F was influenced by his late Grandfather inheriting his musical blood, who taught him to play the guitar and piano. D.E.F would go on to discover that his mixed roots of Cuban, German, Scottish and Jamaican would be an indisputable musical force to his artistry. He moved to France at age 19, where he would learn to write and perform bilingually, develop his music and grow through life experiences. D.E.F is a dynamic, compelling and no-nonsense storyteller, sharing personal and collective perspectives. His pure but sharp penmanship and explosive energy invite audiences to experience an unorthodox musical thought-provoking trance with addictive beats creating a presence that is hard to resist connecting to.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need about £2000, which may sound like a lot to some, but in terms of music videos, this is still cheap. This is a non-profit production. The money will go to hiring professional equipment (Cameras, Lighting etc), costumes and props, location hire, travel and food expenses for the cast and crew (which there will be some 20 people as extras).

We are offering different perks for certain contributions such as; be an extra, signed merchandise, play a main role within the video and loads more!

If we don't reach the funds, then we will make the video with whatever funds we raise, so it won't go to waste!

 

The Impact

Everyone has been affected by COVID-19, the creative industry is one such group. Being an artist during these times is difficult and other means of work is necessary. So, with this campaign, we hope to gain the funds to be able to make a true piece of art that will have an impact and last the test of time. 

This truly is a beautiful piece of work that people can relate to. 

 

Risks & Challenges

We have a brilliant team on board so far from local crews of Nottingham

Director: Kav Digva - who has directed music videos and many corporate and commercial videos

Cinematographer: Todd Franklin  - who has shot music videos, short films and corporate videos

We are securing more people each day as we are wanting to shoot the video in September. The clock is ticking, but we have experience and passion on our side to get this done no matter what!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are hard for all! So, if you can't afford to donate but think the project is worth supporting, then please spread the word and share the links for us!

Thank you so much for your time!!!

Scott Edwards better known as D.E.F is a vocalist, rapper and multi-instrumentalist based in Nottingham. His output blends traditional hip hop roots, punk rock, alternative indie and a touch of grime.
Born in North London, D.E.F was influenced by his late Grandfather inheriting his musical blood, who taught him to play the guitar and piano. D.E.F would go on to discover that his mixed roots of Cuban, German, Scottish and Jamaican would be an indisputable musical force to his artistry. He moved to France at age 19, where he would learn to write and perform bilingually, develop his music and grow through life experiences. D.E.F is a dynamic, compelling and no-nonsense storyteller, sharing personal and collective perspectives. His pure but sharp penmanship and explosive energy invite audiences to experience an unorthodox musical thought-provoking trance with addictive beats creating a presence that is hard to resist connecting to.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We need about £2000, which may sound like a lot to some, but in terms of music videos, this is still cheap. This is a non-profit production. The money will go to hiring professional equipment (Cameras, Lighting etc), costumes and props, location hire, travel and food expenses for the cast and crew (which there will be some 20 people as extras).
We are offering different perks for certain contributions such as; be an extra, signed merchandise, play a main role within the video and loads more!
If we don't reach the funds, then we will make the video with whatever funds we raise, so it won't go to waste!
 

The Impact
Everyone has been affected by COVID-19, the creative industry is one such group. Being an artist during these times is difficult and other means of work is necessary. So, with this campaign, we hope to gain the funds to be able to make a true piece of art that will have an impact and last the test of time. 
This truly is a beautiful piece of work that people can relate to. 
 

Risks & Challenges
We have a brilliant team on board so far from local crews of Nottingham
Director: Kav Digva - who has directed music videos and many corporate and commercial videos
Cinematographer: Todd Franklin  - who has shot music videos, short films and corporate videos
We are securing more people each day as we are wanting to shoot the video in September. The clock is ticking, but we have experience and passion on our side to get this done no matter what!
 
Other Ways You Can HelpTimes are hard for all! So, if you can't afford to donate but think the project is worth supporting, then please spread the word and share the links for us!Thank you so much for your time!!!

story:
The "DONNY, DUKE, & WONDER" CD Project

First of all, I want to express how excited I am to finally be able to produce one of the most inspirational albums in my life. Re-producing the music of STEVIE WONDER, GEORGE DUKE, and DONNY HATHAWAY has been a dream of mine for a long time.  

The recording first took flight in early November 2019. The release date is on October 2, 2020 (My Birthday!!!!) I've taken the core of these iconic musicians' classics and added a twist of my musical passion to it. A straight roller-coaster ride from funk and soul down to the sensual romantic and RnB Ballads.

All 10 songs are written and the recording process is already in full effect. Here are some guests and studio musicians that are going to record on this album:

"Guests & Musicians"

Will Downing - featured vocals 

Donald Hayes - featured alto sax

Najee - featured flute

Rebecca Jade - featured vocals

Samuel Rashad - featured vocals

Doobie Powell - featured vocals and keyboard

Shawn McLemore - featured vocals

Frank McComb - featured vocals

N'Dygo Jones - featured vocals

Marcus Anderson - flute

Marcus Thomas - drums

Jordan Love - rhythm and acoustic guitar

Tamara Loyd for TVOX - vocals

Janelle Ford - vocals

Trumaine Lamar - vocals

and many more...

This is a huge list of musicians and singers, however, with a production this large, I need everyone to join me in making this project possible.

I NEED YOU!

Here is a breakdown of the project production cost:

$5,000+ musicians/singers
$5,000+ recording/mixing/mastering engineers & studios
$4,000+ photo shoot for publicity & CD cover/packaging
$3,000+ radio promotions and distribution
$2,000+ artwork design for the CD packaging and publicity
$2,500+ publishing administration/copyright/registration
$TBA marketing!!!!

While I have already paid for much of this project upfront, I will NOT be able to cover all of these expenses without your help. COVID-19 unfortunately cost me a loss of an estimated $15,000 in shows and appearances. However, inspite of all the performance opportunities that have been lost due to this horrific world pandemic, I am determined to COMPLETE THIS PROJECT. That's why I appreciate you (my, friends, fans, and supporters) so much! You have helped me in the past to accomplish so many goals whether it was purchasing my music (via concerts, streaming apps, etc...) and I hope you'll be compelled to help me on meeting my passionate goal to completing this project as well.

However, I'm not asking for your financial support without creating some special perks for you. No way! For every penny you sow into me, you'll receive something in return starting at just $25 for the autographed CD before the official release date - we hope to start shipping CD's on September 21, 2020!! Beyond that, there are tons of cool perks that I am sure you will enjoy, including:

• Official plaque and certificate of appreciation
• Your name added to the credit's of the album as an "EXECUTIVE PRODUCER"
• "NMX" T-Shirt along with a CD & Vinyl autographed album print (I call everything albums lolol)
• Guest VIP Passes to an upcoming performance
• Private solo performance
• and much more...

Thanks again for your continued support as I remain an independent artist, making music that I feel from the heart. You don't know how much it means to me!

Please reach out via the email link if you have any questions about the perks. I'd be happy to answer you as soon as we can.

With my deepest gratitude,

Nathan Mitchell

story:
Our Story

Graber Gryass is a band from Memphis, a collective of talented friends centered around Michael Graber. Members also play in Public Enemy, Rumpke Mountain Boys, Devil Train, Bluff City Backsliders, Left Unsung, Dagnabbits, and other bands. Michael Graber recently played mandolin and 12-string on Foy Vance’s "To Memphis," has released two recordings with Bluff City Backsliders, and also plays in Zeke’s Three Generation Jug Rascals, and Damfool, and has also played in Professor Elixir’s Southern Troubadours, Fatback Jubilee, and 611. 

Why Gryass? The last thing we want to do is be yet another average bluegrass band playing covers. Our influences are vast: the Byrds, country music from every country, all stimuli. Gryass gives us the right container to hold all of this combustible material. 

Why Late Bloom? After toiling in business and running a consultancy for most of his adult life,  Michael Graber wrote most of these songs at age 50 and celebrates that many people creatively flourish at this age. 

Why Spaceman’s Wonderbox? Band mates starting calling Michael Graber “Spaceman” because he is “so far out,” and it stuck. The Wonderbox holds all types on charms, potions, mysteries, and adventures. The songs go a little further out than those on Late Bloom and have different instrumentation: bass Erhu, dulcimer, harmonium, bouzouki. 

Why do we need your support?

After paying out of pocket for the musicians, Studio, video, graphic design, and mastering, we still have a lot of work to do. Your funds will help distribute, advertise, market, and promote this musical movement. And, you’ll get a bounty of Grassy merchandise. 

Meet the musicians

Michael Graber: Guitar and Vocals 

Eric Lewis: Guitar, Dobro, Vocals

Andy Ratliff: Mandolin, Bouzouki, Vocals

Clint Wagner: Fiddle, Erhu, Vocals

David Pierce: Mandolin

J.D Westmoreland: Mandolin

Khari Wynn: Guitar

Nathan Breckenridge: Bass and Vocals

Danial McKee: Bass

Randal Morton: Banjo

Kitty Dearing: Vocals

Gia Welch: Vocals

Gerald Stephens: Harmonium

Jason Freeman: Dulcimer, Jug, Harmonica, Vocals

Brian Collins: Guitar and Vocals

Rowan Graber Gratz: Vocals on It Was Always You 

All tracks engineered and mixed by Boo Mitchell at Royal Studios; mastered by Kevin Nix. 

I hope you like the songs and the spirit of the band, the harmonies—and find that it is something new. You can read more about our session here.

Sincerely,

Michael Graber

story:
Hello!

We are Bad Transmission - a ska/reggae/hip-hop band from Ulverston, Cumbria.

We are currently recording an album which we have been funding ourselves through playing gigs. Unfortunately the pandemic has hit the music scene hard and so we are asking your kind selves to help us out and pre-order our album so we can pay to get it finished. We have already got a lot of the recording done but we need your help to get it over the line!

We've also got some special rewards on offer such as getting your name in the album sleeve and being in a Bad T music video!

Any money donated will go towards the costs of the recording and production of the album - whether it be the recording, mastering, album pressing etc.

Thank you so much - we are so excited about this album and can't wait for you all to hear it.

If you're feeling super generous and can't wait to hear the album you can also just click "Back It" and donate (not linked to any perks).

P.s. we appreciate not everyone is in the position to be able to donate, but you can still help massively by spreading the word and sharing this far and wide!

Big love,
Bad T

story:
Alaskapella started July 2011 as a group of a cappella singers affiliated with the University of Alaska Southeast. The purpose was to bring more music to the University and the Juneau community. The group was open to both college students at the University and to non-student members of the local community. Over the years, Alaskapella has fluctuated between its starting point of four members and thirty-five members (with choristers coming and going  in the group as their schedule allowed). Today we stand at an anticipated traveling number of eighteen members. Over the four years that Alaskapella has been around, we have performed at at least two major concerts of our own per year, various short gigs for local organizations, performances with other singing groups in their concerts, and we have worked to promote music in the community and at the University. All of this hard work, practice, and love of music has brought us to a wonderful opportunity (see “Carnegie Hall”)! 

However, as Alaskapella is a group of both current college students with the University and non-student members (such as alumni and those taking time off from school due to various reasons), we cannot travel through the college (as the whole group) due to current University policy. Therefore, with the University’s blessing, we are attempting to travel as a group of individuals, hence the reason we are calling ourselves Alaskapellicans and not Alaskapella (the name owned by the University). Over the years, the pelican has become our mascot and our term to define individual group members, which seemed to fit with our current concept of a group of traveling individuals. We are currently a club under the University Foundation (a not-for-profit organization) and use all money earned through donations to represent the University and state of Alaska, provide our members with the best possible  experience (e.g. new uniforms, etc), and enlarge our music repertoire so we can bring a wider range of music to the community. 

Carnegie Hall in New York City!

Alaskapella has been invited by DCINY (Distinguished Concerts International New York) to go to New York City and perform in an a cappella chorus directed by Deke Sharon (Music Director/arranger of Pitch Perfect and producer/arranger/and vocal coach on the Sing Off) in an international program/performance experience called Total Vocal 2. We were discovered by one of the DCINY employees on YouTube and the organization extended an invitation to us to come to New York and join them for the event! This is quite the honor as only the best a cappella groups around the world are invited to join in this amazing experience. Alaskapella is going to great lengths to try and make sure we can attend this opportunity, as we are excited to represent Alaska, the Juneau community, and the University of Alaska (and hope to further our group’s musical prowess to become a better representative for all mentioned parties). The Juneau Arts and Humanities Council has graciously joined us to help reach this goal in our fundraising efforts. For this event, we would be traveling to New York City in March of 2016 from the 17th through the 21st (with the 17th and 21st being travel days). This is so that we can rehearse with the other groups and Deke Sharon to polish our sound and the group in time for the  main performance (on Sunday, the 20th of March). There will be about eighteen of us traveling and performing in this event, but there will also be some VIPs (people who wish to travel with us, but will not be performing with us, a.k.a parents :P) who will be paying for themselves. 

Alaskapella’s mission is to share our love and joy of music with the community and to represent Alaska (and especially the arts community of Southeast Alaska) to the world in the best possible manner. We would like to show the world what talents Southeast Alaska has to offer and share what we learn (and experience) with the community upon our return. 

Alaskapella is thrilled at this opportunity of a lifetime to represent its beloved state and community! It would be wonderful to reach New York, Carnegie Hall, Deke Sharon, and Total Vocal 2 so that we may come back and share our experience with the community.  Due to its known and extensive support of the arts in Juneau and Southeast Alaska, we are over joyed that the Juneau Arts and Humanities Council has agreed to help us fundraise for this venture. 

Thank you so much for your continued support and we look forward to representing our community and state with this wonderful opportunity!

Sincerely,

Alaskapella

alaskapellicans@gmail.com

www.facebook.com/alaskapella

www.alaskapella.com

President, Richard Ringle

Music Director, Patricia Gerdes

Vice President, Chris Pierce

Assistant Music Director, Kristina Paulick

PR and Social Chair, Marie Petersen

Attendance Officer, Andre Bunton

story:
Folks! Olá from São Paulo, Brazil, where I am working on my first album, an elektro-pop mix of some catchy tunes. In this process, I am creating/producing the first music video for my anthem song Shellfish that will be featured in my upcoming album (title to be decided!). And yes, you're right, I need your support!!

Always have been performing and writing music. Embarrassing yet humbling to look back at the old stuff and think, "Damn, is that really when it started?" Grew up as this weird band-Tupac kid who wanted to bridge the gaps between double-reed instruments and socio-political rap. And now? Found my voice/tunes within Elektro-hip-hop-pop. What does that even mean? I don't know...I am exploring it (; 

Basically, I am seeking some small-scale funding for video production and editing. These funds will go a very long way here and of course, whatever you can give (even a thumbs up!) is a huge step toward this awesome video that is on the verge of being produced!

With $600, I will be able to film the needed footage plus edit and market the music video. I like to think of this as recycling: what you put in will be transformed into an aesthetically-pleasing output. Plus there are some fun perks!

Find me on Facebook and give a "Like"if you enjoy the music! Or go to http://alexelkipling.wix.com/alexeliscu and check out some tunes! THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

Hey there! We're Electric Orchids: Matt Mitchell, Derek Hatch, Chris Hutchings, and Val Engholm.


We've been playing for you around the Kansas City metro for just about two years, and it's been amazing! We started in Matt and Val's living room, had a few member changes, a few sound changes, a few wardrobe changes, and here we are.


We want to bring you some great music to listen to, though. We have recordings, but we need the mixing and mastering, CD duplication, vinyl creation (you KNOW you want this on vinyl!), and promo loot for you like shirts, stickers, and such.


We need your help, though. We can't do it alone. We love music, and we know you do, too. Local music brings heart to our city, and supporting local music is important to keeping the spirit of the musical community alive.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we need:
  • Mixing and mastering of recordings.
  • CD duplication.
  • Vinyl creation.
  • Licensing for album cover art.
  • Merchandising (t-shirts, stickers, buttons... what kinds of merch do you guys want?).
  • Professional band photographs.
  • Funding for future recordings.
Perks? You bet!
  • Personal thank-note from the band.
  • Your name in the contributors section of the album notes.
  • An mp3 download of the album, Plastic Heart.
  • A copy of Plastic Heart on CD.
  • A copy of Plastic Heart on Vinyl.
  • A signed Electric Orchids photo.
  • A signed Electric Orchids t-shirt.
  • Electric Orchids stickers and buttons.

The Impact

This project is valuable for you and for us.

For us: We love making music, and we genuinely love the music we make. But making music is nothing if we can't share it with others. This project will give us a chance to share what we do with the world.

For you: By contributing to this campaign, you will have a chance to get independent music and art out into the community. Our music is independently written and recorded. Our cover art is from an independent artist, Kait Moon. Our merchandise will be locally sourced, and our band photos will be produced by a local independent photographer. You have a chance to support independent art in a time when such artists struggle to get their work our there.

Risks & Challenges

What if we don't meet our goal?

We will take the contributions we do get and honor your support by creating something special. Mixing and mastering take precedence over everything else. We have a priority list for doing what we can afford so that we can make the most of your contributions.
  1. Mixing and mastering
  2. CD duplication
  3. Vinyl production
  4. Merchandise
  5. Cover art licensing
  6. Photography

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you can't contribute. You can instead:

  • Share the crap out of this campaign!
  • Come to our shows (find us on Facebook!).
  • Stream us on Spotify and make us more visible.

Hey there! We're Electric Orchids: Matt Mitchell, Derek Hatch, Chris Hutchings, and Val Engholm.

We've been playing for you around the Kansas City metro for just about two years, and it's been amazing! We started in Matt and Val's living room, had a few member changes, a few sound changes, a few wardrobe changes, and here we are.

We want to bring you some great music to listen to, though. We have recordings, but we need the mixing and mastering, CD duplication, vinyl creation (you KNOW you want this on vinyl!), and promo loot for you like shirts, stickers, and such.

We need your help, though. We can't do it alone. We love music, and we know you do, too. Local music brings heart to our city, and supporting local music is important to keeping the spirit of the musical community alive.   What We Need & What You Get
 
Here's what we need:


Mixing and mastering of recordings.
CD duplication.
Vinyl creation.
Licensing for album cover art.
Merchandising (t-shirts, stickers, buttons... what kinds of merch do you guys want?).
Professional band photographs.
Funding for future recordings.

Perks? You bet!


Personal thank-note from the band.
Your name in the contributors section of the album notes.
An mp3 download of the album, Plastic Heart.

A copy of Plastic Heart on CD.

A copy of Plastic Heart on Vinyl.
A signed Electric Orchids photo.
A signed Electric Orchids t-shirt.
Electric Orchids stickers and buttons.
   The Impact
 
This project is valuable for you and for us.

For us: We love making music, and we genuinely love the music we make. But making music is nothing if we can't share it with others. This project will give us a chance to share what we do with the world.

For you: By contributing to this campaign, you will have a chance to get independent music and art out into the community. Our music is independently written and recorded. Our cover art is from an independent artist, Kait Moon. Our merchandise will be locally sourced, and our band photos will be produced by a local independent photographer. You have a chance to support independent art in a time when such artists struggle to get their work our there.   Risks & Challenges
 
What if we don't meet our goal?

We will take the contributions we do get and honor your support by creating something special. Mixing and mastering take precedence over everything else. We have a priority list for doing what we can afford so that we can make the most of your contributions.

Mixing and mastering
CD duplication
Vinyl production
Merchandise
Cover art licensing
Photography
   Other Ways You Can Help It's okay if you can't contribute. You can instead:

Share the crap out of this campaign!
Come to our shows (find us on Facebook!).
Stream us on Spotify and make us more visible.

story:
Help Grace Moon & the Jaguar raise £ 3,000 in funding for a "modern time classic" and be part of a top-secret high priority mission: To record and release our vintage spy pop EP and conquer the world of music! 

Mission updates via Twitter & Instagram: #GMJmission

Join Us on Our Top Secret High Priority Mission!

Do you want to join us on a top-secret, high priority mission?

Grace Moon & the Jaguar have been chosen by “M” and the Russian spy Mr. Vladnikov to complete a top secret and high priority mission. But we can’t do it alone.

Who We Are

Grace Moon and The Jaguar are a London based singer/songwriter, producer duo who have the complete package to achieve international success. They were formed when Norwegian/Danish singer/songwriter Sofie Eikelyn met French producer JB Pilon whilst she was searching for a studio to produce one of her songs for a Hollywood movie. Both artists are credited with creating a unique sound which they describe as Vintage Spy Pop with a cool, sophisticated and modern aesthetic. If Ian Fleming had heard them play he might have described Grace Moon & The Jaguar as the perfect accompaniment to a vodka martini, but unlike James Bond’s favourite tipple, Grace Moon and The Jaguar will leave you shaken and certainly stirred.

What We Need

We have analysed all the parameters and we have come to the conclusion that we need the following to succeed with the mission:

· Write 4 amazing tunes with “modern classics” and serious hit potential

· A secret vintage head quarter with all necessary instruments and equipment (Wax Recording Studio)

· The Money Penny string quartet

· The invincible horn players

· The drum killer Paul Winterhart (drummer of legendary Kula Shaker)

· Sammy the French top agent who is mean on bass

· Marimba & harmonium

· Mean arrangements & guitar from the Jaguar

· Killer vocals, piano & lyrics from Ms. Grace Moon.

· £ 3,000


Our Own Investment

We have invested in all the necessary gear, equipment and musicians to make sure this top-secret mission succeeds.

We have wrenched our hearts and souls and worked days and nights to write and compose 4 of our finest and most spectacular tunes:

  Jungle

  Honey

  Why

  Fooling

We have also been lucky enough to have some of London’s best musicians join us on our mission and we know with their help we can make it all happen.

But we now need your help too secure the mission’s success.

We have already spent more than £ 7,000 of our own money and now we only need £ 3,000 worth of funding to complete the mission.


Cost Break Down

Total Remaining Costs: £ 3,000

  • Session musicians & additional studio time : £2,000
  • Music Video for our song: “Jungle”: £500
  • Photos & Artwork: £200
  • Mastering the EP: £300

What if we raise more than the goal?

If we surpass the goal we will consult all of our backers to talk about another music video and our tour in the UK and France. This way you will be able to give your input on what the rest of the money should be spent on. 


More About Grace Moon & the Jaguar

Sofie Eikelyn (Grace Moon) has been writing songs and composing music since the age of 11. She describes her musical influences as greats Nina Simone, Edith Piaf, Ella Fitzgerald, and Johnny Cash to innovators Nick Cave and The Bad Seeds. She developed a piano technique, mixing classical and 60s pop with a twist of jazz that you can hear on several of their tracks. Sofie, a former model and art aficionado has a wonderful aesthetic sensibility that she has used to influence the imagery that softly envelopes Grace Moon and The Jaguar.

JB Pilon (The Jaguar) is a French producer and multi instrumentalist who also co runs one of East London's most hyped recording studios where he has worked with cutting edge independent acts as well as more established artists. He has composed TV commercial soundtracks for Audi, Revlon as well as a number of other top brands and has made it into the Guinness Book of Records for having performed and recorded the World’s Highest Gig at 6500 meters in the Himalayas, raising money for charity. He has an unshakeable character and a distinctive sensibility - a maestro of the epic and conductor of the musical stories of youthful freedom.

Follow this mission on Instagram & Twitter: #GMJmission


Find us Here

  • Facebook
  • Twitter #GMJmission
  • Instagram #GMJmission
  • Youtube
    • Sign up to our newsletter
  • Live Shows

If you have any questions, comments or if you would just like to say hello, we would love to hear from you:

Drop us a line on info@gracemoonandthejaguar.com

We are really very friendly and promise not to bite!

Thank You!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR TAKING THE TIME TO STOP BY AND FOR TAKING PART IN THIS PROJECT – YOU ARE AWESOME.

WE REALLY APPRECIATE IT!

story:
Humons is the musical project of Detroit’s Ardalan Sedghi. 

For the last year, I've been working on making new music. Out of many tracks, I'm hoping to produce & release 5 of my favorites as my next EP. I'm excited to work with Jon Zott to finish out the tracks and get them in tip-top shape for your ears, brain and feet. Jon is a talented producer who has recently worked with JR JR & Tunde Olaniran. 

Listen to Jon's work here: https://soundcloud.com/jonzott
Listen to Humons here: https://soundcloud.com/humons 

The money I'm raising will go 100% to other artists helping to make this happen. $2,000 for production costs and  $500 for the design of all artwork that will be associated with the release.

Thank you so much for your support <3

story:
Dear Friend, I ask You to support for my educational campaign for cardiac patients and their families. We all know how those people (including patients after myocardial infarction) desperately need knowledge and support in order to come back to life and avoid needless suffering, anxiety, depression or stress. We know that not only stents and drugs save their lives - what is crucial for them is remodelling of previous life, changing not only behaviors but also way of thinking. 

But I say patients' education and You read about music?  Well, that's the trick! 

The name of my campaign right now is “Doctor Stent - music for heart”. Since 2010 I have spent plenty of time on psychoeducational activities for patients after myocardial infarction and their families. All begun as “Handbook far cardiac patients” - small book, then transformed into e-book and then audio-book. All was put on tablet and was called “e-pill” and was convenient way for our patients to learn in hospital. Pararely I worked on website called “life after heart attack” (www.zyciepozawale.pl). In 2014 I created first worldwide comics for cardiac patients “Captain Stent – Heartland Ranger – what happened to You during myocardial infarction” and board game “Heart-game” as well as smartphone application and educational film. All these products are meant to be support for patients in transforming their lives towards better health. And all of them are marked by my alter-ego, icon Doctor Stent. Till now all those projects were done by me without any financial support. But as I want to go further and make them available worldwide I decided in 2014 I to start a band “Doctor Stent & Muzyczna Manufaktura”  with Paweł Romek. I wrote songs and music and Paweł made arrangements for songs and we recorded some songs together in studio. The title of CD is “Pop-whispers” and leading song is called „Ballad about Captain Stent”. Our idea is to become another “doctors’ ” band which makes music for health promotion and motivates people for changing their lives and inspires them for better. And we believe that offering that CD on-line as a gift for donotion for our goal – psychoeducation of cardiac patients worldwide - would help us to go many steps ahead.

Right now we would like to ask you for help us to make our videoclip and CD done. Our dream is to make it as professional as possible including support of professional actors, singers and musicians. If it finds its way to cardiac patients worldwide, it will become trace-horse for our further actions of icon Doctor Stent. 

The money we need will be spent on professional artists (we want hire some local stars), studio and production. 

You may find some songs' samples and CD cover project in extras!

Thank You in advance - Ralph Sztembis, Doctor Stent

story:
Opera has been a fundamental part of my life from the very beginning. Even as a baby, before I could talk, I was devoted to opera, and it had me completely captivated. Mesmerized. Enthralled. Enraptured. Words simply could not express the incredible beauty and the powerful impact of perceiving so many different emotions at the same time, and to such a dramatic and intense degree. They still can’t. Simply put, opera is more than just a passion for me; it’s in my blood, and I need it just as much as anyone needs food, air, or water.

For more than two decades, I dreamed of nothing more than to be a conductor, where I would be able to share my profound love and adoration for opera with others, and to be in a position where I could inspire each of them to perform at their highest and most complete level. My dream finally became realized in 2013, when I began my involvement with Verismo Opera, a community opera theater based in Vallejo, California, that provides wonderful opportunities for aspiring vocalists and conductors to hone their skills as they pursue professional careers at the major opera companies. While studying cello at the San Francisco Conservatory of Music, I was very privileged to conduct fully-staged productions of La Traviata, Rigoletto, Carmen, and La Boheme at Verismo, and it is with enormous anticipation that I look forward to conducting their upcoming production of Faust this summer. 

What has made my experiences at Verismo so heartwarming is hearing and seeing the enthusiastic responses from those who regularly attend their performances. It helps me recognize just how cherished and valued opera continues to be in the general community.

However, it has also made me acutely aware of how urgent it is to produce solutions for defraying the rising costs that are encountering Verismo's future productions.

Specifically, Verismo has major gaps in two critical areas:

1)  the need for additional orchestral musicians to fully serve the composition's musical demands; and

2)  the need for additional rehearsals with the orchestra well before opening night.

Verismo’s limited budget has precluded us from being able to meet these challenges. This is despite principal singers, chorus members, and conductors such as myself electing to perform on a volunteer basis. And with rehearsals scheduled to begin in July for our upcoming production of Faust in August, we have an imminent priority to secure funding that would cover both of these necessities in time.

I reach out to you in the sincere hope that you could kindly make a donation to Verismo as it enters its Summer 2015 Season. Generous people such as yourself will help Verismo bring greater depth to its performances as it continues to serve as a springboard for future soloists setting their sights on the professional world of opera.  

Thank you so much for your consideration.

story:
Hello!

My name is Katie Overbeek. I'm a 30 year old wife and mom who lives in Alliston, about an hour north of Toronto.  I’m married to Josh and we have a beautiful (and very busy) toddler called Joseph.  We go to Anchor Point Church where we both lead worship and oversee the larger worship team there. 

I'm a classically trained pianist and vocalist and have a degree in piano performance, but it’s music for the church that has captured my heart. I was 19 when I began leading worship, and I started writing my own songs not long after. 

Several years ago I was able to record an EP of some of my really early songs, and I’ve had the chance to contribute to several collaborative projects since then; but the picture has felt incomplete.  I’ve always felt that at some point there would be another, bigger step to take—it was just a case of timing. 

This campaign comes at a critical point in my journey.  Over the past year I have felt increasingly stirred to do something broader with my music, but the timing has just never felt right. With limited resources it's been hard to see the way forward.

Finally, after attending the powerful and inspiring 18 Inch Journey retreat under Jonathan and Melissa Helser (Bethel Music) this past May, I felt a bit like the sun broke through the clouds and I started to get a sense of what I should do next. And here we are! 

My family and I have said “yes” to this vision, but we need more people involved. We need a bigger, louder “yes” to surround us in it. I have the incredible opportunity to ask for YOU, friends from all over the world, to lift me up and help me see it through.  It is both humbling and completely amazing that I can even do that. 

THE DEETS

I am looking to raise $27,000 CDN (around $21,000 US or 13,500 pounds UK) in order to record a 7-9 song EP.  That number includes all production costs, distribution, and commissioning artwork and design.  

My friend David Kuwabara (The Royal Royal, Alexander Fairchild) has agreed to produce this EP.  Working with him would mean I could develop this project into something of exceptional world-class quality, involving some of the best hands and ears in the music industry.  I have worked with David in the past and completely trust him as the head visionary for this project.  

Having this record produced in the States does mean that the price tag grows by several thousand dollars as it crosses the border, thanks to the miserable state of the Canadian dollar.  However, I still feel that working with David is the right choice as we already have experience in working together on a project like this.  I know we would not hit any unnecessary speed bumps during the creative process.

I have a series of unique perks for those willing to donate, including jewelry from Jessica Wolf, original photography from Sarah Studios, and - my personal favourite - curated "treasure boxes" containing a handful of beautiful things both vintage and modern, picked by me and tailored to your taste.  Some of these gifts are limited in number and may run out quickly, but everyone who donates beyond $50 after the other gifts run out will be guaranteed 2 physical copies of the album (instead of 1 copy plus the gift). 


The Broader Impact

These songs are statements of faith I have made over my own life through seasons of challenge, loss, and deep uncertainty.  Now I feel I’m supposed to make those statements over others.  They are songs for congregations and for living rooms. They are for the hidden places of your life, written from the hidden places of mine. 

In the bigger picture I see this project as being a launchpad into the next 5 or 10 years, not just for me but for the community that is surrounding me at Anchor Point Church.  I feel that this project would represent new territory for all of us and provide incredible networking opportunities for others besides myself.  

It’s more than just a project.  It’s a doorway through which I believe others will follow.   And THAT is exciting!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, please consider simply spreading the word! From years of being a self-employed businesswoman (running a private music studio) I have learned firsthand that word of mouth is probably the most powerful and effective way to build a support base.  Expressing your support is equally as powerful as donating. 

Remember, you can easily use Indiegogo’s share buttons to send this page out to various social media outlets! 


Thank you so much for considering to support me - it is no small thing and I appreciate it so much!

 These songs are statements of faith I have made over my own life through seasons of challenge, loss, and deep uncertainty.  Now I feel I’m supposed to make those statements over others.  They are songs for congregations and for living rooms. They are for the hidden places of your life, written from the hidden places of mine. 
In the bigger picture I see this project as being a launchpad into the next 5 or 10 years, not just for me but for the community that is surrounding me at Anchor Point Church.  I feel that this project would represent new territory for all of us and provide incredible networking opportunities for others besides myself.  
It’s more than just a project.  It’s a doorway through which I believe others will follow.   And THAT is exciting!

Other Ways You Can Help
 If you can’t contribute financially, please consider simply spreading the word! From years of being a self-employed businesswoman (running a private music studio) I have learned firsthand that word of mouth is probably the most powerful and effective way to build a support base.  Expressing your support is equally as powerful as donating. 
Remember, you can easily use Indiegogo’s share buttons to send this page out to various social media outlets! 

Thank you so much for considering to support me - it is no small thing and I appreciate it so much!

story:
Hello and Welcome!

 My name is Will Johns...

  • I'm a singer, songwriter and blues guitarist from the UK and am independently recording my 3rd studio album. I was born into a musical family. My late father was the legendary producer Andy Johns who worked on Free, Led Zep, Clapton and The Rolling Stones to name a few. 'Uncle Glyn' Johns is also a world renowned Producer.(Eagles,The Who)
    I started playing guitar at 15 and recieved huge encouragement from my uncle Eric Clapton, I remember my other uncle Mick Fleetwood used to keep us in line as kids, threatening us with 'The High Jump'!  
    Surrounded by such great influences I would say it was only natural that I became a musician myself.  It was either that or become a pro fisherman which is my other passion - I am actually The All England Squid Fishing Champion 2014!
  •  I've been nominated 3 times in the British Blues Awards and have recently toured the UK, Russia and the Crimea. Next year I'll be in Europe and the Czech Republic.  
  • I also perform in 'Fresh Cream' with Malcolm Bruce and Chris Page and am looking forward to touring with them later in 2016 when we celebrate 50 years of CREAM's music! 
  • I'm well on the way to finishing my third solo album 'Something Old, Something New..'  and I would really appreciate your help to raise the funds to cover the costs of finishing recording, mixing and releasing my creation in early spring of 2016. It would mean the world to me to achieve this goal and be able to share my latest work.
  • By contributing to this project you will be helping me to bring my music to a much larger audience. The song 'Last Page' from the album has already received airplay on radio stations across the world and the feedback and interest has been brilliant!  You can check out the video here : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3FTpejoFPuY
  • A  UK tour is planned for March & April to promote the Album and a release party in Richmond, Surrey at The Crawdaddy Club will be a truly amazing  event with YOUR help!
  •  So there you go, it sounds fantastic and a lot of it is, but it has been a long and  hard road and there are reasons why I play the Blues for you. Ask me some day!

What We Need...  

  • I require £2,500 to complete the release of the Album with PR and Manufacture.
  •  Recording Costs         8hr @ £32 =£256 + Engineer £80 = £336
  • Mixing & Mastering Costs    £75 per Song x 10 = £750
  • Manufacturing CDs                £300 
  • Promotional Items (T Shirts, Posters, Badges) £200
  • Press & Relations Campaign  £1,000 

  •  What You Get..

    I'm really excited to be able to offer some great perks!
    A free MP3 of my new original song 'BLUES POLICE' emailed to you immediately as a THANK YOU for your contribution.
    Limited Edition CD, signed, sealed and delivered.
    CD, T Shirt, Poster and Badge Bundles.
    Attend a recording session in a Brighton studio and have your photo taken.
    Personalised handwritten lyric sheets.
    Appear in a music video.
    Executive Producer Credits.
    Exclusive in-house concerts.
    Fishing adventures.
    and more........ 

    Should we not reach our entire Goal, all funds raised through this will contribute to the costs described as best as possible with the completion and release of the album being the highest priority. "Something Old, Something New" WILL happen! 

The Impact..

  •  In this age of downloads, devices and instant gratification, this collection of music is a mix of old and new, self penned and collaborative work and also some really classy cover material. All the songs have meaning and depth for all listeners to appreciate and take with them on their life's journey. This album is also about proving that British Blues is alive, strong and undergoing a real revival and about bringing the Blues genre to new ears!  
  • My previous Releases have both contained tracks nominated in The British Blues Awards in the 'Best Original Blues Song' category. It would be amazing to be nominated again! With your support we can achieve some great things with this release.

Other Ways You Can Help...

We realise that some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't still help to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, You can use the Indiegogo share tools which will work on Facebook and Twitter! Any and all help is gratefully appreciated.  Many thanks for helping "Something Old, Something New" on it's way - it's great to have you onboard!

 Will & Team.

story:
Short Summary

We are The Ramble! We're an all original, six piece American Blues & Soul band from Brooklyn, NY. We have a passion for vintage soul, blues & country and feel that the current music industry needs more of it. The Ramble has been writing together for the last 5 months, and its finally time to hit the studio! But we need your help! We have been able to take it this far on our own, but we cannot fund this album by ourselves. We need to raise $4,000 to complete the record. Most bands ask for upwards of $20,000 for an album, but we have some really talented friends that are helping us do this on a budget.

The Ramble is:

Michael Slowey: Lead Vocals/Guitar                                                                                 Justin Richey: Lead Guitar/Vocals                                                                                 Sean Richey: Lead Guitar/Vocals                                                                                 Devon Yesberger: Organ                                                                                                    Kyle Miles: Bass                                                                                                                 Pablo Eluchans: Drums

What We Need & What You Get

As artists we understand the importance of honesty and transparency. That's why we are going to tell you exactly where your contributions are going.

1. Studio Time/Tracking: $1,150

2. Mixing: $600

3. Mastering: $500

4. Manufacturing: $597

5. Merchandise & Shipping: $953

6. Overhead: $200 (IndieGogo takes 5% of what we raise)

Total: $4,000

What You Get:
We have some awesome prizes available for donors! Free autographed albums, Digital Downloads, T-shirts, Posters, Pins, Customized Jackets, Private Shows, and VIP Passes!

*If we don't reach our goal of $4,000, we will go as far as the money takes us. For those who contribute, we still want to have something to give back.

The Impact

Honestly, you will be helping us make our dreams come true! You will also be a vital  part of what we are creating. 

Risks & Challenges

Of course the number one risk is failure. But we are not phased by the possibility of failure. As artists we deal with this aspect every day, and we know you can relate. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know money is tight. That's why we're asking for it! If you cannot contribute, the best thing you can do to help us is share. Share our campaign with your friends, family and anyone else you think might be interested or able to help. Most importantly share, share, share on social media!

story:
Introduction:

Hello, my name is Lawrence Park and I am here to invite you to join the creation of my first 5 song EP - through this Indiegogo Campaign

I am a singer / songwriter currently located in San Diego, CA.  And my passion and love for singing really took off when I met my vocal coach Ken Anderson, who is a Gospel Choir Professor.  And My sound is very much influenced by him and his gospel roots as he has been mentoring me since 2010.

And I just want to highlight a quick little story about him. When I was going through a really rough time, he would call me every single morning...for over a year... once again... every single morning for over a whole year... to uplift me, encourage me, motivate me and really be that one person that did not only truly believe in me, but more importantly... someone that just loved me for who I was.  

What Lawrence Wants To Do With His Original Music:

And that is what I want to do with my Original music.  I want to uplift, I want to encourage, I want to motivate and I want to love people through the music I create and write.  So Wouldn't it be awesome if you were part of that?  

When you go through rough times, and the inconvenient truth is that... you will... I want my music to be an option or an avenue where you can cope, recover and really feel that somebody understands your pain that you're going through.  And that there is light at the end of the tunnel and that things are eventually going to be ok.

And on the flip side, if you are feeling good, I want my music to help you keep it that way.

What YOU Can Get Out Of Supporting Lawrence (look to the right): ------->

But there is only so much I can do on my own.  That is why I am letting you know that ALL funds will go directly to the production of the EP in a professional music studio.  So Please help support the funding of my new EP and in return you can receive one of these fun rewards displayed on the right of your screen.  If you can't find it in your means to give... its all good... just do me a favor and share this link on your social media platforms... But if you can give anything at all, please do... Because even $5 can make a huge difference in reaching my goal.  

Thank You For Being A Part Of The Team #TeamLP #LawrenceParkMusic

So Thank you for taking your time to watch this short clip.  It is really important and special for me in being able to complete this EP in a beautiful and collective way.  And I really hope you join in on the creation to help uplift, motivate, encourage and just love on people.  Thank you.

story:
My Grand Adventure.


One day right after I quit my job to work on music full time, I sat down to meditate. I had meditated before but this time I meditated and then I prayed and it felt so good. I did that for 2 months for a couple hours each day. And I did it for no reason but that it felt good. Cleansing. 

But I did not know what prayer was for really. I know it was good. But sometimes something good for you is not meant to be done with the intensity with which I did it. But the main thing I learned is that prayer is for the healing of the mind. So things happened, some good, some not so good and more good.

And one of those good things are the songs I have written!


My grand adventure is all about letting go of my inhibitions and living an extraordinary life. I have been given this opportunity through these songs that I have written because I cannot imagine not recording and singing them! Meaning, I am compelled to share. 

As a piano player I played because it was just what I did. I wrote music. And that is what I did. 

But these songs which I've written, they seem to need to be sung. And as I am working on them I really enjoy it and the time it takes because I am realizing that all of life is really about enjoying what's placed in front of us, a grand adventure. And now, after experiencing things which may not have been the best for me at the time, an adventure is all I can imagine life to be because if it is not an adventure then what is it?


And right now anything other than a joyful adventurous life is what I am releasing! You see my inhibitions have kept me back from living life fully and I refuse to let that continue to rule me. Is it difficult letting go? Well yes! Letting go is not that easy. So I just take it one day at a time. I know all will be done in God's time. 

What's God's timing mean to me? 

Divine timing. The present. The now moment. 

And how do I work on releasing my inhibitions? 

By saying, All there is is love, and steeping myself in calmness, peace and silence and wham there it is, freedom!


This is my big adventure! 

 

My Backstory

I’ve been playing the piano since I was 9 years old.
And now, all of a sudden, I don’t want to play it as much. Not for any particular reason. But the truth is I always really wanted to play the guitar. When I was very young, my two older sisters had guitar lessons. And I thought that when I was old enough, I would have them too. But just when I thought I would start, the guitar teacher moved away. So instead, I started taking piano lessons with another teacher, Mr. Charles, on the third floor of Charles Music Studio in Brooklyn, NY.


So I continued to play the piano. I studied music at the University of New Mexico in Albuquerque, because I could not think of anything else I wanted to do. I got a degree in Music Theory and Composition and I’m a pretty good composer. I even won our senior year composition contest, and I was pretty happy about that. Eventually, I produced 3 solo piano CDs generating good reviews. I wanted to release others, but between my job (I worked at a record company in Universal City), and my social life, I just never got around to making any more.


Currently . . .

Fast forward to now – I’m playing the guitar.   


I am a musician with a new and different vision for myself! My vision is to record 12 to 15 of the songs I have written over the past 2 or more years. The difference is these are singer/songwriter tunes written for guitar with vocals – me! This will be the first time that I will release an album with me as a singer. I am both exhilarated and apprehensive, but mostly living on trust and faith that my dream will come true. 


Recently, I've written over 25 songs for guitar and voice – 12 are completely the way I like them and I am working on three more to include in my album entitled, Everyone Is the Light! These songs are inspirational and heart opening. 

Singing and playing the guitar has been fun, rewarding, and just really cool! And I'd like to share these songs with everyone. But right now it’s a challenge for me to record them. And that’s because to do a great and professional job and to produce a quality album will take some time and lots of expense. 

With my three solo piano CDs, I did a lot of the upfront work in my home studio, which was fine. This time, however, I want a higher quality sound which leads  to greater listening pleasure for you, the audience. And I cannot do it on my own. This can best be achieved by inviting other professional musicians such as a drummer, bassist, and maybe another guitarist to accompany me in the studio. 


$25,000 will help with the following expenses:

  • Studio Time
  • Musician Fees
  • Record Mastering
  • Website Development & Social Media Management
  • Download Site Fees & Administration 
  • Launch Events
  • Performance Space
  • Perk Fulfillment
  • PR Announcements/Press Releases

Making Herstory  

So, I’ve organized this crowdfunding campaign to generate income to record, mix, and master these singer/songwriter tracks and I’m asking you to help me fund the project. As a thank-you for all contributions $10.00 and more, you will receive a download of my new album, Everyone Is the Light! and other perks listed for various contribution levels. Please add a perk if you'd like one – I will gladly send it to you! 


I’m going for the gusto!

I’m really excited about this and at the same time a bit nervous. But I know it will all turn out great – with your help and support, I will succeed. Won’t you please share your light with me and help me get my new album recorded? Please say YES!

Thank you so much from the bottom of my heart!

Visit my webpage for more info: www.FranciaMcNally.com.
